The Oppo F19 Pro Plus looks elegant, and the phone's build quality is solid, thanks to its polycarbonate body. The device packs four cameras on the rear embedded inside the rectangular camera module. It includes a 48MP primary camera, an 8MP ultra-wide-angle camera, a 2MP monochrome camera, and a 2MP macro camera. On the processing front, the device comes powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 800U MT6853V SoC coupled with 8GB of RAM. The phone comes loaded with a 4310mAh battery with 50W fast-charging support. The lack of a 90Hz refresh rate is certainly a turn-off. The phone is more camera focussed rather than on performance.

The Xiaomi's Redmi 12 series comes with a premium glass back and the device features a 90Hz display. The Redmi 12 also has an IP53 rating for water and dust resistance. The smartphone packs a 5,000mAh battery which can easily last throughout the day. The device is also promised to receive 2 years of Android software updates. If you are primarily looking for a smartphone under Rs 10,000 then the Redmi 12 is an excellent option. However, do note that the handset has only 4G support. If you are looking for 5G option, then you can go for Redmi 12 5G which can be purchased for as low as Rs 10,000 with some bank offers.

Oppo Reno 5 Pro is a 5G phone that costs you under Rs 40,000. It sports a Super AMOLED screen but only with 90Hz refresh rate. It uses the latest Dimensity 1000 Plus to offer 5G support, paired with 8GB RAM for heavy usage. You get 128GB storage onboard and the phone runs on Android 11 out of box. The cameras are versatile and capable of shooting in different angles. And the built-in battery supports 65W fast charging. However, the phone lacks a memory card slot, misses out on headphone jack and has heavy competition to tackle.

mobile_name: Samsung Galaxy M15 Prime Edition 6GB RAM

expert_view: Apple iPhone 12 Pro 128GB is an excellent offering from the brand and packs impressive features. The 6.1-inches OLED display with 457ppi pixel density accounts for a stunning visual experience. The device ships with triple camera setup (12MP+12MP+12MP), runs on Apple A14 Bionic Hexacore processor, and packs 2815mAh battery with 20W fast charging and also wireless charging. That being said, the lack of fingerprint sensor and an expandable memory option are certainly its drawbacks.
The OPPO A38 smartphone offers a compelling package with its attractive design, budget-friendly price, powerful chipset, and a 50MP dual rear camera. However, the phone lacks 5G connectivity.

The Google Pixel 4A comes with a 5.8-inch OLED display. The device is powered by Snapdragon 730 SoC. The smartphone features a 12MP dual-camera setup which takes some good images. The phone packs a 3000mAh battery. The battery life on the device is average. Additionally, the device supports 18W fast charging. If you are looking for a compact size phone with an OLED panel and excellent cameras, the Pixel 4A should be the ideal offering for you in Rs 30,000 price range.

Xiaomi Mi 10T gives you a flagship mobile experience without costing a bomb. The phone sports a display with 144Hz refresh rate. It comes powered by Snapdragon 865 chipset, offering 128GB storage on board. The rear cameras click photos in all conditions and with its big size battery, you get long backup as well as 33W fast charging support. Having said that, the storage is not expandable and it does not have a 3.5mm headphone jack either.
The Redmi K50i is a smartphone that looks like it costs peanuts but delivers when heavy games are thrown at it. It also has a fantastic battery life and okayish cameras.

Priced at under Rs 20,000, the Tecno Camon 20 Pro 5G is a value-for-money smartphone which an AMOLED display. The device has a 120Hz refresh rate and an FHD+ resolution. The smartphone is powered by Dimensity 8020 processor which handles all the multitasking with ease. The phone packs 8GB of RAM and offers 33W fast charging support. A 5,000mAh battery is equipped with the device which can last throughout the day on a single charge. If your budget is near Rs 20,000, you can buy the Tecno Camon 20 Pro as you get a good display, excellent hardware, and 5G support.

Oppo F19 Pro ranks as a mid-range phone but the features do not justify the higher price. Yes, it sports a Super AMOLED screen but lack of high refresh rate is hard to ignore. The use of Helio P95 chipset delivers average performance and even the battery size could have been bigger. The looks of the phone will catch your eye and the quad rear cameras offer decent images. Hard to recommend this one over many other devices in the market.

The Galaxy Z Flip 5 offers a brand-new way to interact with a smartphone, something that only a few smartphones can claim to do in 2023. Its camera processing is more refined than ever before, but it still carries the baggage of the past, such as slow charging.

Oppo A54 packs a modest set of features for its price in the market. The phone runs on Android 10 OS, powered by basic Helio P35 chipset with 4GB RAM that might not satisfy most users in the segment. The triple cameras get the job done in daylight, but the low light quality is average. You get long backup with the 5,000mAh battery that supports 18W fast charging. But the screen only offers HD+ resolution, lacks refresh rate support and faces hefty competition from other devices. Worth looking at other options in this price range.

The OnePlus 8T is a premium mid-ranger from the company. It does pack exciting features such as a 120 Hz screen refresh rate and Warp 65W fast charging support. The device runs Oxygen 11 OS that accounts for an excellent smartphone experience. The phone is let down by average camera performance, and it also does not support wireless charging. The pricing is slightly on the expensive front; there are other available alternatives such as Samsung S20FE and Xiaomi Mi 10T Pro at a lesser price.

The OPPO A17 is a mid-range device by OPPO. The handset has a 6.56-inch IPS LCD display which offers HD+ resolution. The display doesn't have any gorilla glass protection. The device is equipped with an Helio G35 processor which offers average performance. The smartphone lacks fast charging support. If you are looking to buy a new smartphone in the Rs 12,499 price range, the competition is offering much better specifications and features at a similar price point.

if the UI design and the lower resolution display isn't an issue for you, the Oppo A3s is a good smartphone. However, for the same price, you can get the Redmi Note 5, which offers even more features and it performs even better.
There is no doubt that iPhone X is the most feature-packed and the best performing smartphone of its age. However, its high pricing and the notch diverts people from buying it.

The POCO X4 Pro 5G comes with a 6.67-inch AMOLED display that has Full HD+ resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate. The Snapdragon 695 SoC equipped with the device offers flawless performance. The handset supports 67W fast charging. The smartphone features a 64MP camera which takes some decent images. Additionally, the handset has 5G support. If you are looking for an AMOLED display device with excellent performance, 67W fast charging, and 5G, then the Poco X4 Pro 5G is the device you can consider buying.

The Tecno Spark 20 features a 6.6-inch IPS LCD screen with a 90Hz refresh rate, providing an acceptable viewing experience. Powered by the MediaTek Helio G85 SoC, it delivers moderately good performance. Tasks such as calling, texting, scrolling, browsing social media, and opening multiple apps can be done without lag. Casual gaming runs smoothly on this phone. But it struggles with more demanding games. The phone's cameras include a 50MP primary camera and a 0.08MP secondary camera on the back. The front camera is 32MP for selfies. The image quality is acceptable in daylight, but low-light pictures suffer from excessive noise. The Tecno Spark 20 is equipped with a 5000mAh battery that supports 18W charging, offering good battery life that can last an entire day without needing to be recharged. The Tecno Spark 20 provides an acceptable display, average performance, and reliable battery life.

Realme Narzo 20 features a big screen with full HD+ display resolution and with Corning Gorilla Glass protection. It runs on the octa-core MediaTek Helio G80 chipset that offers decent performance for the price and powered by Realme UI based on Android 10 platform. You have quad rear cameras that clicks good images and the 6,000mAh battery will last you for longer than a day with ease.

Samsung Galaxy A52s 5G comes with a 6.5-inch AMOLED display. The device performance is handled by a Snapdragon 750G SoC. The device can take some good images, thanks to a 64MP quad-camera setup. The phone however only offers 15W fast charging. Additionally, the device is costlier. In less than Rs 35,000 price point, the OnePlus Nord 2 and the Realme GT Master Edition 5G offer some excellent specs when compared to the Galaxy A52s 5G.

The iQOO 11 5G is yet another interesting flagship smartphone from the brand that comes loaded with a host of exciting features and flagship-grade specifications. The model is meant for those who love gaming and want a premium smartphone with the best features.

The Oppo A5 2020 is an ideal option for casual users. The phone offers good specifications like Quad-rear cameras, excellent battery life, and a standard processor. Also, Dolby Atmos Dual stereo speakers offering 360 degrees immersive sound is a positive outcome.  However, the device is an avoidable option if you like to play high-end games.

Realme 8 is the latest addition to the mid-range segment. This phone gets a Super AMOLED screen, powered by Helio G95 chipset and runs on Android 11 OS. It features a 64MP quad camera at the back and the overall design makes it easy to use with one hand. You get long backup with the built-in battery that supports 30W fast charging. However, the screen lacks high refresh rate support and this variant comes with 4GB RAM only.

The Samsung Galaxy M52 5G sports a 6.7-inch AMOLED display with Full HD+ resolution. The device offers excellent performance thanks to Snapdragon 750G SoC and 6GB of RAM. The smartphone features a 64MP triple-camera setup. The phone is heavier in weight as it weighs around 199 grams. The device packs a 5000mAh battery that has 25W fast charging support. The smartphone has a plastic back panel. The device lacks a 3.5mm audio jack. If the plastic back panel and heavy weight don't bother you, the Galaxy M52 5G is the best device you should consider buying in the Rs 25,000 price range.

The iPhone SE 2022 comes with a 4.7-inch IPS LCD display which has HD resolution and a 60Hz refresh rate. Thanks to the A15 Bionic chipset and 4GB of RAM, the device offers lag-free performance. The device features a 12MP rear and 7MP front camera. The handset however retains the same old design and has Touch ID. The new iPhone SE gets 5G support and it runs iOS 15 software version. If you are in search of a compact phone with 5G support and decent hardware, then iPhone SE 2022 can be a good option.

The Samsung Galaxy A23 is a 4G device from Samsung priced at under Rs 20,000 in India. The device has a 6.6-inch Full HD+ display which supports a 60Hz refresh rate. The device is powered by Snapdragon 680 SoC, which offers decent performance. The smartphone runs Android 12 out of the box and packs a 5,000mAh battery. The device has 25W fast charging support. However, Samsung is bundling only 15W fast charger in the box. If your priority is hardware, good battery life, and cameras, you can go for the A23. However, do note that you will have to compromise on display quality and 5G support.

The Redmi Note 11 Pro is a 5G device by Xiaomi priced at Rs 17,999 in India. The device flaunts a 6.67-inch AMOLED display that has Full HD+ resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate. Thanks to Snapdragon 695 SoC, the device offers decent performance. The handset supports 67W fast charging and offers long-lasting battery life. The device also has 5G support. In the Rs 17,999 price range, the Redmi Note 11 Pro is a value for money smartphone, considering that you are getting an AMOLED display, Snapdragon 695 SoC, fast charging, and 5G support.

The vivo Y56 is yet another interesting smartphone from vivo. The handset comes loaded with a premium design language and offers a good mix of features and specifications. The 5G device can handle most of the tasks, thanks to the MediaTek Dimensity 700 processor. It also boasts decent cameras, though the ultra-wide-angle lens is missing in this. Overall, if you are looking for a decent smartphone, then you can consider this device.
The OPPO F17 manages to offer all the best features that you'd expect from a smartphone of its price. With the sleek design and great camera features, the OPPO F17 fully justifies its price.

Vivo V23 again focuses on selfie lovers by offering dual 50MP and 8MP wide cameras. It comes powered by MediaTek Dimensity 920 chipset with 8GB RAM. The storage is not expandable, the AMOLED display only gets 90Hz refresh rate support for the price. And the battery life is average. Buy only if you love taking plenty of selfies.

Apple iPhone 13 Mini gives you more of the same with its size, features and cameras. The new A15 Bionic chipset improves performance, the battery life is better thanks to iOS 15 and the OLED display is still as good as any in the market. However, the screen lacks high refresh rate support, the phone comes without headphone jack and memory card slot. And the 20W fast charging at this price is not good. Worth buying if you need a compact and latest iPhone model.

Vivo V23e 5G is mostly a selfie-focused phone. The device gets an AMOLED display on a lightweight body so that you can hold it easily. Its 44MP selfie camera is the main highlight that works in all conditions, even in low light. The hardware for the price takes a hit because of that even though it supports 5G. The storage slot is expandable only if you don't use the second SIM. The battery life is also average. Buy only if you love taking a lot of selfies.

The Realme 10 Pro builds on its predecessor by bringing in a new design, display size, Android version, RAM options, stereo speakers and an overhyped camera sensor. Bloatware and 33W charging hold it back.

mobile_name: Xiaomi Redmi Note 13 Pro Plus 5G 12GB RAM

expert_view: The third-generation of Galaxy Z Fold 3 looks to appeal to more buyers with its price tag. It has the power, design and foldable form factor in its favour. The cameras do a reliable job for its purpose, and it can handle some level water splashes. However, the selfie camera is average, the storage is not expandable and the average battery life only gets 15W charging support for its price, which is not acceptable these days. Definitely worth buying if you want to own the foldable experience.

The Samsung Galaxy S23 FE sports a design similar to its older sibling, the Galaxy S23, and its extended cousin, the Galaxy A54. The stereo speakers are loud and provide a clear sound experience. The S23 FE features a 6.4-inch dynamic AMOLED display that produces sharp colours and maintains excellent indoor and outdoor brightness. The S23 FE boasts a 50MP primary camera, an 8MP telephoto camera, and a 12MP ultra-wide camera on the back. Daylight shots taken with the S23 FE are impressive and have good detail. For selfies, a 10MP front camera captures accurate images with consistent skin tones. In India, the Galaxy S23 FE is powered by the Exynos 2200 SoC rather than the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 1. The chipset handles multitasking and gaming well, though the back panel tends to get warm during extended gaming sessions. The Samsung Galaxy S23 FE has a 4500mAh battery and supports 25W fast charging, which is slow by 2023 standards. Therefore, if you're looking for a flagship-like smartphone without spending too much, the S23 FE is a solid choice.

The iQOO Z7 Pro debuts in India at an introductory price of Rs. 23,999. While it offers commendable features, such as a powerful chipset and impressive design, it falls short in camera quality and audio performance when compared to competitors like the Realme 11 Pro and Redmi Note 12 Pro.

cpu: Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 Accelerated Edition Octa core
expert_view: The POCO M6 Plus 5G offers a great FHD display, solid battery life, and a capable camera for under Rs 15,000. The large 6.79-inch screen is ideal for streaming, and the camera performs well in daylight. Its battery life and fast charging are additional perks. However, it has some downsides: the budget chipset struggles with multitasking, and the software can be cluttered with spam notifications. For a cleaner software experience, consider the Moto G64. For better optics and performance, the Vivo T3x and Realme Narzo 70x 5G are also good alternatives.

The OPPO Reno2 Z has a great set of cameras, and it looks uber stylish, but it leaves a lot to be desired when it comes to performance and software. The combination of a notch-less AMOLED screen, Dolby Atmos audio, and 3.5mm headphone jack offers immersive media consumption experience and the phone lasts long on a single charge. Heck, it even comes with 20W fast charger inside the box. We wish it had a faster processor and some form of water splash resistance.

The Samsung Galaxy M31 offers the best display, camera quality, software experience, and battery life in its segment. However, its super-slow performance is a huge letdown. The device feels so sluggish that at a point you don't care about the positive bits of the device; you just feel like throwing it away for its poor performance. In spite of many class-leading features, I'd suggest you go for Xiaomi or Realme smartphones in the segment, which may not offer features as good as that of the Galaxy M31 but they get your work done and offer tremendous reliability.

The Vivo V25 5G is a decent smartphone under Rs. 30,000 budget. The device offers great camera performance, good battery life, and a vivid 90Hz Full HD+ AMOLED display. However, Vivo could have offered a better chipset and dual speaker considering the price. There are tons of good options available in this segment, but if your priority is to get a good camera experience, you can consider this one.

The Reno 3 Pro gets the basics right with a brilliant display, good battery life, quality cameras and a first-of-its-kind Selfie setup. It might not lure in the ones looking for top-tier specs and buzz words like 90Hz and flagship gaming, but it is still a solid offering for anyone looking for an all rounder.

Samsung launched the Galaxy F22 with focus on the budget buyers in the market. It has matched the needs of users with a Super AMOLED display and 90Hz refresh rate at this price which is impressive. The phone comes powered by Helio G80 chipset that does well in this range. You get expandable storage, quad rear camera, massive battery for long backup as well. However, the screen features HD+ resolution, the battery makes the phone bulky and you only get 15W fast charging support. Buy it if you need a phone with long battery life, and decent cameras.

OPPO K10 sports a 90Hz display and it gets the Snapdragon 680 chipset with 6GB RAM for performance. The phone's 128GB storage is expandable up to 1TB. The main camera at the back does well, and the battery life is good, along with 33W fast charging support. Having said that, the phone misses out on AMOLED panel, comes with Android 11 even in 2022 and it's a basic 4G chipset. Worth considering if you need a phone for daily purpose, and not heavy usage.

The Infinix Note 30 5G impresses with its 108MP AI triple camera, 8GB RAM and 256GB storage, powerful 6080 6nm Dimensity processor, dual 5G SIM capabilities, immersive display, unique design, and fast charging. A compelling choice for tech enthusiasts.

Xiaomi Redmi Note 11 Pro Plus 5G offers decent value for the money you pay. It has a 120Hz AMOLED display, with Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection. It comes powered by Snapdragon 695 SoC which brings 5G support. The cameras at the back deliver quality, the battery life is good and you get it with 67W fast charging. However, the phone's on the heavier side, the front camera is average and the storage expansion comes at the cost of the second SIM. Worth buying.

The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5 plays to its strengths by not changing 90% of its hardware, software or design. The new chipset gives it more horsepower to tackle any app in any multitasking configuration. However, we wish Samsung worked on reducing the prominence of the flexible display's crease and upped the charging wattage.

The Infinix Zero 30 5G is a great mid-range smartphone with a fantastic design, bright AMOLED display, strong performance, and decent battery life. However, it has average low-light camera performance and limited Android updates.

Poco opts for a more lightweight approach with its Poco X5 Pro 5G, but the design is still dated. Overall, the device performs well in our daily usage, but we noticed some hiccups while gaming. The new 108-megapixel camera is a first for Poco in India and delivers good-quality images.

The Samsung Galaxy S20 offers the best of the smartphone industry. However, its mediocre battery backup lets it down. What is the use of a featured-pack smartphone when it can't last a whole day on a single charge? I'd suggest you go for the Galaxy S20 Ultra, which offers much better battery backup, or the iPhone 11 Pro, which has an edge over the S20 Plus in almost every criterion.

Xiaomi Mi 11 Lite NE 5G is one of the lightest phone in the market at 158 grams. It features a 90Hz AMOLED display that is bright and produces crisp colours. The performance from Snapdragon 778G is reliable, which translates into long battery backup as well. The cameras do a good job in most conditions, and 33W charging is handy. However, the screen only gets 90Hz refresh rate at this, and the size means you miss out on headphone jack and a dedicated card slot for storage. Definite option for buyers in the mid-range.

Moto G60 is an excellent addition to the competitive mid-range segment in India. The phone features a 120Hz refresh rate display, powered by the reliable Snapdragon 732G chipset with 6GB RAM for effective performance. The triple cameras do a good job in most conditions and even the selfie camera delivers. The built-in 6,000mAh battery offers long backup as well. However, the phone is on the heavier side and only gets a hybrid SIM slot. Definitely worth considering in this budget.

OnePlus 10T offers excellent value for money and you cannot go wrong with this one. Performance, display, battery, and cameras are some of the highlights of the 10T. OxygenOS is another cherry on the cake.

Xiaomi Redmi Note 9 Pro Max features a bright and large display, packs the Snapdragon 720G chipset, which is good for the price and comes with quality set of rear cameras. It also offers over a day's battery life with the 5,000mAh battery that charges in quick time with the support for 33W fast charging. However, at this price, the phone's screen does not support 90Hz refresh rate and MIUI software still has a lot of bloatware. Still, the phone is a decent bet for the mid-range segment.

The Vivo T1 Pro performs well while looking good. It comes with an HDR10+ certified display and a triple camera system. The tried and true Snapdragon 778G SoC has ample headroom in terms of performance. With a starting price of Rs. 23,999, the T1 Pro is a serious contender in the sub-Rs. 25,000 market.

Xiaomi Redmi Note 11 4G is another mid-range device vying for your attention. It gets an AMOLED display and reliable hardware for daily use. The compact design makes it usable for most people, the cameras are also good for the price and the battery life is adequate as well. Having 33W fast charging support is a big help. However, this variant only gets 4GB RAM and 64GB internal storage and the phone runs on Android 11-based MIUI version.

The Tecno Camon 20 Premier 5G impressed us with its geometric design, useful ultrawide sensor, and impressive display, but Its competitors, like iQOO Neo 7 and POCO F5, offer better features at lower prices.

Infinix Note 12 Turbo is the latest offering from Infinix that arrives with a 50MP rear camera setup, a massive 5000mAh battery, and the hardware performance of the smartphone is very great at this price segment. Though the features look decent, the phone doesn't have anything extraordinary to disrupt the price segment.

The iPhone 11 Pro Max is extremely expensive but its the best option for those who don't want to move out of the Apple/iPhone ecosystem. The 11 Pro Max finally gets night mode on its camera and a bundled fast charger which puts it on par with its rival Android flaghip devices. The processor is the best among mobile chipsets and while the battery has been improved, the iPhone still has a long way to go before it catches up with the battery life of Android phones.

The Motorola Razr 40 Ultra offers a significant improvement compared to its predecessor. The handset features a 6.9-inch pOLED display that has up to 165Hz refresh rate. The secondary display on the device is of 3.6-inches. It's also an AMOLED panel which can display notifications, weather alerts, calendar, and quick settings. Powering the smartphone under the hood there is a Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 SoC which is fast and powerful. The device features a 12MP dual-camera setup which takes some excellent photos. The smartphone however has slow wired and wireless charging support. Additionally, the device doesn't have a microSD card either. If you are primarily looking for a clamshell-like foldable phone with a good display, design, performance, and cameras, then the Motorola Razr 40 Ultra will get all things done.

The Oppo F23 5G offers standout features among mid-level smartphones, including 4 years of Android updates, 5 years of security updates, good battery life, performance due to its 6nm chip, and decent camera performance.
If you are looking for a smartphone under Rs. 25,000, I think there is no other smartphone as good as the Poco F1.

The iPhone 15 Plus offers similar upgrades as that of the iPhone 15. The device retains the same A16 Bionic chipset as last year's iPhone 14 Plus, which offers excellent performance. It runs the latest iOS 17 out of the box and will receive five years of OS updates. The handset now gets a 48MP camera which replaces the 12MP camera that has been on older iPhone models. Additionally, the device features a USC-C port. If you are looking for a smartphone with a good display, camera, and excellent hardware, then the iPhone 15 Plus is a compelling choice.

There is very little to say about OPPO A16 and for this price, its features do not match up with the competition is offering. The HD+ display, along with mid-tier hardware along with basic triple rear cameras mean you are better off skipping this one for good.

The Oppo F15's design makes it stand out and it's surely going to impress a lot of phone buyers. It doesn't have the best gaming credentials or cut-throat pricing of its online counterparts, but apart from that, the vibrant display, good battery life, and dependable camera setup surely make it a good buy for anyone who's looking for an everyday all-rounder.

The iQOO Z7s 5G is priced at Rs 18,999 in India. The handset features an AMOLED display with a 90Hz refresh rate support. The smartphone is powered by Snapdragon 695 SoC which can handle all the basic tasks. The phone also has 44W fast charging and a 5G connectivity support as well. However, do note that the device lacks an audio jack, and it doesn't support 4K video recording either. Overall, the iQOO Z7s 5G is a good phone considering that you get 44W fast charging, an AMOLED display, and 5G support. If you are looking for alternatives in the same price range, the Galaxy M34 5G or the newly introduced Realme Narzo 60 5G also are a good option.

The Vivo T1 44W is an interesting option to consider under this price segment. The smartphone comes with a decent design language and the AMOLED display looks good as well, though it misses on a higher refresh rate. The major highlight of the phone is the 44W fast charging support, which is a rarity in this price segment. The performance seems to be decent enough to handle most of the tasks you throw at it. That said, the Vivo T1 44W edition can be your next budget phone.

The Redmi Note 9 Pro offers everything that you would expect from a smartphone of its price. Well, except for a high refresh display. Although it makes up for that with a neat-looking center-mounted punch-hole. The Redmi Note 9 Pro is perfect for a wide majority of people, including gamers, movie buffs, and people who want a smartphone with a long battery backup.

At Rs. 12,999, the Moto G32 has some stiff competition from Realme, Samsung and Vivo. The 90Hz display paired with a 5,000mAh battery and stereo speakers can be attractive. It would have been good to see multiple variants of the device besides the 4GB RAM and 64GB storage variant.

Xiaomi Poco X3 gives you the best of features for a mid-range phone. The LCD display supports 120Hz refresh rate, the Snapdragon 732G gives powerful performance with 6GB RAM and then you have quad rear cameras. Also, the 6,000mAh battery offers long backup but also supports 33W fast charging. A must-buy for its price in the segment.

The Redmi Note 9 is one of the best all-rounder smartphones in its price. The phone has a sharp and bright display, adequate performance, excellent image quality from the front and rear cameras, latest connectivity options, a large battery pack, and one of the fastest charging speeds in its segment. This phone basically doesn't leave any feature to be desired, making it an ideal choice in the price segment.

The Realme 7 is certainly a good option at this price range when you take a look at its advantages. The camera performance is decent, as it clicks good and detailed pictures. It gives a good battery backup of more than a day on single charge. Overall, it is a good value for money device at this price point.

The Realme Narzo 60 5G features an AMOLED display with a 90Hz refresh rate. The device has a stylish design and a vegan leather back panel. An octa-core Dimensity 6020 SoC equipped with the handset can handle all demanding tasks with ease. The smartphone supports up to 33W fast charging. As per Realme, the handset can charge up to 50% in just 29 minutes. However, the phone lacks an ultra-wide sensor and the low-light camera performance on the device is average. If your budget is around Rs 20,000, the Realme Narzo 60 5G is a bang for buck, considering that the device offers 33W fast charging, 5G support, and an AMOLED display.

The OPPO Reno7 Pro is the premium smartphone by OPPO which offers an excellent design. The device boasts a 6.55-inch OLED display that has up to 90Hz refresh rate. Thanks to the 50MP triple-camera setup, the device can take some good images. Hardware-wise the performance is top-notch, considering that the device uses Dimensity 1200 chipset. The smartphone also has a 65W fast charging support. However, the handset lacks a 3.5mm audio jack and a microSD card slot. Overall, the Reno7 Pro is a good smartphone from OPPO that you can consider buying in the Rs 40,000 price range.

The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 has a fantastic display tailor-made for social media consumption, content creation, and a portable form factor. Its battery is nothing to write home about, and the camera is just fine.

Priced at around 20K in India, the Samsung Galaxy F34 5G offers an affordable package with AMOLED display and 120Hz refresh rate, plus a 6,000mAh battery. It outperforms rivals in benchmarks, and though charging is slower, strong software support ensures lasting usage. It's a solid purchase.

cpu: Snapdragon 7 Gen 1 Accelerated Edition Octa core
expert_view: The Honor 90 5G is a solid mid-range choice, boasting an excellent display and premium looks. Software support and low-light camera performance are drawbacks, but it offers good battery life and decent 66W charging. The Android 13 experience is favorable, and the chipset is reliable for everyday tasks.

The only thing that the POCO M2 Pro lacks is a display with a high refresh rate. The rest of the specifications of the device are the best in class. If you can compromise on a high refresh rate display, you can't get a better phone than the POCO M2 Pro in this price range. However, if you want a high refresh rate, go for the Realme 6 Pro.

The Poco X5 closely resembles the Poco X4 Pro in design, but it has some distinct features like a curved back panel. This phone is comfortable to hold thanks to its plastic back finish, which is matte rather than glossy, reducing fingerprint smudges. It boasts a 5000mAh battery and comes with a 33W charger. The rear camera setup includes a 48MP primary camera, an 8MP ultra-wide camera, and a 2MP macro camera. On the front, there's a 13MP selfie camera. While daylight shots are good, they lack details and sharpness. In contrast, the selfie camera produces photos with accurate skin tones. The Poco X5 features a 6.67-inch AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate, providing a good indoor and outdoor viewing experience. It is powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 695 SoC, offering satisfactory performance for everyday tasks. Although the phone can handle high-end gaming, the experience is not ideal due to low graphics and frame rates. Therefore, if you're in the market for a budget smartphone that performs well in day-to-day tasks, takes good photos, and has a smooth display, the Poco X5 is worth considering.

The Vivo Y21 2021 comes with a 6.51-inch IPS LCD display. The smartphone offers average hardware performance. The camera on the device are also average. You get a 13MP selfie camera upfront which can shoot a good image. The phone packs a 5000mAh battery which can last throughout the day. The device has 18W fast charging. In a similar price range, you can consider buying Redmi Note 10, or Poco M2 Pro as these devices offer some great specifications and faster-charging support.

Samsung's new Galaxy S22 Plus smartphone has all the attributes to be recognised as a premium device. It gets the latest Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 chipset with 8GB RAM and this variant provides you with 256GB storage which is not expandable. The cameras are excellent but the phone comes with headphone jack and the battery life is average.

The Realme 11 faces tough competition but stands out with its innovative design, especially in the black colourway for those seeking a stealthy look. The LCD display is decent for video playback, but the absence of stereo speakers may disappoint some. Camera performance in daylight is good, though low-light and portrait mode could have been better. In a nutshell, the Realme 11 keeps pace with rivals, boasts fast charging, and offers reliable battery life.

The Xiaomi Redmi 9i is an entry-level smartphone and packs basic storage, display, and battery specifications. It does have some flaws when it comes to camera and battery performance. However, on the brighter side, the overall specifications makes it an attractive proponent.

The Chinese manufacturer's Redmi Note 11 SE is yet another fascinating smartphone. The gadget has a premium design language as well as some fantastic features in this price segment. The gadget also includes a dependable MediaTek Helio G95 chipset and a large battery. Choose the Redmi Note 11 SE if you want a reliable smartphone with a distinct design profile and helpful functionality.

The Samsung Galaxy A14 5G is probably one of the most affordable 5G smartphones from Samsung. The latest handset is loaded with some interesting features and a unique design, which makes it a head-turner.  It is equipped with a Samsung Exynos 1330 processor that is suitable for everyday use. Furthermore, despite with only 15W fast charging support from the manufacturer, the battery backup is acceptable. Having said that, the phone is a good bargain at this price point.

The OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite 5G is a budget-friendly option for OnePlus fans with good battery life, decent performance and fast charging. The tall display and lime color of the phone are also great features. However, for a better multimedia experience, the Redmi Note 12 5G or Moto G82 5G may be better options. While the Nord CE 3 Lite 5G has received some upgrades, they may not be groundbreaking. Nonetheless, it's a great choice for a OnePlus loyalist looking for a phone under Rs. 20,000.

Priced at under Rs 15,000, the Realme 60X comes with a 120Hz display. The device is powered by Dimensity 6100+ SoC which offers good performance. The smartphone also has 5G support and it also supports 33W fast charging. The device features a 50MP camera which captures good images. However, the device comes loaded with a lot of pre-installed apps. Compared to other devices in the same price range, the Realme 60X is value for money smartphone as you get a 120Hz display, good camera, and 33W fast charging support.

The Motorola Edge 40 Neo, despite its budget status, overperforms. While it can't match pricier models in performance and offers a good, not great, camera, its premium design, water resistance, and impressive display may deceive you into thinking it's a more expensive device. With reliable all-day battery life, it doesn't mimic a higher-end phone, but it certainly delivers excellent value for its price.

The Lava Agni 2 is a value-for-money phone with a modern design and a well-executed curved display. While the primary camera is competent, the HDR and ultra-wide angle cameras could be improved, and the 2-megapixel duo is disappointing. However, the device is optimised for all-day battery life and fast charging. Moreover, it offers a bloatware-free software experience with future promises, although there are some launch bugs. Starting at Rs 21,999, it's a decent option for daily tasks and gaming. Alternatively, the Realme 10 Pro+ and iQOO Z7 have advantages and disadvantages.

The Moto G31 comes with a 6.4-inch AMOLED display that has Full HD+ resolution. The device boots Android 11 out of the box with stock UI on top. On the backside, the device features a 50MP dual-camera setup, which takes some good images. The device offers a long-lasting battery life, and the battery supports 20W fast charging. However, the performance on the device is mediocre and the handset supports only a 60Hz refresh rate. In the Rs 13,000 price range, the Moto G31 is a great smartphone, considering that you are getting an AMOLED display, stock Android, and a 50MP dual-cameras.

The Samsung Galaxy A21s offers a great rear camera setup, one of the best software experiences in the industry, and an excellent battery life. While the phone doesn't come with an AMOLED panel, its IPS LCD does the job. The only major complaint with the device is that it has a serious performance issue due to the weak Exynos 850 SoC. If you are a heavy multitasker, you should steer away from this device. However, if you are a light user then the Galaxy A21s will offer you great user experience.

Xiaomi Mi 11i has all the attributes to be a value for money buy in the market. It uses the new Dimensity 920 chipset to bring 5G network to this range. The cameras also do a good job in most conditions, especially the main sensor. The AMOLED display is sharp and gets high refresh rate support and Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection. Even the battery life good, along with 67W fast charging support. The only drawback is the hybrid SIM slot which either lets you use the second SIM or expand storage. Go for the Mi 11i for its overall value.

The OnePlus 9 RT is the flagship device by OnePlus, which comes with a 6.62-inch AMOLED display. The display has a Full HD+ resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate. Thanks to the Snapdragon 888 SoC, the device offers excellent performance. Additionally, the device supports 65W fast charging. In the Rs 43,000 price range, the OnePlus 9 RT is the best device you can consider buying, as it has an AMOLED display, up to 8GB of RAM and 65W fast charging support.

The Nothing Phone 2 offers a premium feel with an innovative LED design and improved performance. It provides solid battery life and competitive pricing. However, it falls behind in terms of camera capabilities and software support, which may affect its overall appeal.

The OnePlus 7 Pro is the fastest Android phone money can buy right now. Using its display is a treat, and the phone's overall responsiveness and speeds are unreal. With that said, the poor imaging performance and lack of a headphone jack prevent this phone from being the perfect Android smartphone. If unrivaled performance is something you desire, go for the OnePlus 7 Pro. If an IP rating and headphone jack are must-haves for you, then go for the Galaxy S10 instead.

Vivo X60 is the successor to the X50 from 2020. And the new model gets a host of improvements, including the new Snapdragon 870 chipset in tow. The phone comes with dynamic and capable cameras on both the sides. With 8GB RAM you get multi-tasking done without any hiccups and the battery supports fast charging. Running on Android 11 makes it one of the first to get the latest version. However, the phone misses out on headphone jack and memory slot. Slightly expensive for the overall package in the market.

The Nothing Phone 2 offers a solid update with a premium feel and more recycled materials. It features advanced lights, a faster chip, and good battery life. The LED-strewn back and unique software design are attractive. However, the older chip and average camera performance, along with limited software support, are drawbacks.
The Galaxy Note 8 is surely an upgrade over the Galaxy Note 7. The phone offers a slew of enhanced features with an impressive design.

The Redmi 11 Prime is a jack of all trades and master of none. It nails all the pillars of a perfect budget smartphone in the most bare-basic manner. Its camera aces in daytime photography but struggles to deliver at night, and its battery life is long with long charging times.

The OPPO F17 Pro is an overpriced smartphone. It offers specs of an INR 15,000 at a price tag of INR 22,990. Phones like Realme 7 Pro, Redmi Note 9 Pro Max, and Motorola Fusion+ are clearly better choices compared to the OPPO F17 Pro.

The Samsung Galaxy M31s offers a crisp and vivid display, great camera performance, and excellent battery life. Also, it has a 3.5mm headphone jack and a dedicated microSD card. In a nutshell, the Samsung Galaxy M31s is a value for money device.

The Realme GT Neo 3T is a good device overall. It has a display which is suitable for watching content as well as for gaming. In addition, the 80W fast charging inclusion over the relatively slower one from the last gen is a nice upgrade.

OPPO Find N2 Flip joins the flip form-factor competition and takes on its closest rival, the Galaxy Z Flip 4. The phone ticks all the right boxes - be it screen, display or cameras. The cover screen is the biggest USP of the package, while bloatware is its weakest link. Overall, the Find N2 Flip is an excellent package for those looking for a flip-design phone.

The OnePlus 8 Pro does offer a class-leading display, excellent rear cameras, fast and smooth performance, a long battery backup, fast charging, and a fresh design, but it is too costly for what it offers. For the same price as the OnePlus 8 Pro, you can get an iPhone 11, which, we think is a better device overall.

The Samsung Galaxy A54 5G 256GB is a great mid-range phone with a Super AMOLED display and 120Hz refresh rate, a powerful 32MP selfie camera, and the latest Android 13 with One UI 5.1. However, its 25W fast charging is a bit slower compared to other phones in its class, and its weight may feel a bit heavy in the hand.

The Xiaomi Redmi 9 Power is a well-packed budget smartphone. The device flaunts an amazing Fluid AMOLED display for an excellent viewing experience. The inbuilt stereo speakers do enhance the video and gaming experience. It offers good battery life, thanks to its large 6000mAh battery. It offers decent camera performance and captures nice images in daylight. Overall, the device is a must-try at this price segment.

Samsung Galaxy A32 4G is an affordable 4G offering from the brand and offers value for money features. The device sports a 6.4-inch Super AMOLED display with a 90 Hz refresh rate, has an expandable memory capacity of 1TB. As for the optics, the device sports a quad-camera setup (64MP+8MP+5MP+5MP) on the rear, a single 20MP camera. The 5000mAh battery ensures long operating hours, and with 15W fast-charging, you can quickly refill the battery.

Vivo X50 Pro ships with robust features that account for seamless performance. It boasts an impressive quad-camera display (48MP+13MP+8MP+8MP), excellent internal storage of 256GB, and a large 4315mAh battery with 33W v2.0 fast charging. Coming to the cons, the display does not have any screen protection; also, the device does not offer any expandable memory, so that users have to content with the internal memory.

The Samsung Galaxy A12 is an affordable offering from the brand and packs some decent specifications. The phone comes with a decent display, an impressive quad-rear camera setup (48MP+5MP+2MP+2MP), ample storage space with up to 1TB expandable memory. The large battery capacity of 5000mAh offers uninterrupted usage for longer durations. It is a decent pick at this price segment.

Vivo V20 Pro is a high-end device that justifies its price tag with impressive specifications. It features a stunning display, excellent cameras, a huge battery, and top it off; the device supports 5G network connectivity. When it comes to speed, high refresh rate, and processor, there are certainly better available options out there.

OnePlus used to take consumer needs into account with its previous offerings. However, the decision to use a slow fingerprint sensor, remove the headphone jack and increase the base variant's price makes it feel as if the brand is moving away from its original image. On its own, the OnePlus 6T is a good phone thanks to its attractive design, good battery, decent performance, and impressive rear camera. However, the OnePlus 6 users are better off by not upgrading to the 6T. Other alternatives at lower price points include the ASUS Zenfone 5Z and the LG G7 ThinQ.

The Poco M4 Pro 4G flaunts a 6.43-inch AMOLED display. The display has a Full HD+ resolution and a 90Hz refresh rate. Thanks to 6GB of RAM and Helio G96 chipset, the device offers excellent performance. The handset features a 64MP primary camera which takes some quality photos. The device supports 33W fast charging. In the Rs 15,000 price range, the Poco M4 Pro is the device that you can consider buying. However, do note that you will have to compromise on 5G support.

The OPPO F21s Pro 5G is yet another interesting smartphone from the Chinese brand. The handset comes loaded with a premium design language and offers some great camera-centric features. The model also runs on the latest 5G Qualcomm chipset and packs a punch when it comes battery department. So, if you are looking for a stylish smartphone with a unique design profile and good features, then you can consider OPPO F21s Pro.

The Samsung Galaxy XCover 7 is not your usual consumer-grade smartphone. It's perfect for those who need a reliable work phone. 4050mAh battery is dependable, Dimensity 6100+ SoC delivers decent performance for everyday tasks, and the 50MP camera handles workday scans.

Effortless design, impressive and notch-less screen, stereo speakers, eye-candy UI, great cameras, microSD card slot, 3.5mm headphone jack, and wireless charging all make up for a great recipe. However, a throttling processor and short battery life keep the Galaxy S9 from being a great all-round smartphone.

Oppo A15 is a regular bugdet phone that gives you the basic features. Big screen, decent hardware setup, storage that is expandable, multiple rear cameras and sporting a modern waterdrop notch design. However, it only gets 3GB RAM, 5MP front camera and the battery life is average that comes with microUSB port for charging. Much better options available in the market these days.

The Infinix Note 12 5G can be considered a good option. The device packs an AMOLED display, which is a rare feature in this price range. It also packs some interesting hardware, like a triple-camera setup which can deliver reliable photos. The device's performance is up to the mark. However, you might face issues with bloatware. That said, the phone is a desirable option to consider in this price segment.

The Redmi 5A is one of the best entry-level smartphones offered by Xiaomi. Its battery backup is wonderful, and the display quality is quite satisfactory. While a fingerprint scanner and better cameras could have helped, these aren't major concerns considering how affordable this handset is. It certainly gets our recommendation for someone looking for a basic smartphone to get the job done.

Oppo A15s is a decent offering from the brand with good specifications. It comes with a tall 6.52-inches display, triple camera configuration, and a large 4230mAh battery. The device comes with an outdated chipset on the downside, and also the battery does not support fast charging.

Xiaomi 13 Pro is the company's best smartphone this year in every way. It packs a top-notch camera that comes with Leica tuning. There's Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 flagship chipset under the hood. For charging, the phone comes with 120W support that can fully charge the device in under 20 minutes.

The Realme 9 comes with a host of interesting features. The smartphone is powered by an octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 680 processor that provides decent performance. The phone also features a 6.4-inch AMOLED display that offers great viewing angles. Moreover, the cameras are the biggest highlights of this smartphone and comes with some unique features.

The Oppo F9 Pro is a bit of a mixed bag. Aspects of the device that Oppo has gotten right include the display with its waterdrop notch, imaging performance with sufficient lighting, and battery life with VOOC fast charge support. However, the video capabilities are just not up to the mark, and the performance leaves you wanting for more. SOmething like the Honor Play or the Poco F1 might be a better option for a better overall package.

The Samsung Galaxy Note 20 does bring some exciting features under the hood. It comes with a vibrant display, excellent camera performance and relatively bigger battery with fast charging support. The downside include the absence of expandable internal memory and lack of 3.5mm headphone jack.

The Xiaomi Poco M3 is a power-packed mid-range smartphone. The device features a tall 6.53-inches display, triple camera setup on the rear (48MP+2MP+2MP), a single 8MP selfie camera, expandable storage of up to 512GB. It comes powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 662 processor. Fueling the handset is a large 6000mAh battery with 18W fast-charging support. Overall, the device offers excellent features within the budget.

iQOO 9 Pro has a lot going in its favour. Flagship hardware, cameras with gimbal system, and even the design warrants its class. But iQOO is still a newbie in this arena, where it has the big boys Samsung, Apple to rival. So, even though the phone has a lot to offer, it still fails to become a choice for those spending over Rs 60,000.

All in all, the iPhone 11 Pro is the best option if you want the latest iPhone with all the bells and whistles. The phone is great if you shoot a lot of videos and it does a great job while gaming too, thought that may eat into your battery really fast. But the camera is a lot of fun to play with and the user experience on iOS is really excellent.

The Moto G54 provides exceptional value in its price range. While aspects like camera and design could be improved, it offers clean software, reliable performance, and excellent battery life. Despite some camera inconsistencies, it justifies its price, especially the base variant priced at Rs 15,999, making it an excellent choice for those seeking a dependable smartphone.

The Vivo Y35 2022 offer some interesting features and specifications at this price point. The phone features a good design language and offers a tall display, which is good for multimedia consumption. The model is also powered by a decent and reliable Qualcomm Snapdragon 680 processor and offers a large 128GB of internal storage. However, we have the competition offering better cameras in this price range. Overall, it can be considered a decent option in this section.

Realme 9 Pro has few good things and some bad for its price tag. This variant comes with 6GB RAM which might not be enough for some users. It gets the new 5G Snapdragon 695 chipset for performance, and offers 128GB storage which is expandable. The phone runs on Android 12 OS, and the main rear camera delivers quality photos. The battery life is long and you have 33W charging support.

The Vivo Y75 5G boasts a 6.58-inch IPS LCD display with a Full HD+ resolution. The device is equipped with an octa-core Snapdragon 480 chipset which offers great performance. The device also offers 5G support. However, it has average battery life and only 18W fast charging support. In the Rs 20,000 price range, you can consider buying the Redmi Note 10 Pro Max or Poco X3, considering that these offer some good specifications compared to the Vivo Y75 5G.

The Galaxy A13 is a 4G smartphone by Samsung priced at Rs 15,999 in India. The device flaunts a 6.6-inch TFT display with a Full HD+ resolution. Under the hood, the device is driven by Exynos 850 processor which is paired with 4GB of RAM. The handset takes some decent images thanks to a 50MP quad-camera setup. The device runs the latest Android 12 software version and packs a 5,000mAh battery. Compared to the Galaxy A13 5G, the Poco M4 Pro 5G or iQOO Z6 5G can be good option, if you are specifically looking for a smartphone with 5G support and a higher refresh rate display.

Realme C35 is the latest budget phone from the brand which looks to offer more options to the buyer. This device gets a full HD+ display, has a triple rear camera and comes with 4GB RAM. The 64GB storage is expandable, and the battery life is decent as well. However, the performance is rather average and the other cameras just make up for the numbers. Better option available in this range, but you can consider the C35 for basic users.

The iPhone XS Max offers substantially improved camera over the iPhone X and iPhone 8 Plus alongside dual-SIM feature (with iOS 12.1 update), but in other areas the improvements remain incremental. For the ones who can't make do without Apple ecosystem and want a large screen with optimised camera performance or the dual-SIM feature, they should upgrade to the iPhone XS Max. Otherwise, there are better alternatives in the segment, and they will also save you some cash to buy other stuff.

Oppo Reno 7 comes with an AMOLED display which only supports 90Hz refresh rate. It is powered by MediaTek Dimensity 900 chipset with 8GB RAM for quality performance and 5G support. It also gets 256GB storage which is further expandable. Reno 7 also scores some points for its looks and lightweight design. And having an average battery with 65W fast charging helps. However, Reno 7 has solid competition in its price range.

The Vivo Y22 2022 has several intriguing features and functionalities. The phone has a quality appearance and a large display. The device is also powered by a respectable and dependable MediaTek G70 CPU and comes with a generous 128GB of internal storage. However, there is competition in this price bracket that offers a superior display and camera. Overall, it is a reasonable selection in this category.

Samsung Galaxy M12 is an ideal budget device that comes with Android 11 out of the box. It runs on the new Exynos Octa 850 chipset with 4GB RAM and offers 64GB storage, which is further expandable. But having quad rear camera is a big plus, and with the 8MP camera for selfies, you can take video calls with ease. And finally, the 6,000mAh battery with 15W charging support offers long backup with quick charge as well. Worthy option for budget-conscious buyers.

The Samsung Galaxy M52 5G flaunts a 6.7-inch AMOLED display that has Full HD+ and 120Hz refresh rate. The device is powered by an octa-core Snapdragon 750G SoC which is paired with 6GB of RAM. The smartphone has a 64MP triple-camera setup. The device packs a 5000mAh battery that has 25W fast charging support. The smartphone lacks a 3.5mm audio jack. The Galaxy M52 5G is the best device you should consider buying in the Rs 25,000 price range.

Redmi 10 Prime crosses the Rs 12,000 mark to graduate from a budget to a mid-range device for buyers. It uses the new MediaTek Helio G88 chipset, but this variant gets 4GB RAM only. The LCD display supports 90Hz refresh rate, and offers Full HD+ resolution. The storage is expandable, and even with a 6,000mAh battery the phone is comfortable to hold. However, the cameras are average for the price, and so is the 18W charging support.

iQOO 9 SE is the new kid on the block that has a lot of scope to become a value for money buy this year. For the price you get it with an AMOLED 120Hz display, powered by Snapdragon 888 chipset with 8GB RAM. It offers 128GB storage which sadly is not expandable, and you don't even get the headphone jack. The triple cameras offers versatility and the battery gets 66W fast charge support. Worth considering for this price.

The OPPO A18 features a 6.56-inch IPS LCD with a 90Hz refresh rate. While the display is clear indoors, it becomes challenging to see under bright sunlight. The phone is powered by the MediaTek Helio G85 SoC, which handles everyday tasks adequately, though there is a noticeable lag sometimes. Intensive games frequently crash, disrupting the experience, whereas casual games run fairly well with only minor lags and stutters. On the back, the phone has an 8MP primary camera and a 2MP depth camera, while the front houses a 5MP selfie camera. The image quality is satisfactory for basic needs. The device boasts a 5000mAh battery, which is impressive and offers long battery life. It runs on ColorOS 13, based on Android 13, right out of the box. However, the device has numerous pre-installed apps, leading to a laggy user experience. Overall, while the phone is a decent option for its price, there are other alternatives in the market worth considering.

The OnePlus Nord CE 3 impresses with its edgy design and stunning camera system. The vibrant 6.7-inch 120 Hz display and immersive audio enhance the viewing experience. Powered by Snapdragon 782G, 12GB RAM, and a 5,000 mAh battery with 80W fast charging, it offers smooth performance and efficient power. A compelling smartphone package.

The OPPO F11 Pro is a mid-range phone that looks great and captures really nice still images. Totally a flaunting tool for millenials. Buyers won't complain about the phone's performance but things like a dated microUSB port and a lower price tag could've made this phone an even better option to consider.

The Galaxy A50s has a little bit of everything but not a lot of anything. In that sense, it's a great all-rounder but there are alternatives in the market that offer great cameras, and better battery life but most importantly, better processors. So it's a hit or miss with the A50s, but if past numbers are any indication, the Galaxy A50s should be just as popular as its predecessor.

The Realme 9i comes with a 6.6-inch IPS LCD display. The display panel has a 90Hz refresh rate and a 480 nits brightness. Under the hood, the device is equipped with an octa-core Snapdragon 680 processor, which offers excellent performance. The 64MP camera on the device takes some good images. The handset offers good battery life, and it is also equipped with stereo speakers. In the Rs 14,000 range, the Realme 9i is a good smartphone that users can consider buying.

POCO F4 5G smartphone is value for money, considering the highly-competitive specifications and a flagship chipset (Snapdragon 870) that offers lag-free performance. The smartphone has excellent primary rear cameras for great photoshoots. You get a 4500mAh battery which offers a long-lasting backup and a 67W fast charging support that can quickly charge up your phone in no time. The latest smartphone from POCO is excellent for gaming enthusiasts.

The OPPO F21s Pro is another intriguing smartphone from the Chinese manufacturer. The device has a premium design language and some excellent camera-centric features. The device also has the most recent Qualcomm processor and packs a powerful battery. So, if you want a trendy smartphone with a distinct design profile and useful functions, choose the OPPO F21s Pro.

The Samsung Galaxy Note 10 is one of the best options you can look at if you want a high-end Android device. The phone gives you a premium experience thanks to OneUI and the phone is beautiful to look at as well. The camera system competes with the best phones in the world and is able to hold its own.

LG Wing is crafted to offer the polished experience to the user. The secondary display is well integrated for a modern smartphone experience. The camera capabilities of the phone are impressive. The phone comes powered by a powerful Snapdragon 765G processor for robust performance. On the other hand, its low refresh rate and small volume buttons (hard to press) are certainly its cons. If LG had reduced its pricing a bit, it would have certainly been tempting.

The Vivo Y36 impresses with its vibrant 6.44-inch FHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon 680 processor, and ample 5000mAh battery with fast charging support. However, lack of 5G connectivity could disappoint some buyers.

Vivo V21 5G mainly focuses on selfie enthusiasts with its 44MP camera that even supports OIS. Rest of the device looks underwhelming for its price, especially with the MediaTek Dimensity 800U chipset on offer. You have 8GB RAM and 128GB storage that is expandable but only at the expense of second SIM. The rear cameras offer average results and the battery life could be better. Go for the V21 5G only if you are fond of clicking selfies and have money to spend.

The JioPhone Next is an entry-level smartphone from Jio that ships with a 5.45-inch IPS display. The device runs Android 11 out of the box with Pragati OS. The handset comes equipped with a host of Jio apps and has features such as Translate Now, Read Aloud, and Nearby Share. The smartphone even has a 4G support. However, the device offers average performance and packs a small battery. If you are looking for a 4G handset with Android 11 on board in Rs 6,000 range, then the JioPhone Next can be an ideal offering.

With a good spec sheet and the inclusion of LED lights at the back, the Tecno Pova 5 Pro provides a unique experience to its users for under Rs 15,000. While we are impressed with the LED lights, more customisation options would have made the feature useful.

The Redmi Note 10T comes with a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display. The display panel has a 90Hz refresh rate. The device offers impressive performance thanks to Dimensity 700 SoC. The camera performance on the phone is average. The device features an IPS panel. If you are looking for a smartphone with Dimensity 700 SoC, 90Hz display, and 5G support, you consider buying the Redmi Note 10T.

Priced at Rs 23,999, the Vivo T2 Pro boasts a premium design and stunning display. It offers strong performance and decent camera results but lacks an ultra-wide lens and has room for software improvements. Overall, it's a good choice under the Rs 25,000 price range.

The Reno 2F is great if you plan to shoot a lot of photos with the rear camera and the battery backup is quite nice too. Unless you plan to invest a lot of time in gaming, the phone makes a lot of sense if you want a mid-range phone.

Realme X3 offers powerful hardware and software packed in a trendy design. Thanks to its latest Snapdragon 855 Plus processor, the device offers excellent overall performance. It offers good value for money and has a clear edge over other flagship devices.

The Realme 7 Pro comes with meaningful upgrades over its predecessor, Realme 6 Pro, in terms of an AMOLED display, fast charging, and stereo speakers. On the other hand, the device has cons in the form of a smaller display with only a 60Hz refresh rate and an ultra-wide-angle camera. It is certainly not the best device in this price segment.

Samsung Galaxy M01 Core gets a HD+ display, runs on the Android 10 Go edition and comes packed with a 3,000mAh battery. However, the phone only comes with 2GB of RAM. Also, the Galaxy M01 Core does not come with a rear fingerprint sensor or even an LED flash on the back camera.

The Infinix Zero 30 5G features an AMOLED display that has a 144Hz refresh rate. The Dimensity 8200 SoC equipped with the device can handle multitasking and gaming with ease. The smartphone features a 50MP selfie camera which has 4K video recording support. The device also has an IP53 rating and 68W fast charging. If you are primarily looking for a smartphone with good selfie camera, excellent display, and faster charging, then Infinix Zero 30 5G is worth buying.

The Tecno Camon 20 comes with a 6.67-inch AMOLED display. The display panel offers vivid colours and it has a 120Hz refresh rate which offers a smooth scrolling experience. The handset is powered by Helio G85 SoC which can handle all the tasks with ease. The device packs a 5,000mAh battery which supports up to 33W fast charging. However, the smartphone lacks 5G support. If your priority is a 5G device you can go for Tecno Camon 20 Pro, or consider other alternatives such as  Redmi Note 12, Galaxy M33 5G, or POCO X5. Besides 5G support, the device has got everything that you would need such as AMOLED screen, excellent processor, and a long lasting battery life.

The Infinix Note 30 5G is a massive upgrade over its predecessor, Note 12 5G, with a 108MP triple rear camera setup, 45W fast charging, and more. If you miss an AMOLED display and a good processor, the POCO X5 5G can be considered.

The Remi Note 6 Pro is quite a reasonable offering in the budget category. Xiaomi has certainly made improvements on this phone compared to its predecessor, making it a worthwhile upgrade. However, the Note 6 Pro faces considerably intense competition now. A great alternative would be the Asus Zenfone Max Pro M2 with its premium glass sandwich design, a smaller screen notch, and a 5,000 mAh battery.

The Mi A3 is perfect for those who want a mid-range phone with stock Android UI, good cameras and long battery life. It's a good-looking phone, too. While the phone has an AMOLED screen with good colors, we can't help but notice its lower resolution (720p) for the size. Some might find Android One UI too basic for their needs, but that doesn't mean it's a bad phone. It's just that they'll have to install more third-party apps to get things done.

Vivo Y100A is a mid-range smartphone that offers an AMOLED display and fast charging. It also has a high peak brightness of 1300 nits. However, its performance is mediocre, thanks to Snapdragon 695 Soc, and there is bloatware pre-installed with the Funtouch OS 13. It lacks a dedicated microSD slot for storage expansion. Alternatives to consider in this price range are OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite and iQOO Z7.

It is hard to recommend the Oppo A5s when options such as the Realme 3 and Redmi Note 7 exist. The use of a weak Helio P35 chipset paired with 2GB of RAM on the Oppo A5s result in a severely lacking user experience. If your only requirements are good looks and long battery life, then this smartphone will fulfill your needs. If imaging and performance are must-haves, then you would be better off looking elsewhere.

The Vivo V11 Pro is a step in the right direction for mid-range smartphones. It offers reliable performance despite its software being slightly annoying. The inclusion of an in-display fingerprint scanner at this price point is certainly appreciated. You also get above average battery life with support for fast charging. Even though there are a few hindrances, the Vivo V11 Pro undoubtedly deserves attention.

The X60 Pro borrows a lot of its elements from the X60, except for better imaging prowess. The higher price means you get more cameras but apart from that, the Pro version looks and feels like the regular model only. In fact, this device gets a smaller battery for strange reason and even though it has an AMOLED screen, the lack of refresh rate support is perplexing to say the least. Probably worth going for other options at this price range and there are plenty to look at.

The only feature that the Nokia 150 offers over its more affordable sibling, the Nokia 125, is the rear camera. But the camera is basically useless unless you are satisfied with blurry, low-detailed, grainy shots. And we think it isn't worth spending the extra money on the Nokia 150 over the top of what you'll be paying for Nokia 125.

Xiaomi Redmi 9A sits in the budget smartphone segment and offers a host of features that are pretty good for the price. It sports a 6.53-inch bright HD+ display with notch, powered by octa-core Mediatek chipset, features dual rear camera and comes loaded with a 5,000mAh battery. The only gripe with the phone is that it comes with 2GB RAM and microUSB port for charging.

Vivo V21e 5G comes with a 6.5-inch AMOLED display. The device offers impressive hardware performance and decent cameras. The selfie performance on the handset is even good, thanks to the 32MP selfie camera. The phone packs a 4000mAh battery that offers 44W fast charging support. However, the device comes with average battery life and has a Hybrid storage slot. The phone is the go-to offering for users who want impressive hardware and good camera performance.

Motorola Edge 30 offers a host of interesting features, which makes it a worthy option to consider in this price segment. The device offers an OLED display and comes with a 144Hz refresh rate, which is currently the highest in this price range. The phone also comes with capable performance and the fast charging support is just the cherry on top. So, if you are considering a smartphone that provides decent cameras and good performance with the highest screen refresh rate, then you can consider Motorola Edge 30.
While the bloat-free software experience with promised updates and lasting battery life seems like a catch for Moto G62, the shortcomings in the camera department can be a bummer.

All in all, there are better options in the Indian smartphone market like the Realme X or Realme XT. The Oppo A9 2020 doesn't have anything that sets it apart from the competition besides the battery, but it could appeal to someone looking for a decent all-rounder.

The Micromax IN Note 2 is a mid-range smartphone from Micromax that boats a 6.43-inch AMOLED display. Thanks to the Helio G95 SoC, the device offers excellent performance. The smartphone offers up to 30W fast charging support. The device has average battery life. If you are looking to buy a smartphone in Rs 14,000 price range, the Micromax IN Note 2 is a good option, considering that the device has AMOLED display, 30W fast charging support, and a excellent design.

The Infinix Hot 20 is yet another stylish smartphone from Infinix. The phone has several fantastic features and an excellent design language. First off, the device has a sizable display and a 5G MediaTek Dimensity 810 processor that provides reliable performance. The device also includes a high storage capacity, which is also extensible. Infinix Hot 20 is undoubtedly a viable option if you're seeking a smartphone with a respectable user experience and is produced by an Indian company.

Moto G40 Fusion packs decent specifications in the sub-20,000 category. The smartphone has a wide display with HDR 10+ certification, impressive triple-rear cameras (64MP+8MP+2MP) offering excellent image quality, offers ample space thanks to its expandable memory support of up to 1TB. The large 6000mAh battery ensures longer hours of interrupted usage, and with fast-charging support, the device can be charged pretty quickly. The lack of AMOLED display and onboard internal storage of only 64GB are its cons.

The Samsung Galaxy F13 is a decent option in this price segment. The handset is loaded with some interesting features and specifications like a large display, good battery life, a decent set of cameras, and more. However, the phone also has its fair share of cons. That being said, you can consider this device if you have limited phone usage.

The Samsung Galaxy A34 is a great mid-range option with a 120Hz AMOLED display and flagship-like design. It also boasts 4-year software support. However, there's no charger in the box and no fast charging, which could be a dealbreaker for some. Other options to consider in this price range include the iQOO Neo 7 and Redmi Note 12 Pro Plus.

The Moto Razr 40 offers a stylish flip phone option with a great display, though it lacks Widevine L1 certification. It performs well without lag and provides a pleasant software experience typical of Motorola phones. The battery life is decent, and the cameras are satisfactory. Priced at Rs 59,999, it's a good choice for foldable enthusiasts.

Realme 9 5G gives you a mixed set of features that might not appeal to buyers. It has a 90Hz refresh rate display, powered by Dimensity 810 SoC and offers expandable storage. The main 48MP camera offers quality but the others are average. The battery life is good, but only offers 18W fast charging. If you don't need a 5G phone there are better options available.

The itel A70 is a solid option for those looking for a phone under Rs 8,000. It has a nice design and sturdy build and does well for everyday tasks. The camera and audio performance are surprisingly good. Just keep in mind it's not meant for heavy use. If you want a decent all-around phone without spending too much, the Itel A70 is worth considering. It also works fine as a secondary phone for calls and emails.

The Realme XT packs a mean punch for its price tag by offering not just a 64MP camera, but a high-quality display, a good processor and a lightning fast charger, all of which is available at the Rs. 15,000 mark. The phone is also scheduled to get an Android 10 rollout sometime in 2020.

The Vivo Y75 4G comes with a 6.44-inch AMOLED display. The device is powered by a Helio G96 processor which offers excellent performance. It packs 8GB of RAM and 128GB of internal storage. The smartphone is backed by a 4,050mAh battery that supports 44W fast charging. You can go for the Vivo Y75 if you are looking for a AMOLED display, excellent hardware, and a 44W fast charging. However, you will miss the 3.5mm audio jack and 5G support on this device. If you are looking for 5G support, Vivo has also introduced the Y75 5G variant, which offers similar specifications as the Vivo Y75 4G.

The Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra is the premium offering by Samsung. The handset comes with a 6.8-inch AMOLED display that has QHD+ resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate. Thanks to Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 chipset, the device offers good performance. The handset features a 200MP camera that takes some good images. The handset also offers 45W charging support. The Galaxy S23 Ultra is a good contender, considering that you get a good display, faster performance, and exceptional camera.

The POCO M6 Pro stands out with a unique dual-tone design and the latest 4nm mid-range Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 SoC, excelling in various aspects. It offers impressive battery life and performs well with its primary camera in daylight. It is a good choice for those looking for a 5G smartphone at budget price range.

Priced at under Rs 20,000, the Samsung Galaxy F34 features an AMOLED display. The device has a 120Hz refresh rate and Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection. The smartphone runs Android 13 out of the box, and it is promised to receive four years of Android software updates. A 6,000mAh battery equipped with the device can easily last throughout the day. The phone also has 11 5G bands support and a microSD card slot. However, the Exynos 1280 SoC equipped with the handset offers mediocre performance. Overall, the Galaxy F34 is a good device considering that you get a good 120Hz AMOLED display, massive 6,000mAh battery, and 11 5G bands support.

Motorola Edge 20 makes a decent fist for its sub Rs 30,000 price tag. It also comes powered by Snapdragon 778G chipset with 8GB RAM that gives you the performance you need. Its triple rear cameras are versatile and shoot in all conditions, giving you the desired quality. Stock Android on board is always a treat to the eyes, and the phone's battery benefits from it. However, the phone lacks memory expansion, no headphone jack and only 30W fast charging at this price.

The iQOO Z6 Lite 5G ticks the boxes of iQOO's core philosophy of performance and battery life. The lack of a bundled charging brick may be off-putting to some, and its camera performance is mediocre at best. Nevertheless, it's a good phone for first-time smartphone users who want basic 5G connectivity.

The Infinix Hot 30 5G is an overall good phone priced at under Rs 15,000. The device has a sleek design, and good camera which captures detailed images. The Dimensity 6020 SoC combined with 4GB of RAM all the tasks with ease. The device also has a 5G support, and a 6,000mAh battery which last throughout the day on a single charge. However, the phone features an average selfie camera and has 18W fast charging support. If you are looking particularly for a 5G phone near Rs 15,000, you can go for Infinix Hot 30 5G. The other options you can consider in the similar price range are the Redmi 12 5G, Realme Narzo 60 5G, and Vivo T2x.

The Vivo V29 Pro is a recommendable option in its price range, excelling in camera performance, performance, and battery life. Pre-installed apps and shorter Android update support are its minor drawbacks.

iQOO 7 Legend is the rebranded iQOO 7 for the Indian market. It gets top-notch hardware features, that includes AMOLED 120Hz display, Snapdragon 888 SoC, 8GB RAM and decent rear camera on board. Add to that, you have 66W fast charging support for the 4,000mAh battery. The only drawbacks are no headphone jack, no memory card slot for expansion and the front camera just about works. iQOO 7 Legend is a value-for-money workhorse, and if the brand name does not matter, you should definitely get it.

The iQOO Z6 5G is a decent device by iQOO under Rs 20,000 price range. The handset boasts a 6.58-inch IPS LCD display that has Full HD+ resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate. The device is powered by Snapdragon 695 SoC, which offers excellent performance. The smartphone features a 50MP camera that takes some good images. The handset runs the latest Android 12 software version and packs a 5,000mAh battery. However, the device supports 18W fast charging only. If your priority is the latest Android 12 version, decent hardware, and 5G support, then the iQOO Z6 5G can be a good option.

The Infinix Smart 8HD is one of the best smartphone deals you can get on the market right now. It's primary snapper is a rockstar in the day, it offers a fuss-free interface with a little bit of bloat along with respectable performance.
