We wish its Magic Ring had more use-cases and its secondary camera would have been traded for slightly faster charging speeds.

The Realme 3 Pro is a worthy competitor to the Xiaomi Redmi Note 7 Pro. With its great IPs screen, wonderful gaming performance, superb shooters, and impressive battery life, the Realme 3 Pro challenges the Note 7 Pro in pretty much every category. While the phones are comparable when it comes to their hardware, the Realme's ColorOS 6 helps it gain a clear advantage over its competitor.

iQOO Z5 5G packs the Snapdragon 778G chipset which guarantees solid performance with 8GB RAM on board. The LCD display supports 120Hz refresh rate and features Full HD+ resolution. The rear cameras offer decent photos in different conditions, and the battery with its long backup supports 44W charging speed. However, the plastic back panel is not ideal for this price and the storage is not expandable. Buy if you need a reliable device for under Rs 25,000.

The Realme 9 5G SE is the latest 5G phone by Realme in the Realme 9 series. The device boasts a 6.6-inch IPS LCD display that has 144Hz refresh rate. The smartphone offers excellent performance, thanks to the Snapdragon 778G chipset and 6GB of RAM. The device has up to 30W fast charging support. However, the handset has an AMOLED panel. The device still runs Android 11 out of the box. If you are looking for decent hardware, up to 144Hz refresh rate display, and 30W fast charging support, then you can go for the Realme 9 5G SE.

The OPPO A57 2022 seems to be a decent option in this price segment. The handset packs a premium design and offers a modest processor, if not powerful. The device is loaded with 33W fast charging, which makes it an interesting buy under this price segment. However, the competition currently has much better specifications and features at a similar price point.

The Xiaomi Mi 10T Pro is an excellent device packed with powerful specifications. The 108MP quad-camera setup along with 20MP selfie camera accounts for splendid images. It packs 8GB RAM for hassle-free multitasking performance. Also, the device's battery capacity is 5000mAh, which offers power back up for long durations. However, the bulky weight of the device and non-expandable storage space are its drawbacks.

Samsung Galaxy F41 is a decent mid-range phone with quality front and rear cameras. The phone's mid-range hardware gets a big Super AMOLED display, running on the latest Android 10 software version. It also packs a large capacity battery for long backup. However, the phone does not get high refresh rate support and only offers 15W charging at this price, which is lower than competition.

The Xiaomi Poco X3 Pro 8GB RAM  offers flagship-grade features that are worth the money. On the positive side, the phone comes with a 120 Hz refresh rate display, runs on a Qualcomm Snapdragon 860 chipset, has 8GB RAM, 128GB internal memory (expandable up to 1TB). The optical features include a quad rear camera setup (48MP+8MP+2MP+2MP) and a 20MP front camera. The phone could have come with an AMOLED display, and its lack proves to be its con.

The iQOO 9 Pro is the value for money smartphone. The device flaunts a 6.78-inch AMOLED display that has a QHD+ resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate. The display has 1500 nits brightness and a pixel density of 518 PPI. Thanks to the Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 processor and 12GB of RAM, the handset offers excellent performance. The device also supports up to 120W fast charging and the charger is included in the box. The smartphone runs the latest Android 12 software version out of the box. You can go for the iQOO 9 Pro if your budget is close to Rs 70,000.

The Vivo Y16 is another low-cost smartphone from the Chinese brand. The device offers several intriguing features and qualities that make it an appealing alternative in this price range. The Vivo Y16 is a steady performer with a simple level of setup that may easily suit your multitasking demands. Furthermore, the smartphone has a good camera setup, a long-lasting battery, and an incredible user experience powered by Android v12 OS.

The Lava Blaze 5G is yet another Made for India smartphone from the Indian brand. The handset offers a good design language and contains some great features. To start with, the model offers a large display and is equipped with a 5G MediaTek Dimensity 700 processor, which delivers stable performance. The model also features a large storage capacity, which is also expandable. Overall, if you are looking for a smartphone that offers a decent user interface and is made by an Indian brand, then you can definitely consider Lava Blaze 5G.

The Samsung Galaxy A14 5G 8GB RAM is likely one of Samsung's most cheap 5G smartphones. The newest handset has some fascinating features and a distinct appearance that makes it stand out. It has a Samsung Exynos 1330 CPU that is suited for daily usage. Furthermore, despite the manufacturer's limited 15W fast charging capability, the battery backup is enough. Having said that, the phone is a terrific buy at this price.

The Samsung Galaxy A70 is a neat-looking phone with the excellent build quality. OneUI software has good aesthetics and design as well. What we liked the most is the phone's stunning OLED screen, which is ideal for content consumption. The selfie camera is good and so is the battery life. However, it has its own share of issues. The fingerprint sensor implementation is poor. The rear cameras lack night mode and any kind of video stabilization. The wide-angle shots don't come out well due to the excessive barrel distortion. All things considered, Vivo's V15 Pro is a more balanced choice. It comes with a more stylish design, a full-screen OLED screen, and much better cameras. However, it comes with its own share of fault in the form of Funtouch OS, which is a cheap replica of Apple's iOS.

The OnePlus 7T Pro is unbeatable when it comes to buying a high-end Android phone. It matches the big names beat-for-beat when it comes to specs and features. In fact, at this price, no other phone even comes close in terms of value for money.

The Realme GT Neo 3 brings flagship-grade specifications and features at an affordable price tag. The phone comes with a 120Hz AMOLED display and offers flagship performance with its MediaTek Dimensity 8100 processor. The device also has decent cameras that are capable of clicking photos and videos in different conditions. Moreover, the 80W fast charging will sure come in handy, while the in-display fingerprint sensor also helps to record heart rate. That said, if you are looking for a flagship smartphone under Rs 40,000 price segment, then Realme GT Neo 3 can be considered a good option.

The Realme Narzo 60 Pro 5G flaunts a 6.7-inch AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate. The device has a stylish design and a vegan leather back panel. The device uses an octa-core Dimensity 7020 SoC which handles all the demanding tasks and gaming with ease. The smartphone features a 100MP primary camera which captures excellent photos. However, the device doesn't feature an ultra-wide camera. Additionally, it doesn't have a microSD card slot, a 3.5mm audio jack, and an IP rating for water and dust resistance. If your priority is display, performance, design, and fast charging support, you can go for the Realme Narzo 60 Pro 5G.

The Vivo V25 Pro is yet another design marvel from the Chinese brand. The phone packs a premium design and offers a crisp 120Hz AMOLED display. The device also features a flagship-grade MediaTek Dimensity 1300 chipset coupled with 66W ultra fast charging support. The phone's camera capabilities are top notch and offers stable performance in different lighting conditions. That said, if you are looking for a stylish smartphone from Vivo under this price segment, the Vivo V25 Pro is a sure shot.

The Moto G73 is a solid option with a clean and secure Android experience, along with 5G connectivity and all-day battery life, all at a reasonable price point, but its lack of an AMOLED panel, slow charging, and no support for 4K video recording may be a turn off for some.

The truth is that while the Vivo V17 Pro is an amazing phone, the price makes no sense at all. Especially when you consider the kind of phones that are available in the market today, Vivo could have priced this phone a lot better. But if you can overlook the competition, though you have absolutely no need to, this phone is a pretty great all-rounder.

The only real downside of the Realme 6 is its processor. The MediaTek Helio G90T might put out good numbers on paper but it isn't as good in real-life usage. That being said, it isn't that bad of a performer either. It will get the job done. Apart from the processor, the Realme 6, is a class-leader in almost every other department, may it be display, camera, battery life experience, or design.

The Redmi 12C is an entry-level smartphone from Xiaomi which offers good performance and excellent battery life. The handset has a microSD card slot for storage expansion and up to 4GB of RAM. However, do note that the handset runs Android 12 OS, lacks 5G, and has a standard 60Hz refresh rate display. The device also doesn't supports fast charging. In conclusion, if you are primarily looking for a smartphone with good battery life and all the basic needs, then you can go for the Xiaomi Redmi 12C.

Xiaomi Mi 11 Lite can be recognised for its slim design and lightweight body. The phone uses mid-range Snapdragon 732G chipset with 6GB RAM that gives you reliable performance. The AMOLED screen features 90Hz refresh rate and gets Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection as well. The rear cameras give you decent quality and you get the promise of long battery backup. However, a hybrid slot is a drawback. Worth going for if you need a reliable and lightweight phone.

The Realme Narzo 50 is a mid-range handset by Realme that comes with a 6.6-inch IPS LCD display. The display panel offers up to 120Hz refresh rate. The device is powered by Helio G96 SoC which offers good performance. The handset however lacks 5G support and it still runs Android 11 out of the box. However, in the Rs 13,000 price range, the Narzo 50 is still a good smartphone that you can consider buying, as you get a 120Hz refresh rate display, 50MP triple-cameras, and 33W fast charging support.

The POCO M4 5G is a decent option considering its price tag. The smartphone comes loaded with a large 6.7-inch display that comes with a 90Hz screen refresh rate. The smartphone is powered by a reliable MediaTek Dimensity 700 processor that delivers good performance in all aspects. The phone is also loaded with a 5,000mAh battery to make sure you get at least one full day of battery backup. On the downside, the phone only comes with dual rear cameras and just 18W fast charging support.

The OnePlus 11R is arguably one of OnePlus' best smartphones. The phone has a high-end design aesthetic, and the cameras work quite well. Additionally, the phone is equipped with the most recent Qualcomm chipset, which can handle any work you throw at it. The battery is respectable, and the option for 100W fast charging is just the icing on the cake. Overall, it's one of the top smartphones available right now.

Realme 8i gets a FHD+ 120Hz display, powered by MediaTek Helio G96 chipset with 4GB RAM and offers 64GB storage. The primary 50MP rear camera is decent but the other two are average and don't offer much value. The battery life is decent but 18W fast charging is a bit slow for this price now. Buy it if you need a mid-range 4G phone, or you have other options with better features available.

The OPPO A96 is a mid-range 4G device by OPOP which comes with a 6.59-inch display. The display panel has a Full HD+ resolution and a 90Hz refresh rate. Thanks to Snapdragon 680 SoC and 8GB of RAM, the device offers excellent performance. The handset packs a 5,000mAh battery which supports 33W fast charging. If your priority is a 90Hz refresh rate panel, decent hardware, and a long lasting battery life, then you can go for the OPPO A96. However, do note that you will have to compromise on 5G support.

To conclude, the OnePlus Nord N20 SE is yet another exciting smartphone. The handset features a good design, which looks attractive. The phone also packs some decent performance and is equipped with decent battery life. The user interface is clean and provides a good response. Overall, if you are looking for a budget-centric smartphone with reliable performance and good design, then you can consider this phone.

The Samsung Galaxy S23 Plus offers flagship-level specifications. The handset sports a 6.6-inch AMOLED display that has Full HD+ resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate. The device offers top-notch performance, thanks to Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 chipset. The device runs Android 13 OS and it also supports 45W fast charging. However, do note that the phone doesn't have a microSD card slot, and a 3.5mm audio jack. If your priority is good display, faster performance, charging speed, and good camera quality, you can go with the Galaxy S23 Plus.

The iQOO Z7 is a beautifully designed smartphone. The outdated notch and mediocre speaker output can be a letdown. But, looking past that, it's a well-executed device at a starting price of Rs 18,999.

Samsung Galaxy M21 is a hard-core mid-range device that offers a decent display, with an effective set of hardware, quality cameras and a decent battery backup. However, for this price, we expect phones to offer 90Hz refresh rate support these days, and a mere 4GB RAM might not work in favour of the power users. Also, the big capacity battery misses out on faster charging speed.

The iQOO 9 is a flagship offering from iQOO. It boasts a 6.5-inch AMOLED display that has a 120Hz refresh rate. The device is powered by Snapdragon 888 Plus processor which offers flawless performance. The handset runs latest Android 12 software version out of the box. Additionally, the device offers 120W fast charging support. The iQOO 9 is value for money smartphone, considering the specifications it offers at Rs 43,000 price.

The OPPO A17K is a budget-range device by OPPO. The handset has a 6.56-inch IPS LCD display which offers 720 x 1612 pixels resolution. The device comes powered by an Helio G35 processor which offers average performance. Despite having a huge 5000mAh battery, the smartphone lacks fast charging support. If you are looking to buy a new smartphone in the Rs 10,499 price range, the competition is offering much better specifications and features at a similar price point.

The Xiaomi Redmi 10 flaunts a 6.7-inch IPS LCD display that has HD+ resolution. The device is powered by Snapdragon 680 processor which offers lag-free performance. The handset sports a 50MP triple-camera setup which takes some good images. The smartphone offers a long-lasting battery life. However, the device runs Android 11 and has 18W fast charging support only. If your priority is decent hardware and long-lasting battery life, then you can for the Redmi 10.

The Moto G52 brings a host of interesting features and specifications at this price point. The phone offers a sleek design language and the OLED display delivers a good viewing experience. The Qualcomm Snapdragon 680 processor present in the device is capable of handling most of the tasks you throw at it without fail. That said, if you are considering a phone for under Rs 15,000, then you can definitely consider buying this device.

The POCO C55 is yet another interesting smartphone to consider in this price range. The latest smartphone from the brand offers apt specifications and features that give stiff competition to its rivals. The phone comes with a decent processor, and the tall display makes it easier to consume content on-the-go. The rear cameras seems to be decent, while we think the selfie camera could have been slightly better. Overall, it is a decent device to consider in this price segment.

The TECNO POP 8 packs a large display, smooth 90Hz refresh rate, and dual speakers at an attractive price of Rs 6,599. If you prioritize entertainment and basic tasks, it's a solid choice. However, the cameras are average, and storage might be limiting for heavy users. Consider its strengths if you primarily browse, watch videos, and stay connected at an affordable price.

The Realme 6i is a budget offering from the brand and gives value for money features. However, there have been compromises when it comes to design and storage. But it gets a Helio G90T, which is great at this price range. Still, the phone is the go-to option in the affordable mid-range price bracket.

The Samsung Galaxy S20 5G is a true, high-end flagship phone with all the industry-leading features packed into it. You will get an excellent display, great cameras, silky-smooth performance, a beautiful-looking UI, a great build quality, and class-leading connectivity options. The only downside of the phone is that it has a poor battery backup. If you are okay with short battery backup, the Samsung Galaxy S20 5G is one of the best flagship smartphones in its price range. You can look for Galaxy S20+ or Galaxy S20 Ultra for a higher battery backup.

iQOO Z3 5G comes with a 120Hz IPS LCD display. Under the hood, the device is equipped with an octa-core Snapdragon 768G chipset. The smartphone packs 8GB RAM and 256GB of onboard. The phone runs Android 11 which is riddled with bloatware. The device offers 55W charging support. However, the cameras are average. If you need a phone with quality hardware performance, and a 120Hz display, then iQOO Z3 5G is the best offering in Rs 20,000 price range.

The Infinix Note 12 Pro is loaded with a host of interesting features that makes it a good device to consider. The phone packs a 108MP triple-camera setup which is a rarity in this segment. Moreover, the device also packs a 5G MediaTek chipset, which is reliable when it comes to performance. Moreover, the phone also comes with 33W fast charging, which is a good addition to the long list of features.

The Realme 9i 5G 128GB model comes loaded with some interesting features. The phone comes with a new laser light design, which provides a reflective texture. The handset features a reliable MediaTek Dimensity chipset and offers virtual RAM technology. The cameras seem to be decent in this price range, and the battery life is good as well. So, if you are planning to buy a 5G smartphone under this budget, then you consider Realme 9i 5G 128GB as well.

Redmi 12 5G aims to reclaim the sub-'     15k segment with its impressive design, large beautiful display, and sufficient performance for daily use. Exceptional battery life and aggressive pricing add significant value, making it an ideal choice for budget-conscious users seeking an affordable 5G phone with excellent connectivity.

The Vivo Y30  is available at an affordable range and packs a bunch of exciting features. The phone does offer impressive camera performance backed by 13MP Quad rear cameras and 8MP front camera. Besides, the handset comes equipped with a powerful hardware configuration, large inbuilt storage capacity.

Xiaomi Mi 11X Pro is one of the most affordable phone in the market that comes with Snapdragon 888 SoC. It gets a Super AMOLED screen with 120Hz refresh rate which is one of the best in its segment. You get 8GB RAM onboard with this variant, along with 128GB storage. The 108MP camera will deliver on your needs, same with the front 20MP camera. You have a 4,520mAh battery that offers decent backup. But the phone lacks a memory card slot, and supports only 33W charging which is slow for this price range these days. If these features satisfy your needs, then go ahead and buy the phone.
With performance and battery as its core selling points, the Iqoo Z6 Pro manages to stay relevant despite sporting an understated look and having a serviceable camera module.

The latest and greatest chip from Qualcomm, highest brightness figures, crazy multi-refresh rate capabilities, 120W charging and the ability to map gestures as macros make the iQOO 11 the most lucrative gaming phone right now.

The POCO F4 5G is flagship handset from POCO. The device has a 6.67-inch AMOLED display which offers 120Hz refresh rate, FHD+ resolution and a 1300 nits max brightness. An octa-core Snapdragon 870 SoC equipped with the device offers excellent performance. The phone supports 67W fast charging and it also has 5G support. If you are looking for a flagship handset with good hardware, brighter display and Android 12, POCO F4 5G is the ideal phone which you can consider buying under Rs 30,000.

With the Vivo V25 pro, you get bragging rights to a futuristic pop-up camera on a quite an affordable price. This design also helps you get an unobstructed viewing experience. You also get good performance courtesy of a Snapdragon 675 SoC. As long as you can put up with Vivo's Funtouch OS, this phone is worth considering, With that said, the Asus Zenfone 5 can be a better option if raw performance is what you are looking for.

The Redmi 7A is an impressive choice for first-time smartphone buyers. Priced at just Rs 6,499, it offers a large screen, decently fast performance for day-to-day tasks, feature-rich MIUI software, adequate cameras, and long battery life. We wish Xiaomi had used a USB Type-C port, though.
The Vivo Y15 doesn't have much going for it besides the battery capacity.

Realme C20 is budget device that comes powered by MediaTek Helio G35 chipset. It gets a 6.5-inch HD+ screen quality and offers long backup thanks to the built-in 5,000mAh battery. The single rear camera does a good job, and you get 32GB internal storage. But it only gets 2GB RAM, runs on Android 10 and supports charging via microUSB port. Worth looking at other options in this price range.

The Samsung Galaxy M13 offers some good features and specifications at this price point. You get a  large 6.6-inch display, which is ideal for multimedia consumption. Moreover, the phone will offer a good battery life, all thanks to the 6,000mAh battery. Apart from this, the company has also added some nifty features like RAM Plus technology that delivers a decent performance.

The Samsung Galaxy A53 5G is the new premium 5G smartphone by Samsung in the A-series. The device has a 6.5-inch Super AMOLED display which supports a 120Hz refresh rate. The smartphone comes powered by new Exynos 1280 chipset which is accompanied by 8GB of RAM. The handset runs Android 12 out of the box. As promised by Samsung, the device will get four years of the software update and five years of security patches. If you are looking for a smartphone to keep for at least four to five years as for the new Android version, and want an AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate and long-lasting battery life, then the Galaxy A53 5G is the device which you can consider buying.

Realme is playing on the 9i 5G with its design and the 5G affordability. At Rs 14,999, it is a good device with a smooth display, decent battery life, and a good selfie camera. However, at the same price, the Poco M4 Pro 5G looks more appealing.

The Vivo Y17s comes with a 6.56-inch display which has a standard 60Hz refresh rate. The Helio G85 SoC equipped with the device is capable of handling day-to-day task. The device has an IP54 rating and a good battery life. However, it lacks 5G support and has only 15W charging. If 5G and slow charging speed aren't a concern then you can consider the Y17s. At the same price, the other devices such as Redmi 12 5G, and Realme 11x 5G offer more value for money compared to the Y17s.

It is difficult to recommend anything other than the Redmi Note 5 Pro at this price point as it offers unbeatable performance, exceptional imaging prowess, and commendable overall polish. In fact, we would go as far to recommend adding the few thousand rupees more and getting this over the Redmi Note 5 as you get a significantly better value.

The Vivo Y12 isn't the best option in its price range, and there isn't a strong USP for the phone either that could attract buyers since competing phones offer everything and more. The phone gets a hard pass from us.

Xiaomi Redmi 9 is a surprise package for a phone costing under Rs 10,000. It gets a Full HD+ screen, with a capable hardware on board and offers a solid battery life. However, the phone features dual rear cameras only, and that could force buyers to look at other options. Still, a very good buy for the regular users.

Samsung Galaxy A72 (128GB) is a premium quality smartphone that packs amazing specifications. The device sports a spectacular 6.7-inches AMOLED display, impressive quad-camera setup (64MP+12MP+8MP+5MP) on the rear, and a 32MP selfie camera at the front. Users also get ample storage space as the device packs 128GB internal memory that is further expandable up to 1TB using a microSD card. Rounding off, the handset is powered by the large 5000mAh battery with 25W fast-charging support. Despite its high price, the smartphone does not have any screen protection nor any IP rating, which is its Cons. Overall, the higher mid-range smartphone from Samsung fares better than most of its rivals.

The Realme X7 Pro is one of the best upper mid-range smartphones you can buy right now. The phone offers every feature that you'd want from a smartphone of its price. It has got a brilliant viewing experience, thanks to the 120Hz AMOLED unit. The Dimensity 1000+ can handle heavy tasks and heavy multitasking with ease. The primary camera at the rear captures brilliant pictures in any lighting condition and so does the selfie camera. The phone has got a decently large battery and more importantly, it comes with 65W fast charging capability, making it one of the fastest charging phones in the market.

Poco F3 GT comes with a 6.67-inch 120Hz AMOLED display and it offers impressive hardware performance thanks to Dimensity 1200 chipset. The device features a triple-camera setup which takes some good images. The phone packs a 5065mAh battery that offers 67W fast charging support. If you are looking for a gaming phone under Rs 30,000 with some impressive hardware, AMOLED display, and fast charging support, you can consider buying the Poco F3 GT.
If you want to upgrade from a two-year-old budget smartphone, the POCO M5 can be a great choice. It has little bloat compared to the competition and decent performance on tap.

The Vivo V19 has everything that it takes to make it one of the best mid-range smartphones in the market. It has got an excellent AMOLED display with class-leading brightness. A powerful processor for a lag-free performance in day to day usage. The rear camera setup packs a high-resolution, 48MP camera for crisp images. The 8MP ultrawide sensor is a great addition as well. The front camera setup is also among the best in the segment with its 32MP main sensor and 8MP ultrawide camera. Lastly, you get a 4500mAh battery that should last you an entire day on heavy usage.

Vivo X70 Pro Plus is the latest flagship contender with a lot of quality for a decent price. It sports a Quad HD+ AMOLED 120Hz display, powered by latest Snapdragon 888 Plus chipset, with 12GB RAM and 256GB storage. The rear cameras are pretty good and offer versatility and results. It supports fast charging as well. However, the phone misses out on headphone jack, memory card slot and all this power takes a toll on battery life. Worth buying if you need a premium phone.

Samsung Galaxy M32 sports a 6.4-inch AMOLED display that has a 90Hz refresh rate and Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection. The phone comes equipped with an octa-core Helio G80 SoC, 64MP primary main camera, and a 20MP selfie shooter. It packs a massive 6000mAh battery. Only the cons is that the device is bulky and it offers 25W charging support.

The Vivo Y33s features a 6.58-inch IPS LCD display that has Full HD+ resolution. The smartphone offers decent hardware and camera performance thanks to Helio G80 SoC and 50MP triple-cameras. The Vivo Y33s packs a 5000mAh battery which can last throughout the day. The device has 18W fast charging. In a similar price range, you can consider buying Poco X3 Pro or Realme 7, as these handsets offer better specifications and features compared to the Vivo Y33s.

The Infinix Zero Ultra has crazy charging speed and a beautiful display. However, it lacks the performance and panache its competitors have to offer in the form of iQOO Neo 6, OnePlus 10R and Realme GT Neo 3, among others.

The Galaxy M30s is great if you're looking for a battery beast. It would work for a casual user but for someone spending a lot of time on their phone, the UI could seem a bit laggy even though it offers a lot of customisation and has good features. The phone isn't great for gaming either unlike similarly priced options from Realme and Xiaomi.

Vivo V20 SE packs excellent specifications and features such as tall 6.44-inches AMOLED display, 8GB RAM, 128GB storage configuration. It has an optical on-screen fingerprint sensor for biometric authentication. The only downside is the relatively small battery capacity of 4100mAh.

Realme Narzo 30 Pro is a decent mid-range phone with mixed-bag results. It sports a Full HD+ screen with 120Hz refresh rate, the Dimensity 800U chipset is powerful and efficient to deliver on the battery front. The triple rear camera is capable in bright conditions, not so much when the light dips. But having a big battery is also helpful, and 30W fast charging is a bonus. However, the phone features hybrid SIM slot and comes with Android 10 version only.

OnePlus 9 256GB is a well-packed phone featuring a great display and impressive cameras. Add to it, the robust Qualcomm Snapdragon 888 processor, 12GB RAM, and 45000mAh battery with a 65W Warp charge make it a worthy option for buyers. On the flip side, the device has certain cons, such as no support for expandable memory and the absence of a 3.5mm headphone jack.
The Mi 10 would have been a perfect device if it just had the center-mounted punch-hole and IPXX water and dust resistance. Nonetheless, it offers best set of features for its price.

If you are looking for a smartphone with a smooth performance at a budget, the Poco X2 should be the first on your list. Apart from the smoothest performance in the segment, the Poco X2 also offers an excellent rear and front camera setup, a polished software, and a long battery backup with fast charging.

Realme 8 Pro goes heads up with the new Redmi Note 10 Pro Max. This phone packs an 108MP camera, runs on Android 11 OS and sports a Super AMOLED display. The built-in battery supports 50W fast charging for quick boot up. But the screen misses out on high refresh rate at this price, the phone comes powered by an older Snapdragon chipset and other cameras at the back are average at best. Should consider other phones in this price bracket.

Oppo F19 offers you bright and colourful Super AMOLED display with promise of long battery backup that supports 33W fast charging for blazing performance. You get 6GB RAM and 128GB storage that is further expandable as well. The phone runs on Android 11-based ColorOS version and features triple rear camera that delivers quality photos in low-light conditions.

Realme 8 5G is a decent phone under the sub-Rs 20,000 price segment. The phone has a smooth AMOLED display; its 90 Hz refresh rate is quite smooth. On the hardware front, the phone is provided with an impressive 4GB of RAM and 128GB internal memory with expandable memory support of up to 1TB. To address the power requirements, the phone includes an impressive 5000mAh battery with 18W fast-charging. The phone does not have any screen protection and disappoints users owing to its lackluster camera performance.

The Moto G72 is an intriguing smartphone. The smartphone packs segment-leading features and offers a good design language. The model features pretty high brightness and comes with a pOLED panel that is good for media consumption. The device also features a powerful MediaTek chipset that delivers great performance. So, if you are looking for a smartphone that delivers a stock Android experience and is feature-loaded, then you can consider Moto G72.

The Vivo Z1 Pro is impressive in parts, be it styling, performance, battery life, or fast charging. However, it fails to present itself as an all-rounder. Its cameras are underwhelming and so is its software UI. Vivo also failed to equip the phone with a USB Type-C port, which most phones in its segment come with in 2019.

The only issue with the Samsung Galaxy A30s is that it can't quite keep up with the competition, as even the Galaxy M30s, which carries the same price tag, offers better battery life, a superior chipset, a better rear camera, and full HD+ resolution. The design does not particularly stand out either, as it is a fairly standard Samsung design.

The Vivo Y50 is a stylish mid-range device with an impressive camera setup, ample storage space, and also massive RAM. It also packs a powerful 5000mAh battery capacity and offers backup for longer durations. But it does not support fast charging, and it takes a long time to charge the battery fully.

The Samsung Galaxy M21 128GB version offers a massive 6000mAh battery that offers great battery life for all your requirements. Samsung bundles 15W charger with device, but you have various options to buy phones with 30W fast charging at this price range. The Super AMOLED screen offers vivid, clear viewing of the pictures and videos.

The Samsung Galaxy F23 5G boasts a 6.6-inch IPS LCD display. Under the hood, the device is powered by an octa-core Snapdragon 750G processor which offers lag free performance. The device features a 50MP triple-camera setup, which takes some good images. The handset even has a 5G support. On the software front, the F23 runs latest Android 12 software version. If your budget is around Rs 15,000, and you are looking for a Samsung smartphone with 5G support and decent hardware, then you can consider buying the Galaxy F23 5G.

The Realme C51 is a budget-oriented smartphone priced at under Rs 10,000. The device features a 6.5-inch HD+ display that has a 90Hz refresh rate. The smartphone boasts a 50MP dual-camera setup which captures good images. The device is equipped with Unisoc T612 SoC which offers mediocre performance. The smartphone supports 33W fast charging. If your priority is display, camera, and fast charging, then Realme C51 is worth considering under the Rs 10,000 price range.

Xiaomi's Redmi A2 brings affordable smartphones to India with a 2-year extended warranty. With options ranging from 2GB + 32GB to 4GB + 64GB, the Redmi A2 offers value-conscious consumers meaningful features at honest prices.

Samsung Galaxy A22 is a peculiar device. It gets a Super AMOLED panel but only with support for HD+ screen resolution. The phone comes powered by MediaTek G80 Helio chipset which is average for this price these days. Add to that you have average cameras, and the only good thing is that you get it with Android 11 out of the box and a long battery life. But that also with 15W fast charging which is nowhere close to the standard these days. Better to skip this device for others from Xiaomi, Realme and more.

The OPPO A55 comes with a 6.51-inch IPS LCD display that has HD+ resolution. The phone features a 50MP triple-camera setup which takes some good images. The device is powered by Helio G35 SoC which offers average performance. The phone's storage is expandable up to 256GB. The device packs a 5000mAh battery that 18W fast charging support. If you are looking to purchase a smartphone in a Rs 15,000 price range, the Redmi Note 10T or Poco M3 Pro 5G can be a better option compared to the OPPO A55.

Moto G71 5G is the latest mid-range phone to offer future network connectivity. It sports AMOLED display without high refresh rate. The use of Snapdragon 695 chipset with 6GB RAM makes it reliable for daily use. You also get 128GB storage which is not expandable. The triple rear cameras do a good job, and the battery life is effective with 33W fast charging support.

Redmi Note 11S is another 4G phone that looks to impress among the host of 5G devices in this segment. It sports an AMOLED display, gets a reliable hardware package, and excellent cameras that add extra value. The battery life is also good, the storage is expandable and the 33W fast charging support is helpful. However, this model only gives you 64GB storage and still runs on Android 11 version.

The Tecno Spark 10 Pro is a mid-range handset from Tecno that features an excellent display, runs the latest Android 13 OS, and has good performance. The phone flaunts a 90Hz refresh rate display and it is powered by Helio G88 processor which offers good performance. The device boots the latest Android 13 OS out of the box, and offers good battery life. However, the handset lacks 5G support, and has only 18W fast charging support. If you are looking for good selfie camera, display, and performance, then you can go for the Tecno Spark 10 Pro.

The OPPO F25 Pro features a 6.7-inch AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate. The display quality is quite crisp and rich in detail. The phone is quite sturdy in terms of design, but it becomes uncomfortable for the hands after extended usage. At the back, there's a 64MP primary camera, an 8MP ultra-wide camera and a 2MP Macro camera. The photos have a warm tone and are quite balanced. However, there's room for improvement in ultra-wide camera quality. It's good but not good in all the conditions. This phone boasts a MediaTek Dimensity 7050 SoC that has awesome multitasking capabilities. However, while playing games like Call of Duty: Mobile, this phone usually tends to lag. On the contrary, casual games like Subway Surfers work well. The phone is powered by a 5000mAh battery and comes with a 67W fast-charging adapter in the box. It provides almost a day of battery life with mild usage. This is a good phone with excellent battery life and acceptable everyday performance.

The Redmi K20 is one of the best trimmed down versions of a flagship smartphone ever released. Except the Snapdragon 855 chipset and 4K 60fps video recording, it retains all the features of the Redmi K20 Pro. It looks similarly attractive, has the same great AMOLED screen, loud speakers, headphone jack, and long battery life. Its cameras are great for the price. The performance, while not as fast as the Snapdragon 855 on the Redmi K20 Pro, comes eerily close and you won't feel much of a difference even while gaming unless you're comparing side-by-side. If only it had a faster fingerprint reader and better auto brightness, it would've been the most perfect phone in its segment.

Infinix Note 11S is a decent option for buyers in the market. It features a large display, powered by reliable Helio G96 chipset with 8GB RAM which is good for the price. You also have 128GB storage which is expandable using dedicated card slot. The cameras deliver quality and the battery life keeps you ticking, and quickly back up with 33W fast charging. However, the screen misses out on AMOLED and high refresh rate support. And the design makes it bulky.

The OPPO K10 5G offers a good value-for-money proposition to the buyers. The handset comes with a decent design language and offers an IP54 rating, which is a good addition. The phone also comes with good battery life and the 33W fast charging support comes in handy. The performance is decent and the display is fluid and responsive. However, the lack of an ultra-wide-angle lens may raise some eyebrows. That said, it is a good option to consider in this price segment.

The new Samsung Galaxy A31 ships with decent build quality and display. The battery turns out to be the standout feature of this phone. On the downside, mediocre cameras and underwhelming camera performance make it an avoidable option. At the same price point, the Samsung Galaxy M31 turns out to be the better option.

The Vivo Y11 (2019) turns out to deliver decent performance. The 6.35-inch display is ideal for watching movies and playing games. Also, the phone boasts a bigger battery capacity of 5000mAh that offers longer battery life. In terms of cons, the phone is quite bulky to hold, and it also does not support fast-charging technology.

The Samsung Galaxy F12 (64GB) is a budget offering from the brand and packs an impressive specs sheet. The device ships with an impressive camera configuration featuring a quad-rear camera setup ((48MP+5MP+2MP+2MP) and an 8MP selfie camera. The multitasking is smooth, thanks to 4GB of RAM. It offers ample storage space with expandable memory support of up to 1TB via a microSD card. Fueling the smartphone is an impressive 6000mAh battery with fast-charging support. On the downside, the device does not feature any glass protection, and it is a bully weighing 221 grams.

The iPhone 15 Pro features an aerospace'   'grade titanium design. The device has an OLED display which supports a 120Hz refresh rate. The camera on the device offers 3x zoom. Additionally, the handset is powered by the A17 Pro chipset which offers 10% better performance compared to the A16 Bionic chipset. The device also has 2GB more RAM compared to its predecessor. The phone also features an Action button which replaces the Ring/Silent switch. The button can be used to access run shortcut, or run any accessibility feature or toggle between ring/silent mode. Compared to last year's iPhone 14 Pro, the iPhone 15 Pro is definitely a worthy upgrade as you now get a USB-C port, a new action button, more RAM, and an excellent hardware.
The Samsung Galaxy J8 is not a bad smartphone altogether. However, other smartphones in the same price range offer more than the Galaxy J8. I think you should consider Redmi Note 6 Pro instead.

Realme 5 brings a quad-camera setup under the Rs 10,000 price segment, a first in its category. It also has a big screen, a fast processor, an extremely long battery life (thanks to a 5000mAh battery), and a planned upgrade to Android 10. It has an attractive design as well as a water splash-resistant design. However, we can't help but notice is lower than required screen resolution and the good old microUSB port is still lingering around.

There hardly is anything to dislike about the Realme X2. It has a great display, excellent cameras, superfast performance, long battery backup, and quick-charging capability. There isn't any other smartphone in the price segment that offers hardware as good as that of the Realme X2. Simply put, if you are looking for a smartphone under INR 20,000, go for the Realme X2 without a second doubt.

OnePlus Nord offers 5G-ready features in a sub-30K phone. It comes with a 90Hz AMOLED display, features quad rear cameras and gets a solid 4,115mAh battery with 30W fast charging support. However, the storage is not further expandable and it doesn't come with a headphone jack.

The Realme Narzo 50 5G cuts a few corners to accommodate a 5G-enabled chipset for its price, and these corners are important in terms of user experience. The Narzo 50 Pro, on the other hand, is priced and specced aggressively, making it a good recommendation for someone looking for a phone just above Rs. 20,000.

The Galaxy A03 is an entry-level smartphone from Samsung. It flaunts a 6.5-inch TFT display that has HD+ resolution. The Unisoc T606 chipset along with 3GB of RAM, offers mediocre performance. Also the camera performance is average. The device supports just 10W charging. In the Rs 10,000 price range, you can skip the Galaxy A03, and explore other options such as Redmi 9 Prime, Poco M3, Micromax IN Note 1, which offers some good features.

Overall, the Xiaomi Redmi Note 12 4G is an excellent choice for anyone looking for a high-performance smartphone at an affordable price. With its powerful processor, AMOLED display, and latest Android 13 OS, the device meet all the needs and expectations. However, do note that the phone doesn't have a 5G support. In the same price, if you are looking for a 5G handset, you can explore other options like Galaxy F23 5G, iQOO Z6 Lite 5G, Redmi 11 Prime 5G, Poco M4 Pro 5G.

Poco M3 Pro 5G is an ideal choice for mid-range buyers if they need a 5G phone. It has got the looks, the performance is quite impressive with the Dimensity 700 and you get a 90Hz refresh rate screen. It also offers long battery life. However, this variant has 4GB RAM, it supports hybrid SIM slot, the main camera is average and you only get 18W fast charging.

The Oppo A53s 5G is yet another affordable 5G offering from the brand. The device comes loaded with an excellent rear optical configuration that includes 13MP primary camera, a 2MP macro camera, and a 2MP depth camera. It helps captures professional-level photographs. Backing it is a powerful 5000mAh battery with fast charging. The display offers only a 60Hz refresh rate, and it could be improved.

Xiaomi Mi 11X Pro is the latest affordable flagship in the market, powered by Snapdragon 888 chipset with 8GB RAM. This variant comes with 256GB storage that is non-expandable. The device offers AMOLED screen with 120Hz refresh rate and an elegant design. You have capable rear cameras and a decent front selfie camera as well. The phone offers long backup but we would have liked fast charging to be faster than 33W for this price. Either ways, worth giving it a shot for its overall capabilities.

The Motorola Edge 20 Fusion is a mid-range offering by Motorola that comes with a 6.67-inch OLED 90Hz display. The device offers excellent hardware and camera performance thanks to the Dimensity 800U chipset and 108MP camera. However, the phone has average battery life and misses out on stereo speakers. If you are looking for smartphone purchase in Rs 20,000 price range, you can go for Motorola Edge 20 Fusion.

The OPPO A16e is a mid-range device by OPPO. The handset has a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display which offers HD+ resolution and a standard 60Hz refresh rate. The device is equipped with a Helio P22 processor which offers average performance. The smartphone lacks fast charging support and doesn't have a fingerprint reader either. If you are looking to buy a new smartphone in the Rs 9,990 price range, you can consider smartphones like Realme Narzo 30A, Realme C25, or Micromax In Note 1, considering that they offer value for money specifications

The Samsung Galaxy M13 5G is the new mass-market entry-level 5G smartphone. The phone has a nice look and solid performance. It has a MediaTek Dimensity 700 chipset that is suitable for daily use. Furthermore, the battery backup is adequate, despite the manufacturer only offering 15W fast charging support. Having said that, the phone is a decent buy in this price range.

The Vivo T2x features a 6.58-inch FHD+ IPS LCD screen that offers an average viewing experience. This phone is powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 6020 SoC, which handles multitasking between apps well and provides a good day-to-day experience. It is not built for heavy gaming, but casual games can be easily played. The phone has a 50MP primary camera and a 2MP macro camera at the back, and an 8MP front camera for selfies. The photos taken with this phone are good for its price range, though there is some noise in daylight shots, which is acceptable. The phone packs a 5000mAh battery and supports 18W charging, which is relatively slow. The Vivo T2x runs on Funtouch OS 13, based on Android 13, and comes with bloatware that can be removed for a cleaner user experience. The Vivo T2x is a budget smartphone that ticks almost all the boxes in its price segment.

With its impressive camera system, powerful processor, long-lasting battery, and expandable storage, the Narzo N53 is perfect for users seeking a reliable and feature-rich smartphone. Whether you're a photography enthusiast, a multitasker, or a heavy user, the Narzo N53 is designed to meet your needs and exceed your expectations.

mobile_name: OPPO Reno12 Pro Manish Malhotra Limited Edition

expert_view: The Oppo A12 comes in handy for day to day tasks. However, the phone does lag when it comes to camera performance. At this price range, there are many options from the makers of Xiaomi (Xiaomi Redmi Note 8), Realme (Realme Narzo 10), and Motorola (Motorola G8 Power Lite) with better camera specifications.

Samsung Galaxy A03 is a budget phone that runs on the regular Android 11 version. Considering this, the phone offers just 3GB RAM and the hardware is meant for basic usage only. The main rear camera is good, but others are basic. The HD+ screen quality is also no longer appealing at this price. Better options in the market.

The Realme Narzo 50i flaunts a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display. The device is powered by a Unisoc chipset, which offers average performance. The smartphone packs a 5000mAh battery. The device lacks fast charging support and a fingerprint sensor. In the similar price range, the Redmi 9 Activ could be a much better option, considering that it comes with a Helio G35 SoC and has a fingerprint sensor as well.

The iPhone 15 brings an upgrade in terms of the camera department compared to the iPhone 14. The device features a 48MP primary camera and has 2x zoom. The iPhone 15 is powered by Apple's in-house A16 Bionic chipset which offers great performance. It ships with the latest iOS 17 software version and will receive five years of OS updates. And finally, the smartphone now has a USB-C port. However, the device offers a slower charging speed compared to the competition. If you are in the market looking for a new iPhone purchase, then the iPhone 15 is definitely worth considering.

The Oppo K1 can easily score a recommendation in the mid-range segment. It has decent specifications and hits double when it comes to front camera. Besides, the phone looks great with its gradient texture on the back panel.

The Realme 5i misses out on a few basics features such as the USB Type-C port and a Full HD resolution display. If there wasn't any other smartphone that offered a better set of features for the same price, I'd have definitely recommended the Realme 5i. That, fortunately, isn't the case. For the same price as the Realme 5i, you could get the Redmi Note 7 Pro, which offers all the features that the former lacks.

Xiaomi Redmi 9 Prime offers Full HD+ resolution for under Rs 10,000 with Corning Gorilla Glass 3 protection. It runs on MIUI version built over Android 10 version out of box and packs a competent set of hardware for decent performance. The phone also gets quad rear cameras and loaded with a 5,000mAh+ battery for solid backup. Looking for a budget phone? You can't go wrong with the Redmi 9 Prime.

Oppo A74 5G is yet another addition to the affordable 5G devices in the brand's  A-series. It is backed by great specs such as impressive RAM and storage (6GB and 128GB), great cameras (48MP+2MP+2MP) on the rear, and an 8MP front camera. The device is backed by a huge 5000mAh battery capacity with 18W fast-charging support. As for the cons, the display is mediocre as it flaunts IPS LCD with only a 60 Hz refresh rate.

Tecno Pova 2 comes with a 6.9-inch FHD+ display. The device offers impressive hardware and camera performance, thanks to Helio G85 SoC and a 48MP quad-camera. The phone packs 128GB of internal storage which is expandable. However, the device only offers 18W fast charging support and it has a bulky design. If you are looking for a smartphone in Rs 10,000 price range, you can go for Tecno Pova 2, considering that the device offers value for money specifications.

Samsung Galaxy M32 5G comes with a 6.5-inch display. The display panel has only HD+ resolution. Powering the device under the hood is Snapdragon 720 processor which offers mediocre performance. The cameras on the device offer average performance. The phone packs a 5000mAh battery. However, it only supports 15W fast charging. In the Rs 20,000 price range, you can choose between Poco X3 Pro, Realme X7, or even Redmi Note 10 Pro Max, considering that these handsets offers much better specifications and features compared to the M32 5G.

The Infinix Note 12 comes with a 6.7-inch AMOLED display. The device is powered by Helio G88 processor which offers lag-free performance. The camera on the device is of 50MP. The handset ships with 4GB of RAM and packs a 5,000mAh battery. The smartphone also supports 33W fast charging. In the Rs 11,999, the Infinix Note 12 is the ideal device considering that you get a AMOLED panel, good hardware performance, and up to 33W fast charging support.

The Realme C30 smartphone is a decent device in this price segment. The latest handset comes with a premium design language and offers a large display that makes it quite useful. The phone also packs some decent performance, though cameras could have been a bit better. Overall, if you are looking for a budget-centric smartphone, then Realme C30 can be considered as a decent option.

The Moto G62 5G is a good option to consider under this price segment. The handset features a premium design language and packs a good display with a 120Hz screen refresh rate. The phone performs well in this price segment and offers a good set of cameras. So, if you are looking for a smartphone with a clean user interface and decent performance, you can consider Moto G62 5G.
At an asking price of Rs 9,499, the Moto G13 proves every buck to its consumer. It ticks almost all the things right. However, display resolution and bloatware could have been done better.

The Samsung Galaxy F04 is the company's most recent low-cost smartphone aimed for consumers. The phone has a lovely appearance and outstanding performance. It has a MediaTek Helio P35 CPU, which is enough for daily use. Furthermore, despite the manufacturer's limited charging support, the battery backup is acceptable. Having saying that, the phone is a terrific value at this pricing.

The Vivo T2x 8GB RAM boasts of 5G support, 50MP camera, and a 144Hz display. However, its fast-charging feature could be better, and the phone lacks an ultra-wide angle lens while the display is LCD. Alternatives like iQOO Z6 Lite 5G or Realme 10 may be worth considering.

The Realme 2 Pro is pretty much the best smartphone that one can currently buy at this price point. its price-to-performance proposition is the best by far. What it lacks in fast charging, it makes up for with its tremendous battery life. The bezel-less display reproduces vibrant colors. Obstruction is minimized here with its tiny teardrop notch design. While the body might be prone to scuffs, the provided transparent case helps mitigate this issue.

The Y17 is an all-rounder but does not excel at one particular thing, unless you count the battery capacity. The processor is a bit of a concern as you can look at a few alternatives at this price point.

Xiaomi Poco C3 gives you everything that one asks from a budget phone. Big screen, capable hardware in tow, decent cameras and a long battery backup. However, we would have liked the C3 to get a microUSB 2.0, especially when the market has moved to USB Type C in 2020.

Vivo Y51 2020 feels like an increment compared to its predecessor. The screen size remains identical, with support for Full HD+ resolution but at this price, you expect high refresh rate as well. The hardware package will deliver on your needs, especially handling multi-task activities with 8GB RAM will be easier. Then you have storage up to 1TB if required and the cameras give you decent photos as well. The battery backup won't let you down either. However, we would have liked to see punch hole design instead of waterdrop notch at this price. Heavy competition might not work in favour of the Y51 2020.

Asus Zenfone 8 has few things going in its favour. It features a compact design, that carries an AMOLED 120Hz display. The phone gets durability via IP68 rating and Corning Gorilla Glass Victus. It has 8GB RAM on board and the cameras are good. However, Snapdragon 888 is an old SoC now, the storage is not expandable, Android 11 OS is dated now, and the battery life along with 30W charging is not good for this price. Better options available now.

The Vivo Y72 5G comes with a 6.4-inch IPS LCD display. The device offers 5G support and runs Android 11 out of the box. However, the performance and cameras on the device are average. If you are looking for a smartphone in Rs 20,000 price range, you can go with Redmi Note 10 Pro Max, iQOO 3 or the Poco X3 Pro, as these devices offers value for money.

Nokia C01 Plus is another budget phone running on the Android 11 Go platform. It gets an octa-core chipset with 2GB RAM and offers 16GB storage, which is sufficient for this OS to run lightweight apps. The cameras offer basic quality, but the battery life is good. Go for this device if you are switching from basic phones, and are tight on budget.

Xiaomi Mi 11 Lite as the name suggests is a thin and lightweight device. It packs Snapdragon 732G chipset which sounds average for this price nowadays with 5G around. The AMOLED screen gets 90Hz refresh rate, along with Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection. The rear does a good job, and you get long battery life with fast charging. However, the device only features a hybrid SIM slot, has no headphone jack and the front camera is average. Buy the Mi 11 Lite if you need a compact phone. Otherwise you have many 5G-centric phones out there.

Apple iPhone 13 gets a 256GB storage model, which comes handy with its high-quality camera. The new A15 Bionic chip with 4GB RAM delivers reliable performance, and you have iOS 15 for power management and other features. The OLED display is great but you miss 120Hz refresh rate, the cameras are pretty good and so is the battery life. Having said that, basic things like headphone jack, memory card slot are missing. And you only have 20W charging support. Get the iPhone 13 if you have the budget and seek a phone with great camera.

Tecno Pova 5G is the company's first 5G phone in the market and it is mostly a mixed bag for our liking. It has a large 120Hz display but only with an IPS panel. It gets Dimensity 900 chipset with 8GB RAM that delivers quality performance, and offers expandable storage. However, the cameras are average for this price, so is the charging speed support for the large 6000mAh battery. Worth looking at other options for this price.

The Samsung Galaxy A23 5G is the latest mid-range smartphone that offers some interesting features. The handset is equipped with a premium design, which reminds us of Galaxy S-series. Moreover, the device packs some fascinating features and offers decent specifications like the Qualcomm Snapdragon 695 processor that is capable. The phone also features a large display with and features latest version of Android 13 operating system. Having said that, the phone is a terrific buy at this pricing.

The Infinix Hot 30i is a feature-packed smartphone that offers a excellent design, and a 6.6-inch IPS LCD 90Hz display. The handset is powered by Helio G37 SoC which can handle all the basic tasks. The phone also has a microSD card support. However, the device runs Android 12 OS and has only 10W charging support. If you are looking for a budget-oriented smartphone, then you can go for the Infinix Hot 30i, as you get good battery life and a 90Hz display.

The Realme 5 Pro is the contender for the best smartphone in the sub-Rs 15,000 price category in 2020. It has a stylish design with water splash resistance, a good quality bezel-less screen, an excellent set of cameras, fast performance, and long-lasting battery life. It even has a triple card slot and an in-box 20W fast charger. Want Android 10? The Realme 5 Pro will receive it as a software update in 2020. The only thing where Xiaomi phones are better than the Realme 5 Pro is in terms of software and UI design, although ColorOS doesn't throw as many ads as MIUI.

LG G8X ThinQ offers a dual-screen accessory, wherein the users can have a dual-screen experience. A magnetic connector is a useful addition for charging the phone. Also, it offers a wonderful gaming experience. The price of the device is on the higher side.

The Xiaomi Poco M2 is just a redesigned version of the Redmi 9 Prime. It does pack some exciting features such as an AI quad-camera setup, a large 5000mAh battery with 18W fast charging support. It does not feature NFC for the transfer of data. But overall, the pros outweigh the cons of this phone.

The Vivo Y73 2021 comes with a LCD display. The device offers decent hardware performance, considering that it is equipped with Helio G95 SoC. The phone sports a 64MP primary main camera. The device offers 33W fast charging support. However, note that the Y73 comes with a LCD panel, and it packs a 4000mAh battery. If the display panel and battery life aren't a concern for you, then you should get the Y73. The other option in this price range you could consider buying is the iQOO Z3.

OPPO F19s faces tough fight in the market, even though it gets a compact design. The hardware is average for the price, so are the main cameras at the back. You get AMOLED screen but lacks high refresh rate support. It get 6GB RAM by default with 128GB storage which can be expanded further. Android 11-based ColorOS fares well and the battery life should satisfy most users, especially with its 33W fast charging support. Loses out to better options in the market for us.

The iQOO Z7s 5G 8GB RAM smartphone impresses with its powerful performance, thanks to the Qualcomm Snapdragon 695 chipset and octa-core processor. The stunning 6.38-inch AMOLED display offers vibrant visuals, while the dual rear camera system captures impressive photos. With a long-lasting battery and expandable storage, it's a feature-packed device worth considering.

The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5 is a premium smartphone from Samsung which boasts an AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate. The device uses a Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 SoC which handles the multitasking with ease. The smartphone is thinner and lighter than the previous fold devices. It also offers a whole day battery life on a single charge. However, the device doesn't come with a charger in the box and it also lacks a microSD card slot. Overall, the Galaxy Z Fold 5 is a good device considering that you get a good display, capable cameras, and a great hardware.

The Google Pixel 8 showcases new and impressive AI capabilities, a brighter display, and a compact design. It lacks a telephoto lens, but its genuine macro mode sets it apart.  It is the best Android phone for users looking for pure UI experience and longest software support.
For the ones who are not completely drooled by the design, the Vivo Y95 is not an all-rounder. Although it has a beautiful outlook, the interior elements are mediocre.

The Vivo Z1x is a result of Vivo correcting the mistakes it did with the Vivo Z1Pro. The company has now used an AMOLED screen instead of an LCD panel, an under-display fingerprint reader instead of a rear-mounted one, a 48MP camera instead of a 16MP one, a USB Type-C port instead of a microUSB port, and improved fast charging speeds. The phone now has fast performance, bright and clear screen, good set of cameras, and long battery life. The only area we wish it was better at is the software design. FunTouch continues to be feature-rich but it needs to learn how to look good and behave well, and not mimic iOS' design.

Samsung Galaxy M51 gives you a big screen viewing experience and the Super AMOLED panel makes it even better. The hardware packed inside the phone is capable of delivering on all fronts. The snappers on board the phone let you click decent photos and the battery backup should help you coast through a day or even two. However, the phone's screen does not get high refresh rate support and features a notch instead of punch hole for the front camera.

The Samsung Galaxy A04 is the company's most recent low-cost smartphone aimed for consumers. The phone has a lovely appearance and outstanding performance. It has a MediaTek Helio P35 CPU, which is enough for daily use. Furthermore, despite the manufacturer's limited charging support, the battery backup is acceptable. Having saying that, the phone is a terrific value at this pricing.

The Samsung Galaxy M13 5G is the new entry-level 5G smartphone for the masses. The handset packs a decent design and offers reliable performance. It comes loaded with MediaTek Dimensity 700 chipset that goes well with daily usage. Moreover, the battery backup seems decent, though the company only provides 15W fast charging support. That said, the handset can be considered a good option in this price range.
The Moto E13 is a capable entry-level phone with a stylish design, average performance and a good UI. However, it charges slowly and offers lacklustre camera performance.

The Tecno Phantom V Fold impresses with its software, overall performance, and design. It offers a compelling option for those seeking a foldable phone without breaking the bank. It is a great deal for those who can't afford the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5.

The OnePlus Nord 3 5G is a strong contender for the best smartphone under Rs. 40,000 in India. It offers a bigger display, flagship-level performance, and capable cameras. The only drawbacks are the average ultra-wide camera and lack of a higher IP rating compared to some competitors. Despite a slightly higher price, it remains a great all-rounder for those seeking a feature-rich smartphone without breaking the bank.

The Redmi 6 Pro from Xiaomi is a decent budget offering. Its notched, Full HD+ display is great for content consumption, which benefits from having a large battery that lasts well through the day. The software is also clean with handy customization options. If 4K video recording is a must-have, you might be better off with the Redmi Note 5. For everything else, the Redmi 6 Pro should suffice.

The Vivo V15 is a mid-range phone for those who want to flaunt their style and post selfies on social media all day. It is a modern looking phone that can click quality selfiies all day, on a single charge, thanks to its long battery life and faster charging. It needs a price cut, though, to survive this cut-throat smartphone market.

The ASUS ROG Phone 3 turns out to be one of the top-notch phones out there. The game-centric features on the phone make it an excellent gaming device. Besides, the phone packs powerful hardware configuration, smooth display, and excellent software. One thing the phone lags when compared to its competitors is the camera. Apart from that, it is a perfect option for hardcore gamers.

The Samsung Galaxy M11 packs an excellent specs sheet considering its price range. It has a triple rear camera setup, a large 5000mAh battery with a 15W fast charging support, and Dolby Atmos, speakers. A better display quality would have made it a worthy contender in this price segment.

LG K42 ranks as a budget phone that has a few things going in its favour. Like the big screen is good for watching videos, and you have 64GB storage to download apps, keep photos clicked using the quad rear camera. The selfie camera does a good job for the price too. But in 2021, we expect a phone in this price range to pack a bigger battery, powerful hardware and definitely a minimum of 4GB RAM. Probably best to look at other options in the market.

Oppo A31 2020 gives you large screen entertainment with Corning Gorilla Glass protection. The triple rear cameras offer decent photos and the battery life is more than manageable. However, the phone's overall performance is a mixed-bag, it comes with old Android version and no fast charging support for the battery.

Vivo has added the Y31 2021 to its lineup in the mid-range segment but the overall features of the phone is a mixed-bag. While you get a big 6.58-inch Full HD+ screen, it does not support any high refresh rate. It runs on the latest Android 11 version with Snapdragon 662 chipset and 6GB RAM. You also get 128GB storage which is further expandable. But having a waterdrop notch design is a step down in the current market. Even the cameras offer you the bare minimum, while it's good to have long battery backup but only 18W fast charging. You will find better options out there for this price.

Motorola E7 Power is a device that offers a big screen with long battery backup. Everything else is there to make up the numbers. Yes, having the Helio G25 chipset is good for the money but only with 2GB RAM is not ideal anymore. And for a budget phone you need a dedicated memory card slot. The cameras are also basic but having USB Type C port is a welcome addition.

The Vivo X70 Pro is the premium smartphone from Vivo. The device has a 6.56-inch AMOLED display that has Full HD+ resolution. The device is powered by an octa-core Dimensity 1200 SoC. The smartphone has a 50MP quad-camera setup which takes some good images. The device has up to 12GB of RAM. However, the smartphone lacks expandable storage support and a 3.5mm headphone jack. If your priority is performance and cameras, then the Vivo X70 Pro is the ideal offering.

The Infinix Note 11s flaunts a 6.95-inch IPS LCD display. The display has a 120Hz refresh rate. The device offers decent performance, thanks to 6GB of RAM and Helio G96 SoC. The smartphone supports 33W fast charging. The camera performance on the device is average. Additionally, the handset has got a plastic back panel.  If you are looking to buy a new smartphone with an AMOLED display in a similar price range, you can consider Infinix Note 11 over the Infinix Note 11s. You still get a 33W fast charging and a 5,000mAh battery bundled with the Note 11 model. However, do keep in mind that the Note 11's display only supports a 60Hz refresh rate.

Samsung's Galaxy A03 Core is another Android Go phone that seeks your attention, especially for its price, but the overall features are just not impressive. It gets a big HD+ display with notch, the performance is manageable and you have cameras that just offer something. The battery life is good though. Still, not good enough for us to recommend.

Xiaomi Mi 11T Pro 5G is an excellent device in the Rs 44,000 price range. The device boasts a 6.67-inch AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate. The smartphone is powered by Snapdragon 888 SoC, which is aided with 8GB of RAM and 256GB of internal storage. The handset features a 108MP triple-camera setup, which takes some good images. The device supports 120W fast charging. However, the handset lacks a microSD card support and a 3.5mm audio jack. The Xiaomi 11T Pro 5G is a good smartphone that you should consider buying, as you get an AMOLED panel, 120W fast charging support, and decent cameras.

Samsung Galaxy A04s is a entry-level smartphone with plenty of upgrades compared to the Galaxy A04. Compared to its predecessor, the Samsung Galaxy A04s included a faster display, a more modern SoC, and an additional rear-facing camera. There is no 5G support, if you are fine with 4G LTE broadband connections, then Samsung A04s is recommended to buy.

The Galaxy J7 Max is yet another failed offering from Samsung in the J-series. The phone disappoints with its performance, and it clearly loses to its competitors in the under 10K price segment. There are a slew of smartphones that pack better specs than the J7 Max and that too with a lower price tag.

The Galaxy A80 is a pretty great phone but the price tag is a deterrent. The phone could have been a major player in its pricing segment if the processor had been a bit better. Still worth a look if a killer display and powerful camera capabilities are your main requirements.

The Realme C2 is a bit of a mixed bag. While the software is great, cameras perform well, and battery life is excellent, the use of a weak chipset results in a jittery experience. there is also just 2GB of RAM and 16GB of storage on the base variant, which can further hamper multitasking on this phone. The Realme C2 makes sense for those looking for a bare minimum Android smartphone. If you have the budget to go for the higher storage variant, just pick up the Redmi 7 instead.

Vivo Y20G is a mid-range phone that has few things going in its favour. It packs a big screen with Helio G80 chipset under the hood with 6GB RAM which is impressive. It is also one of the few phones to come with Android 11 out of the box. And yes, it gives out decent backup. However, the screen supports HD+ quality, with no high refresh rate on offer. It also carries waterdrop notch, the rear cameras are just about okay and for charging you have microUSB port which is not ideal these days.

The Asus ROG Phone 5s is an all-rounder gaming smartphone from Asus. The device flaunts a 6.78-inch OLED display that has Full HD+ resolution and a 144Hz refresh rate. The smartphone is powered by Snapdragon 888 Plus SoC which offers excellent performance. The handset supports up to 65W fast charging and it packs a 6,000mAh battery. It also has a 5G support, an in-display fingerprint sensor, and a 64MP triple-camera setup. In the Rs 50,000 price range, the ROG Phone 5s is a good device which you can consider buying.

Realme Narzo 50A is the mid-range offering by Realme that comes with a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display. The smartphone is powered by Helio G85 SoC. The device runs Android 11 out of the box. The phone however has only 256GB expandable storage support and a 60Hz refresh rate display. The camera performance on the device is average. The phone packs a massive 6000mAh battery. If you are looking for a good battery backup mobile with great performance, you can go for the Realme Narzo 50A.

Vivo X70 Pro 256GB is the variant with high storage on board. It gets an AMOLED display with high refresh rate support. The Dimensity 1200 SoC with 8GB RAM offers decent performance and heavy usage. The cameras are versatile and shoot well in low light. Even the front camera delivers quality. However, the storage is not expandable, and there is no headphone jack. The battery life is also average. Still has a lot going in its favour.

The Moto G51 5G sports a 6.8-inch AMOLED display. The device offers excellent performance, thanks to the Snapdragon 480 Plus SoC. The device's camera performance is average in low light conditions. The phone packs a 5,000mAh battery that offers longer battery life. The device also has a 5G support. However, the smartphone has slow charging speed. If you are looking for a 5G ready device, AMOLED display, and a longer battery life, Moto G51 5G is the ideal offering in Rs 15,000 price range.

The Tecno Spark 9 is an entry-level smartphone that can handle most of your daily activities. The phone is equipped with a large 6.6-inch display and offers decent internal storage, which is expandable as well. The phone also features a good battery backup, which can comfortably last one full day of charge.

The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra is a premium smartphone from Samsung that comes with a 6.8-inch AMOLED display. The screen offers a 120Hz refresh rate and it has a 1750 nits brightness. The handset packs 12GB of RAM and 512GB of internal storage. The device runs Android 12 OS with One UI 4.0 on top. The smartphone lacks a microSD card support though. The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra is an good smartphone that you can consider buying, as it offers a good hardware performance, and runs the latest Android OS version out of the box.

If you are looking for a good design, good display, good battery life, then you can consider purchasing the Galaxy A73. The performance of the device is great, thanks to the Qualcomm Snapdragon 778G chipset. But this smartphone comes with an AMOLED display, IP67 rating, which seems to be a good offering at this price segment.

The Nothing Phone 1 256GB model is apt for those who want big storage. The phone comes with a unique design language, which is a rarity in the smartphone market. The Glyph interface offers some interesting features that make it stand out from the crowd. However, the brand only offers 33W fast charging, and no charger is available in the box. That said, the phone is still a unique proposition in this price segment.

The new, reasonably priced Samsung Galaxy A53 5G on the market features a Super AMOLED 120Hz display. For the price, it has a new Exynos 1280 CPU but 6GB of RAM. Due to its IP67 certification and Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection, the phone's design is durable. The front camera is also effective, while the quad rear cameras provide versatility. Despite only supporting 25W fast charging, the battery life is good. Excellent phone, however, there are better alternatives in this price range.

The Itel S23 impresses with its sleek design, powerful camera setup, and ample storage space. Pros include the 50 MP primary camera, 8 GB RAM, and expandable storage. However, the device could benefit from a higher screen resolution and a faster charging option.

The Samsung Galaxy A7 is a decent contender in the budget segment of the market. There are a few shortcomings, but the phone is still a decent package overall. Since there are better options to consider at this price point, we will recommend you grab a Galaxy A7 if you get it a reasonable discount.

The Samsung Galaxy M21 128GB version offers a massive 6000mAh battery that offers great battery life for all your requirements. Samsung bundles 15W charger with device, but you have various options to buy phones with 30W fast charging at this price range. The Super AMOLED screen offers vivid, clear viewing of the pictures and videos.

Samsung Galaxy M01 Core gets a HD+ display, runs on the Android 10 Go edition and comes packed with a 3,000mAh battery. However, the phone only comes with 1GB of RAM and 16GB of storage. Also, the phone does not feature a rear fingerprint sensor or LED flash on the back camera. Strictly meant for basic mobile usage.

Samsung launched the Galaxy S20 FE few weeks back, and now you have the 256GB variant of the same phone. It packs a large Super AMOLED screen, with punch hole design and support for high refresh rate. It has Exynos 9 octa-core chipset with 8GB RAM which is good enough for most people. The triple rear camera pack a punch with its versatility, and the selfie camera does a good job too. The screen gets Corning Gorilla Glass 3 protection only, it has hybrid SIM slot for storage expansion, misses out on headphone jack and the built-in battery only supports 25W charging at this price.

The OnePlus Nord CE 5G 8GB RAM comes with a 6.43-inch AMOLED display. The device offers top-notch performance thanks to Snapdragon 750G chipset. However, the device has average cameras. If you are in the market for a cleaner Android software experience and an AMOLED screen phone, you should get the Nord CE 5G in this price range. However, don't expect some decent camera performance from the Nord CE 5G.

The Tecno Phantom X boasts a 6.4-inch AMOLED display that offers Full HD+ resolution. Thanks to the Helio G95 SoC and 8GB of RAM the device offers flawless performance. The smartphone features a 50MP triple-camera setup which takes some good images. It packs a 4,700mAh battery which supports 33W fast charging. The device still runs Android 11 OS out of the box. Additionally, the handset is costlier compared to the competition. If you are looking for the same specifications such as AMOLED display, good hardware, and fast charging, you can consider Redmi Note 11 Pro Plus, Poco M4 Pro, etc.
Vivo Y21T is priced higher than what it should in the market, and that itself is a good reason to skip considering the model.

The Redmi Note 11S boasts a 6.43-inch AMOLED display. The display offers up to 90Hz refresh rate and it has a Full HD+ resolution.
