Thanks to the Helio G96 processor and up to 6GB of RAM, the device offers decent performance. The smartphone features a 108MP quad-camera setup, which takes good images. Additionally, the device offers long-lasting battery life and it has 33W fast charging support. The handset lacks 5G support though and it runs the Android 11 OS version. Overall, the Redmi Note 11S is a good smartphone, as you get a AMOLED display, decent performance, and up to 33W fast charging support.

The Samsung Galaxy S22 is a flagship smartphone from Samsung that boasts a 6.1-inch AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate. The device offers excellent performance, thanks to Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 SoC and 8GB of RAM. It runs Android 12 OS with One UI 4.0 on top. The smartphone however lacks a microSD card support and it supports 25W fast charging. Overall, the Galaxy S22 is an excellent smartphone which you can consider buying, as it offers a brighter 120Hz AMOLED display, good hardware performance, and runs the latest Android OS version out of the box.

The Moto G14 is a sucessor to the last year's Moto G13 smartphone. The G14 comes with a 6.5-inch display that has a Full HD+ resolution. The device runs Android 13 out of the box with stock Android UI on top. It also has a microSD card slot and a 20W fast charging support. However, the phone offers mediocre performance, and it comes in only 4GB RAM option. Additionally, it lacks 5G support. At a price of Rs 9,999, the Moto G14 is a good option for those looking for a smartphone with clean software, a good display, and 20W fast charging. If you are considering some alternative in the similar price range, then with bank offers, the Redmi 12 5G and Poco M6 Pro 5G are also worth considering.

The Realme Narzo 60 5G impresses with its overhauled design and vibrant Super AMOLED display. The upgraded 64MP camera and MediaTek Dimensity 6020 processor offer good performance. However, it lacks stereo speakers and an IP rating, and comes with preinstalled apps and bloatware.
The Vivo Y91 is a fitting choice for the ones who want a stylish phone under budget pricing. However, when it comes to overall performance and hardware, there are better alternatives.
The Y9 Prime (2019) is a good phone in general, but there are definitely alternatives in the smartphone market offering more in terms of value for money.

The OPPO Reno 2 is a higher mid-range phone that focusses on cameras, performance, and style. There's a notch-less Super AMOLED screen for excellent gaming and video watching experience but lacks HDR10. The sharkfin-style pop-up selfie camera looks ultra-stylish and the in-display fingerprint reader is quite fast. The quad-rear cameras capture excellent still images in all types of conditions. The 4000mAh battery lasts long, too, and the 20W VOOC fast charging only helps it even further. While the Snapdragon 730G is no slouch in performance, we wish the company had offered the Snapdragon 855 inside the Reno 2, especially for its price.

The Infinix Hot 8 offers good value for money and the battery life is a big plus. Infinix is able to match the features offered by the more popular brands in the budget segment and in some cases even surpass them. Definitely a worthy option to look at when buying a phone in the budget segment.
The Redmi 8A is a good value for money phone that is great for someone who is looking for something that is purely functional.

Oppo Reno 4 Pro has all the attributes of a quality smartphone. It packs an AMOLED display with 90Hz refresh rate and Corning Gorilla Glass 6. It runs on ColorOS version based on Android 10, features decent set of front and rear cameras and the 65W fast charging backs up the 4,000mAh battery. However, for this price, the phone comes powered by a mid-range chipset which is not ideal.

Realme C12 is a solid workhorse with its 6,000mAh battery that will deliver more than a day's battery life. It sports a large display which is ideal for entertainment on-the-go. The phone runs on the Android 10-based Realme UI and features a triple rear camera setup. However, it does not get fast charging support and the hardware offers average performance. Ideally meant for heavy users, who'd prefer to have the battery last really long.

Realme Narzo 20 Pro gives you 65W fast charging support, the fastest in the segment. It packs a 6.5-inch Full HD display and powered by octa-core Helio G95 processor with 6GB RAM. The storage is expandable and the camera setup on the front and back do a decent job. But at this price, the phone's display offers no high refresh rate and the battery life is average at best.

The Moto G 5G is one of the affordable 5G phones in the market right now, powered by the Snapdragon 750G chipset. It sports a large display, packs triple cameras at the back, and a quality selfie camera. Even the 5,000mAh battery offers decent backup. Having said that, it only has 4GB RAM, the display does not support high refresh rate, and you only have a hybrid SIM slot. For this price, you get some good features but you miss some basic ones as well.

OnePlus 9R 256GB is the cheapest in the brand's 9-series and sports pretty exciting features under the hood. The smartphone flaunts an impressive 6.55-inches Fluid AMOLED display, quad rear camera setup (48MP+16MP+5MP+2MP), and offers impressive performance aided by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 870 chipset coupled with 12GB of RAM. The device is backed by a 4500mAh battery with 65W Warp charge support. On the downside, the smartphone does not support expandable memory and is also devoid of a 3.5mm headphone jack.

The Reliance Jio Phone is an entry-level soft-touch keypad phone that comes in black color. The device has navigational keys below the display. The soft-touch-keypad phone from Jio features a good battery and internal storage of 4GB.

The Xiaomi Mi 11i HyperCharge comes with a 6.67-inch AMOLED display. The display panel has Full HD+ resolution and 1200 nits brightness. The cameras on the device take some good images. Additionally, the handset offers excellent performance thanks to Dimensity 920 processor. The smartphone has 120W fast charging support. The Xiaomi Mi HyperCharge is a good phone, considering that it offers 120W fast charging support, an AMOLED panel, and a 108MP triple-camera setup.

Despite focusing more on its display, the Moto G82 can perform decently when used casually, but optics isn't its forte. Its price of Rs. 21,490 puts it up against the Redmi Note 11 Pro+ and the Realme 9 Pro Plus.

The Nothing Phone 1 12GB RAM variant is ideal for folks who experience the top-end experience. The phone has a distinct design language, which is unusual in the smartphone market. The Glyph interface has numerous unique characteristics that set it apart from the crowd. However, the brand only provides 33W fast charging, and there is no charger included in the box. Having said that, the phone remains a one-of-a-kind offering in this price range.

The I Kall K350 Pro is a cost-effective smartphone from the I Kall. The phone features a 4000mAh battery, 3GB of RAM, and a large display as well, making it perfect for daily usage. It is difficult to estimate how well the phone will work due to its unknown processor and old Android version. As a consequence, before purchasing this smartphone, consider your options.

The Realme Narzo N55 is a solid budget phone with a 90Hz display, 64MP camera, and fast charging. However, it lacks an ultra-wide lens, 5G support, and has bloatware. Alternatives to consider in this price range are the Infinix Note 11 and Samsung Galaxy F13.

The Vivo Y02T offers a great balance of performance and style. Its 6.5-inch display delivers vibrant visuals, while the 13 MP rear camera captures detailed photos. With a powerful battery and fast charging support, it keeps up with your daily tasks. A reliable choice for those seeking a budget-friendly smartphone.

Vivo V29 impresses with its vibrant AMOLED screen,  main camera, and superfast charging. Though minor trade-offs like a smaller battery and single speaker are noticeable, its robust performance, customizable software, and stylish design cater to those seeking both flair and functionality.

It is hard to recommend the Vivo Y91 when the Redmi 7 offers significantly better performance at the same price point. While both phones offer comparable battery life, the Redmi 7 pulls ahead by also offering better cameras. You even get an IR blaster with Xioami's offering.

The ASUS ROG Phone 2 is one of the best Android phones available in the market now, from a specs and value for money point of view. It's surprising how much is packed into the device, given its price tag. The only thing stopping the ROG Phone 2 from being the best phone is the camera, which could easily get beat by some flagship devices. But in the grand scheme of things, that's a minor issue. The ASUS ROG Phone 2 is a no-brainer if you're looking for a good gaming phone. Or a great phone, in general.
The Vivo U10 is a stellar phone when you consider all the specs and features it offers at its price. It is definitely one of the best phones in the sub-10k bracket.

Xiaomi Redmi 8A Dual is the ideal budget device with a large display, big capacity battery and powered by an effective Snapdragon processor. It comes with USB Type C port which is an added bonus for the price and the battery supports 18W fast charging.

Realme C15 gets a mammoth 6,000mAh battery that supports 18W fast charging. The phone features a HD+ display with Corning Gorilla Glass 3 for protection and powered by Helio G35 processor from MediaTek. Having said that, the phone only gets 3GB of RAM and microUSB port for charging.

The Vivo Y51A is the latest mid-range offering from the brand. The handset ships with a tall 6.58-inches display with 401ppi pixel density. The smartphone includes a triple camera array on the rear (48MP+8MP+2MP) and a single 16MP selfie camera for photography enthusiasts. On the flip side, the mid-range device packs an IPS LCD and also it is powered by the average Qualcomm Snapdragon 662 processor.

Asus ROG Phone 5 is a hard-core gaming phone that provides you with the later hardware in the market. You get a big screen with support for 144Hz refresh rate for smoother gaming experience. Corning Gorilla Glass Victus gives the phone protection and running Android 11 makes it ideal. The cameras are decent but the long battery backup along with 65W charging is a sweet deal for this price. However, the storage is not expandable, the design looks boring now and wireless charging was expected at this price.

Asus ROG Phone 5 Ultimate is also hard-core gaming phone and the first to get 18GB RAM in the market. You get a big screen with support for 144Hz refresh rate for smoother gaming experience. Corning Gorilla Glass Victus gives the phone protection on both sides and running Android 11 makes it ideal. The cameras are decent but the long battery backup along with 65W charging is a sweet deal for this price. You get a whopping 512GB storage but the design looks boring now and wireless charging is a must-have at this price range.

Realme C11 2021 runs on Android 11 Go version which is why it only gets 2GB RAM. The cameras on both sides are basic, and you will get normal daily work done on the device. It offers a big HD+ screen along with a big capacity battery for long backup. You get 32GB storage that is further expandable. This phone caters to select users, who need a basic smartphone for regular tasks. Not meant for heavy users. Better to skip this one.

OnePlus 9 Pro 256GB is an impressive device that delivers a premium experience. With a 6.77-inches Fluid AMOLED display, users get to enjoy an impressive visual experience. The camera configuration is robust, with a quad-camera setup on the rear (48MP+50MP+8MP+2MP) and a 16MP selfie camera. The performance is top-notch, thanks to the Qualcomm Snapdragon 888 chipset paired with 12GB of RAM. Rounding off, the phone gets power from the 4500mAh battery that supports a 65W Warp charge. The cons include no support for expandable memory and its bulkiness weighing 197 grams.

This variant of the Realme GT Master Edition 5G comes with 8GB RAM and 256GB storage for under Rs 30,000. The device features a Super AMOLED high refresh rate display, powered by Snapdragon 778G chipset, and packs triple rear cameras that support versatile shooting. The battery lets you charge at 65W speed as well. However, the screen and hardware takes a toll on the small-ish battery, and the storage is non-expandable. Capable device worth going for.

The Realme C31 is an entry-level offering from Realme which comes with a 6.5-inch HD+ display. The device is powered by a Unisoc T612 processor which offers average performance. The device still runs Android 11 out of the box. A 5,000mAh battery is equipped with a device that offers long-lasting battery life. The smartphone supports only 10W charging. If you are looking for a big-screen display, long-lasting battery life, and 4G, then you can consider the Realme C31. However, do note that you will have to compromise on software version, 10W charging, and mediocre chipset.

The Xiaomi Redmi 10 is an entry-level handset from Xiaomi which features a 6.7-inch HD+ display. Thanks to Snapdragon 680 SoC and 6GB of RAM, the handset offers lag-free performance. The smartphone features a 50MP main camera at the back. Keeping the lights on there is a 6,000mAh battery which can easily last throughout the day. If you are particularly looking for a bigger display device with good battery life, them the Redmi 10 is the device which you can consider buying. However, you will have to compromise on HD+ panel, 18W fast charging and Android 11 version.

POCO X4 Pro uses the snapdragon 695 processor with 6GB RAM for excellent performance. The cameras are decent and you get an adequate battery life with a 67W fast charging feature. The smartphone misses Android 12 and a hybrid storage slot.

The Moto G52 128GB option brings a good mix of power and stability at this price point. The smartphone comes loaded with a reliable Snapdragon processor and you also get business-grade ThinkShield security for added protection. The phone offers a sleek design language, which makes it one of the best options under the Rs 15,000 price segment.

The Realme GT Neo 3 150W is one of the first smartphones in India that have brought ultra-fast charging technology. The phone comes with a whopping 150W fast charging support that the company claims can charge the device up to 50 per cent in just 5 minutes. The smartphone also comes with gaming-centric features like GT Mode 3.0, vapour cooling system, up to 1000Hz touch sampling rate, Tactile Engine 2.0, and more. The smartphone comes loaded with the latest MediaTek Dimensity 8100 processor that provides flagship-grade performance in every department. That said, if you are looking for a flagship smartphone with an ultra-fast charging solution, then Realme GT Neo 3 150W is one of the best options you can get on the market.

The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 is the best innovation from the South Korean smartphone maker. The handset not only offers flagship-grade features and specifications, but it also comes with a unique folding mechanism that has redefined the smartphone industry. The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 is one of the best options you can get currently if pricing is not an issue for you.

The Motorola Edge 30 Ultra 256GB model is probably the best offering from Motorola right now. The phone packs a premium design and offers a vivid display. It also delivers flagship-grade specifications and offers some great camera features. The model offers state-of-the-art features and the latest specifications that make it a worthy competitor to consider in this price segment.

The Redmi Note 12 6GB RAM is a modest upgrade over the Redmi Note 11. The smartphone packs a new design language and offers good performance in this price segment. You get a 120Hz AMOLED display along with a 5G chipset that offers decent performance. The phone also packs a 33W fast charging, which is a good addition. Overall, if you are looking for a reliable option under Rs 20,000 price segment, then consider this device.

The POCO C51 is a budget-friendly option with impressive battery life, a vibrant display, and solid build. However, its average performance and camera capabilities might be limiting. For better low-light image quality and system performance, consider the Moto E13, which also features a USB Type-C port.

The Vivo T2 5G 8GB RAM offers an AMOLED display with 90Hz refresh rate and a 44W fast charging feature that charges 50% of the battery in just 25secs. However, it lacks an ultra-wide camera and has poor night shots, along with the presence of bloatware. Consider alternatives like iQOO Z7 5G or OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite.

The Vivo Y16 128GB offers a decent overall package with its reliable performance, impressive camera system, and ample storage capacity. The long-lasting battery ensures uninterrupted usage. However, the lack of fast charging along with a lower display resolution, are minor drawbacks to consider.

The OPPO A55 4G 4GB RAM offers a stylish design, a large immersive display, and an impressive camera setup. With smooth performance and efficient multitasking, it caters to everyday usage. However, the low screen resolution and lack of fast charging may be drawbacks for some users. Overall, it delivers a reliable smartphone experience.

The Samsung Galaxy M34 is a reliable option for individuals seeking a smartphone that caters to their daily needs. With its long-lasting battery life and smooth 120Hz refresh rate, the Galaxy M34 offers a competitive and good user experience.

The iPhone 15 Pro Max offers the same upgrades as that of the iPhone 15 Pro, except that it features a pericope telephoto lens with 5x zoom. The device features a titanium design, an A17 Pro chipset, a USB-C port, and an Action button. Though it is costlier, it offers several new upgrades compared to last year's iPhone 14 Pro Max.

The iPhone 15 Pro is a step behind the Pro Max, mainly due to a lack of an upgraded zoom lens. However, it offers the potent A17 Pro chip, a sleek titanium design, USB-C, flagship performance, and the useful Action button. It's a welcome upgrade from the iPhone 14 Pro for those seeking a smaller phone with premium features.

The Apple iPhone 5s packs decent features at its current pricing. The phone is still eligible for getting iOS updates. If you want to buy an Apple iPhone under tight budget, then the iPhone 5s is still be a good buy.

The Redmi note 5 in a much-needed upgrade over the Redmi Note 4. The large display with minimal bezels certainly helps with the viewing experience. While there were a few UI hiccups, the overall performance was still decent. The phone is indeed well worth its price. However, a few thousand Rupees more will get you the Redmi Note 5 Pro which offers a much better deal.

The Redmi 6A is a decent upgrade over the Redmi 5A. As far as entry-level smartphones go, the Redmi 6A is a smartphone worth considering for those who are looking for exceptional battery life. The cameras on this device also perform surprisingly well in bright conditions.

The Redmi Y3 undoubtedly delivers impressive selfie performance for a phone at this price. It also boasts a tremendous battery life. If these are the most important features for you, then you can certainly buy this phone. However, if you desire a more balanced handset then go with the Redmi Note 7. You can even save yourself some money and get pretty much all the same features as the Y3 with the Redmi 7.

The Realme 3i offers a unique look with matte finish paint. While its screen resolution appears low, it also serves as an advantage in terms of battery life as the Helio P70 doesn't have to push as many pixels to drive the HD screen. Its cameras are nothing to write home about and the phone still uses the old microUSB port for charging. At least it comes with dedicated microUSB and dual SIM card slots and it will receive the Android 10 upgrade in 2020. Realme 3i is not a bad phone but it doesn't get our whole-hearted recommendation either.

Oppo A11K is a budget phone that packs a HD+ display and comes with a dual rear camera setup. However, for the price, the software is riddled with bloatware, the hardware lacks performance and in 2020, the phone comes running Android 9.0 version out of the box.

Oppo A52 4GB RAM is a decent phone that comes in handy for a regular user. The phone packs a stylish design, feature-rich OS, large 5000mAh battery with 18W fast charging support. On the downside, the phone equips a Snapdragon 665 processor that offers moderate performance. But given the price point, one can look at other available options.

Infinix Hot 10 64GB comes with a classic design and sports a tall display. The phone does ship with a better chipset over its predecessors, leading to improved performance. If the phone happens to be priced slightly lower, it would have been an ideal pick in the budget segment.

The Realme Narzo 30 5G comes equipped with an octa-core Dimensity 700 SoC. The phone features a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display. It has a great battery life, thanks to a massive 5000mAh battery equipped in. The device however offers 18W charging support. The cameras are average. If you want good hardware, long battery life, but can adjust with average cameras and 18W charging support, then you can go for the Realme Narzo 30 5G.

Realme GT Master Edition comes with a 6.43-inch AMOLED display. The phone offers excellent hardware performance thanks to the Snapdragon 778G processor and 8GB of RAM. The device runs Android 11 out of the box. However, the phone misses out on expandable storage support and has average battery life. You can go for Realme GT Master Edition in Rs 30,000 price range, as the device offers value for money.

Apple launched the iPhone 13 Mini this year with 256GB storage model that features OLED Retina display, powered by A15 Bionic chip with 4GB RAM. The cameras still give a tough fight to premium Android phones, and the battery life improves thanks to its compact size and power management. However, the screen misses out on high refresh rate, there is no headphone jack or memory card slot. And 20W fast charging at this price is not good. Want a compact iPhone with new hardware? This is your best pick.

Poco M4 Pro 5G is the successor to the M3 Pro in the market, and uses the new Dimensity 810 SoC but with 4GB RAM means you get basic performance. Even the internal 64GB storage isn't enough, especially since the device only has a hybrid card slot. The cameras are decent and you get adequate battery life with 33W fast charging. However, the phone misses out on an AMOLED panel and gets Android 11 OS.

The Redmi 11 Prime delivers a good performance for its asking price. The camera works fine in a day-light environment but performs poorly in low-light conditions. The device has a 90Hz display and good battery life which might be a good thing for budget buyers. The Redmi 11 Prime is a good option, but we feel you can find a better phone in this price segment.

The OnePlus Nord 2 CE 5G comes with a 6.43-inch AMOLED display that has Full HD+ resolution and 90Hz refresh rate. Thanks to the Dimensity 900 SoC and 8GB of RAM, the device offers excellent performance. The smartphone features a 64MP triple-camera setup, which takes some good images. The device has up to 65W fast charging support. Overall, the Nord 2 CE 5G is a good phone, which you should consider buying if your budget is Rs 25,000.

The iPhone SE 2022 features a 4.7-inch IPS LCD display. The display panel lacks a higher refresh rate and it has a HD resolution. The device is powered by A15 Bionic chipset which offers excellent performance. The handset flaunts a single 12MP rear and 7MP front camera. The design of this newer generation iPhone SE hasn't changed much compared to the previous iPhone SE. It still retains the Touch ID and has thick bezels around the display. The device offers a long-lasting battery life and has 5G support. If you are looking for a 5G device with the compact form factor and excellent hardware then you can consider buying the iPhone SE.

The OnePlus 10 Pro is probably one of the best OnePlus flagship smartphones to date. The top-end variant of the OnePlus 10 Pro is less expensive than its competition, like Galaxy S22 or iPhone 13. The phone offers a fantastic 120HZ AMOLED LTPO 2.0 display coupled with a top-notch Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 processor and ultra-fast charging support. The handset comes with flagship-grade cameras, the best we have seen in any OnePlus phone. Overall, the OnePlus 10 Pro is a worthy contender for the best Android smartphone of the year.

Nokia offers a new soft-touch keypad mobile in Blue and Charcoal colors. The Nokia 105 2022 mobile's keypad is below the screen and offers soft-touch keys. It offers a good battery and gets an infrared sensor at this budget price.

The Infinix Smart 7 is a low-cost device from Infinix. It boasts a 6.6-inch HD+ resolution IPS LCD display. The Unisoc SC9863A chipset, which provides mediocre performance, powers the gadget. The smartphone has 4GB of Memory and 64GB of internal storage. If you want a large-display smartphone with a long battery life, the Infinix Smart 7 is a good option. But keep in mind that you will have to make sacrifices in terms of charging and the outdated Android version.

Tecno Camon 19 Neo is a decent option that comes with a good selfie camera. The front-facing sensor is capable of taking some selfies in daylight. Moreover, the device also features a large display and comes with a MediaTek Helio G85 processor, which delivers stable day-to-day performance. Apart from this, the handset also packs a good battery backup. So, if you are looking for a stylish smartphone under the Rs 15,000 price segment, you can consider Tecno Camon 19 Neo.

The iQOO 9T 5G is probably one of the best options you can get in this price segment. The handset is loaded with flagship hardware and offers some great display that makes it good smartphone for gaming. It also offers one of the fastest charging technologies available in the market and comes with a premium design. Overall, if you are for a flagship smartphone that can offer great gaming experience, then you can easily consider iQOO 9T 5G.

In this pricing bracket, the Vivo Y02 is an intriguing option. The smartphone has some basic specs, but its appearance sets it apart from the pack. So, if you want a sleek smartphone that can manage most of your everyday chores, try the Vivo Y02 model.

To conclude, the Apple iPhone 14 Plus 256GB model is surely a great addition to the iPhone series. The phone offers a large display, which makes it a wonderful experience to play games or watch videos. The phone is powered by one of the fastest chipsets in the industry that delivers exceptional performance in all aspects. Moreover, the iPhone also has great camera features, making it one of the most desirable smartphones in 2022.

The Vivo Y16 is yet another budget-centric smartphone from Vivo. The model has some interesting features and specifications, making it a compelling option in this price range. The Vivo Y16 is a dependable performer that can easily meet your multitasking needs thanks to its basic level of setup. In addition, the smartphone boasts a respectable camera setup, a long-lasting battery, and an amazing user experience powered by Android v12 OS.

The Realme 10 Pro+ has focused on the display factor and introduced the Dimensity 1080 SoC to this price segment. The device runs well in our day-to-day usage, but we noticed a disparity in the refresh rate in certain apps. On the other hand, the cameras are decent and click detailed photos, and it has support for fast charging, up to 65W.

The Realme 10 Pro+ has focused on the display factor and introduced the Dimensity 1080 SoC to this price segment. The device runs well in our day-to-day usage, but we noticed a disparity in the refresh rate in certain apps. On the other hand, the cameras are decent and click detailed photos, and it has support for fast charging, up to 65W.

The Realme C55 is an excellent offering for budget buyers at a starting price of Rs 10,999. It comes with a good quality 90Hz display which produces good colours. The 64-megapixel camera works surprisingly well, and the full-day battery life is always commendable. However, it falls short on day-to-day usage, which is something that should be fixed via an update.

The Samsung Galaxy M14 5G offers impressive battery life and performance for a mid-range smartphone, and its support for 13 5G bands, Voice Focus feature, and Widevine L1 support make it a great deal. Plus, the camera takes good quality pictures in proper lighting, perfect for social media sharing.

Priced at under Rs 30,000, the Realme Narzo 60 Pro 5G is an excellent smartphone which comes with an AMOLED display. The display panel has a 120Hz refresh rate. The smartphone comes with an octa-core Dimensity 7020 SoC and it also has a 100MP primary camera which captures excellent photos. However, the smartphone lacks an ultra-wide lens, a 3.5mm audio jack, and IP rating. If you are primarily looking for a smartphone with a good display, performance, and faster charging, then Realme Narzo 60 5G is worth considering.

The Samsung Galaxy A7 (2018) is the Korean giant's first attempt at a device loaded with three rear camera lenses. While these sensors do offer greater versatility, the overall performance is quite inconsistent. The CPU and graphical performance are also not up to the mark, especially when compared to more affordable offerings loaded with Snapdragon 660 chipsets. The nail in the coffin is the absence of fast charge. Unless you absolutely need the rear wide angle lens, you might be better off with one of the various other offerings at this price point.

The Vivo Y81 is not worth the money. It isn't even worth half its price. It lacks behind its competitors in almost every aspect. Its display has lower resolution. There is no dual-camera setup. It has an ugly-looking UI. The battery capacity is also less than other smartphones in the price range. For Rs. 11,999, you can get way better smartphones than the Vivo Y81.

The Redmi Note 7 is undeniably the best phone in its category despite MIUI being filled with incredibly annoying ads. The phone completely overshadows its competition with its superior design and incredible performance. With this phone, Xiaomi regains its reputation as a market disrupter. The only problem here is the phone's availability as flash sales seem to end in seconds, and even most Mi Home stores seem to run out of stock. The phone is definitely worth the buy if you manage to get your hands on one.
The Oppo F11 is a decent all-rounder, but one could find some better camera, processor, and display options on other phones.

The Xiaomi Redmi Note 9 Pro Max flaunts a 6.67-inch IPS LCD display. The display panel has Full HD+ resolution. The device ships with 6GB of RAM and a Snapdragon 720G processor which offers excellent performance. The handset packs a 5020mAh battery that can last throughout the day. The smartphone also supports 33W fast charging. However, the display supports a 60Hz refresh rate and the MIUI software still includes a lot of bloatware.  You can go for the Redmi Note 9 Pro Max if you for looking to buy a smartphone with a big display and a long-lasting battery life.

Vivo Y12s is the upgraded variant of the Vivo Y12; the device sports a tall 6.51-inches display. It comes with a standard 3GB RAM and 32GB internal storage. It packs a dual rear camera setup (13MP+2MP) and a single 8MP selfie camera. Although the device packs a large battery capacity of 5000mAh, it does not support fast-charging. In a nutshell, the smartphone is a value for money device.

Vivo V20 is one of the first non-Google phone to come with Android 11 version out of box. The phone sports an AMOLED screen that comes without high refresh rate support. The hardware is average for the price, but you have 8GB RAM with 256GB storage that is further expandable. The cameras on both the sides deliver to the promise and the battery gets 33W fast charging. Also, it does not have NFC. Decent phone with heavy competition in the market.

The Apple iPhone 12 is very similar to the iPhone 12 Mini, and it differs only concerning screen size. A standard battery backs up the phone with 20W fast-charging support. Also, the phone supports wireless charging technology. The lack of a fingerprint sensor and non-expandable storage are certainly drawbacks.

The Realme Narzo 30 comes equipped with an octa-core Helio G95 SoC. The phone offers a triple-camera setup that takes some good images. The selfie camera on the device is of 16MP. The phone houses a massive 5000mAh battery that has 30W charging support. However, the device comes equipped with an IPS LCD panel. The Realme Narzo 30 is a go-to offering if you are looking for decent performance, cameras, and satisfactory battery life.

Tecno Spark 7 Pro features a 6.6-inch HD+ display that has a smooth 90Hz refresh rate. This latest budget phone run Android 11 out of the box. It comes powered by an octa-core Helio G80 SoC, and packs 6GB RAM for excellent performance. The 5,000mAh battery offers a long backup. But you only get 10W charging support.

The Redmi 10A seems to be a well-balanced device. The phone tries to give a premium look and feel, which is a good thing in this price segment. The device also features an octa-core MediaTek Helio G25 processor that can deliver stable performance. Moreover, the phone offers a large 6.53-inch display that is enough for watching video content comfortably.

The Galaxy A12 comes with a 6.5-inch display. The device is powered by Exynos 850 processor, which can handle all the basic tasks. The handset sports a 48MP quad-cameras. The device packs a 5,000mAh battery which offers good battery backup. However, the charging speed on the device is limited to 15W only. In the same price range, we recommend you to check for Poco M3, Redmi Note 9, and Realme 7, considering that these offer better specifications than the A12.

Xiaomi Redmi Note 10S gives you good value for the price. The phone sports an AMOLED display, with punch hole design, powered by Helio G95 chipset with 8GB RAM. It offers expandable storage, runs on Android 11 and has quality quad rear cameras. The battery life is also good with 33W fast charging supported. Worth buying.

The Samsung Galaxy M53 8GB model sure seems to be an interesting option in this price segment. The handset comes with a premium design language and offers 108MP-backed triple rear cameras that can deliver some excellent shots in daylight. The phone also offers a reliable 5G chipset that handles most of the daily tasks and provides 5G connectivity. However, the company is still providing 25W fast charging support at a time when the competition is offering 60W+ fast charging in this similar price segment.

The Realme GT Neo 3T packs a punch. The device offers some really good features and specifications for the price point. You are getting the flagship-grade performance and high-grade cameras with this one. Moreover, the phone also packs 80W of fast charging, which is one of the fastest charging technology available currently in the market. Overall, it is a good choice for those who want a gaming-centric smartphone in the mid-range segment.

The Infinix Zero 5G 2023 Turbo offers impressive specifications like good processor, excellent primary camera and decent battery life. If you're looking for a smartphone with strong performance and solid specifications at an affordable price point, the Infinix Zero 5G 2023 Turbo is a solid choice.

The Samsung Galaxy A34 5G packs an impressive set of features, including a Super AMOLED display and 5G connectivity for high-speed internet access. The phone's IP67 rating ensures that it's durable enough to handle everyday wear and tear. On the downside, the device's plastic frame and lack of a 3.5mm audio jack may not appeal to everyone. Additionally, the charging speed of 25W might not be the quickest on the market. All in all, the Samsung Galaxy A34 5G is a solid option for those looking for a phone with top-notch display and fast connectivity.

The Galaxy Z Fold 5 refines its predecessor's rough edges, boasting a gap-free, less visible crease, and minimal inner bezels. Though the tall outer screen may not suit all preferences, its 2023 flagship power, stylus support, and extensive multitasking options make it a top-notch productivity device. If budget is not a constrain, and you are looking to buying an innovative foldable phone, Galaxy Z Fold 5 is a great option.

The Tecno Pova 5 Pro 5G, priced at Rs. 15,000, offers style and budget-friendliness. It features a reliable Dimensity 6080 chipset, 120Hz display, and strong battery life with 5G support. However, there's no AMOLED display or ultrawide/macro lens in the camera setup. Despite these minor drawbacks, it's a solid choice for affordable gaming.
The Samsung Galaxy M40 is a decent mid-range device but it can't hold its own against competitors like Realme X or even Samsung's very own Galaxy A50.

Nokia 2720 Flip phone is made of cheap plastic. The phone with large numeric keys offers an ideal for senior citizens for easy dialing. The camera's positioning is yet another flaw as it gets covered while you try to take a picture. Overall, the phone is a bit overpriced, and you get plenty of available options in the Android smartphone segment at the same price point.

The Realme 6 Pro brings the features that we are used to seeing in the upper mid-range smartphone to the lower mid-range price bracket. The quad-camera setup at the rear, especially, is a show stopper. It features a 64MP primary camera, something that even the flagships like OnePlus 8 don't offer, a proper telephoto camera, which I think is the first in the segment, and an 8MP ultrawide sensor. The front camera setup is no slouch; you get a 16MP main sensor and an 8MP ultrawide unit. Then comes the silky-smooth 90Hz display, a first in the segment. And to drive the screen, the powerful Snapdragon 720G SoC. To top things off you get the fastest charging in the segment  -  30 watts  -  to quickly recharge the large 4300mAh battery pack.

The Realme 7i offers a 90 HZ display and has a 64MP primary camera, making it an exciting prospect at this price segment. It packs a 5000mAh battery with 18W fast-charging support. It lags when it comes to low-light camera performance. The phone is a worthy contender for an affordable mid-range segment.

Nokia 225 2020 is a basic phone and is ideal for those looking for 4G support at a low price. It also has expandable memory support of up to 32GB for storing user data and files. On the downside, a 0.3MP camera and poor battery life are its cons. Overall, the phone is priced a bit higher as compared to its specifications.

Infinix is offering a decent set of features with the Smart HD 2021, especially for its price. You get a large screen with support for HD+ resolution and Android 10 out of box. The phone packs an octa-core chipset with 2GB RAM that should offer basic computing power for daily usage. And the large battery on board should offer long backup. However, the cameras are basic and offer nothing special. You have other options to consider in this segment.

The Realme C25 128GB is an excellent device with power-packed specifications. It has an excellent build quality, a fairly decent processor, a healthy set of connectivity options and a good camera configuration. The device ships with a bigger battery of 6000mAh that offers enough juice for more than a day of usage. It also supports 18W fast-charging technology. The low-resolution display (720p) and the bulky weight of the device (209 grams) is certainly a letdown.

Realme C25Y features a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display. The display panel though lacks a higher refresh rate.  It features a 50MP triple-camera setup on the back. The device runs Android 11 OS. You can get a long battery backup, thanks to a 5000mAh battery. The phone however only has 18W charging. The smartphone is powered by a Unisoc chipset, which offers average performance.

The Poco C31 flaunts a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display. The device is powered by an octa-core Helio G35 processor. It packs up to 4GB of RAM and 64GB of internal storage. The device's hardware is average. The smartphone boots up outdated Android 10 version out of the box. The device has microUSB 2.0 port. If you are looking for a device with longer battery life, the Poco C31 is the best offering.

Vivo V23 Pro is a good choice for buyers, even though it is priced higher for its features. The device includes an AMOLED display but with 90Hz refresh rate. It comes powered by MediaTek Dimensity 1200 chipset with 12GB RAM that delivers solid performance. The storage is not expandable though. The cameras on both sides deliver in most conditions. However, the battery is average, but with 44W fast charging you can manage. No headphone jack either.

The Vivo Y01 is an entry-level smartphone from Vivo that flaunts a 6.51-inch IPS LCD display. The device is powered by Helio P35 processor which offers mediocre performance. The device comes with only 2GB of RAM. It packs a 5,000mAh battery which can last throughout the day. If you are looking for a performance-oriented device with a good display, we would recommend you skipping the Y01.

OPPO A76 is an average mid-range phone that fails to justify its high price tag. It gets a HD+ display, the cameras are basic, but the performance should be satisfying thanks to 6GB RAM on board. The battery life should be good as well. Still, other devices offer a better chance for this money.

Realme 9 Pro is the latest mid-range 5G phone in the market and it gets few things right, while few things are missing. It gets a full HD+ display but without an AMOLED panel. The 5G chipset comes with 8GB RAM and offers 128GB storage which is expandable. The main back camera delivers good results while others are average. The battery life is decent and 33W fast charging comes handy.

The Samsung Galaxy M04 is the company's latest smartphone in the affordable class aimed at the public. The phone has a lovely design and a good performance. It has a MediaTek Helio P35 CPU that is adequate for regular use. Furthermore, despite the fact that the manufacturer only provides 15W fast charging support, the battery backup is acceptable. Having saying that, the phone is a good bargain at this price point.

The Infinix Hot 12 Play is a budget-oriented device from Infinix. It has a 6.82-inch IPS LCD display that has HD+ resolution. The device is powered by Unisoc T610 chipset which offers average performance. The device ships with 4GB of RAM and packs 64GB of internal storage. If you are looking for a big display smartphone with a long lasting battery life, then you can go for the Infinix Hot 12 Play. However, do note that you will have to compromise on 10W charging and average processor.
The Infinix Note 12i offers a good visual experience with a decent design, a long-lasting battery, and 33W fast charging support. However, cameras and software are big disappointments.

The iQOO Neo 6 5G 256GB model is a capable smartphone that brings some great features. The phone offers a smooth AMOLED display and brings a 120Hz refresh rate for a smooth scrolling experience. The device is powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 870 chipset, which delivers flagship-grade performance, especially while playing games. Moreover, the phone also features 80W fast charging support, which is a welcome move.
At Rs. 49,999, the iQOO 9T aims to bring the raw performance well within your reach. It's a well-rounded phone, and we wish iQOO could do something about the bloat in its UI.

The I Kall Z3 New is yet another standard offering in this price segment. The phone features some interesting design language, though the the rest of the specifications are standard for this price segment. So, if you are planning to buy an entry-level smartphone, be sure to check other options that gives you a much more recent version of Android.

The Apple iPhone 14 model is likely to be one of the most popular iPhones in the iPhone 14 series. The phone strikes a good mix between design and performance. The gadget has a 6.1-inch display that is easy to grasp. The device also has a strong Apple A15 Bionic CPU and excellent photographic capabilities owing to its dual-camera system. So, if you're in the market for a new iPhone and want a smaller device, the iPhone 14 is the way to go.

The Redmi A1 boasts a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display with a HD+ resolution. The phone runs Android 12 Go Edition out of the box with stock Android UI on top. It also offers good battery life, thanks to a 5,000mAh battery equipped with it. Furthermore, this entry-level handset even has a 3.5mm audio jack. However, note that you will have to compromise on cameras and performance. If your priority is clean software and a longer battery life with a bigger display, then you can go for the Redmi A1.

The Moto G32, priced under Rs 12,000, boasts a clean user interface and water-repellent design, along with a decent battery life. However, its lack of 5G connectivity, relatively slow charging at 30W, and low peak brightness may disappoint some users. Overall, it's a good value-for-money choice for those seeking basic smartphone functionality.

The Samsung Galaxy F14 5G is a great budget-friendly option with 5G support, a 90Hz refresh rate display, and good battery life. However, its front camera could be better, and it lacks fast charging. If these cons aren't deal breakers for you, the F14 5G is a good choice to consider, although other options in this price range include the POCO M4 5G and Redmi 11 Prime 5G.

The iQOO Neo7 Pro impresses with its performance-oriented design and gaming capabilities. The 6.78-inch AMOLED display with 120Hz refresh rate and HDR support enhances the visual experience. However, the phone's weight and pre-installed apps may affect user satisfaction. Mobile gaming enthusiasts will find solace in the Neo7 Pro's capabilities.

Redmi 12 5G offers capable features and performance with a sleek design, premium glass back, excellent battery life, and great primary camera. Portrait mode and charging speeds could be better, but overall, it's a solid choice. Starting at Rs 11,999 in India.

Although the OPPO F9 has an attractive design, a decently fast processor, a 25MP selfie camera and a 3500mAh battery with VOOC Flash Charging, the phone should've had a better rear-facing camera, 4K video recording, and lower price tag. There are phones at the same price that offer a better all-round performance.

The Infinix Hot 9 flaunts an elegant design with a punch-hole display. Although the phone looks trendy on the outset, the phone lags when it comes to camera performance. It's UI downgrades user experience; choose this phone if you only wanted it for basic use.

Samsung Galaxy A21s packs a 5,000mAh battery that promises longer usage but with a HD+ resolution display and Exynos 850 processor under the hood, the phone's overall performance is underwhelming. Buy it only if you need a phone to last for longer than a day.

Realme C11 gets a large display with support for big capacity battery and runs on the Android 10-based Realme UI. However, the MediaTek Helio G35 processor with 2GB of RAM sounds underwhelming and you get better phones from Redmi and Realme's Narzo sub-brand in the same price range.

Realme X3 SuperZoom features a display with 120Hz refresh rate, powered by the Snapdragon 855+ processor and gets quad camera setup with a zoom lens. The phone offers decent battery life and supports fast charging as well. However, it doesn't let you expand storage, and support for wired headphone is also missing.

Apple iPhone 12 Mini is a new addition to the iPhone lineup. It sports a smaller display than the other variants but there is nothing inferior about its features and performance. It runs on iOS 14, powered by the latest A14 bionic processor and the cameras are pretty good at the back. The battery life benefits from improved power management and you also have wireless charging to fall back upon. However, storage is still not expandable, the front cameras not matching the price tag, and so is the fast charging speed.

Moto G9 Power as the name suggests, will never let you down with its performance or battery backup. It helps the phone supports fast charging via USB Type C. You get a big screen experience which is ideal for watching videos on the go. The cameras on both sides deliver decent quality for the price as well. However, the size of the battery has a direct impact on its weight, the screen quality for its size is not ideal and you only get hybrid SIM slot to either expand storage or use the second SIM. Scores a lot of points but has obvious shortcomings as well.

Samsung Galaxy M02s is a budget device in every sense. It packs the Snapdragon 450 chipset with 3GB RAM that is the standard at this price. The big screen offers HD+ quality and dual SIM network supported for 4G internet speed and VoLTE. The triple rear cameras are welcome at this price, and the front camera offers support for video calls. The 5,000mAh battery provides long backup but it adds to the weight of the device. And you only have microUSB port charging. For entry-level users, the M02s is a reliable pick, even when they are other options in the market.

The Oppo A54 6GB RAM is a feature-rich smartphone with an impressive set of features. The phone sports a sleek and durable finish and comes with an IPX4 splash-proof rating. The phone sports an impressive triple camera configuration  (13MP+2MP+2MP) on the rear and a 16MP selfie camera. The hardware components include 6GB RAM and 128GB internal storage (expandable up to 256GB using a microSD card. Finally, the device is backed by a 5000mAh battery with 18W fast-charging support. On the downside, the phone is bulky to hold, weighing 192 grams, and runs Android v10 (Q) operating system.

The Xiaomi Mi 11X 8GB RAM offers exciting features under the hood. It sports an impressive 6.67-inches AMOLED display with a 120 Hz refresh rate. It has Corning Gorilla Glass v5 protection that safeguards the display from scratches and marks. With an impressive 8GB RAM, the multitasking is smooth; it has 128GB of storage for storing user data and files. Powering the smartphone is a modest 4520mAh battery with 33W fast-charging technology. On the downside, the phone is bulky, weighing 196 grams, and it does not support expandable storage.

Oppo A53s 5G 8GB RAM is the sleekest 5G smartphone out there. The device has great features at an affordable price bracket. The triple cameras (13MP+2MP+2MP) let users capture amazing photographs. The smartphone offers flawless performance, thanks to its MediaTek 700 octa-core processor coupled with 8GB of RAM. Add to it; the device offers ample storage space as it supports expandable memory of up to 1TB. The resolution is a con as it supports only 720 x 1600 pixels.

Tecno Spark Go 2021 is an Android Go phone, which is why it gets 2GB RAM. However, the Helio A20 quad-core chipset underwhelms with its performance. The phone comes with a single camera on both sides that get the job done at this price. But all in all, it's hard to recommend this phone, unless you are upgrading from a basic phone without 4G connectivity.

The 128GB variant of the Samsung Galaxy F22 gets 6GB RAM and that's the only difference you get with the phone which gives improved performance. The device sports a 6.4-inch Super AMOLED display with support for 90Hz refresh rate. It's powered by Helio G80 chipset. The quad cameras at the back are decent and with a 6,000mAh battery you get support for more than a day. However, the bulky design, HD+ screen resolution and 15W fast charging does not match with other devices in this price range.

OnePlus Nord 2 features a 90Hz AMOLED display. The device is powered by Dimensity 1200-AI chipset which offers an impressive performance. The smartphone features a triple-camera setup, which takes some good images. The phone packs a 4500mAh battery that has 65W fast charging support. However, Nord 2 misses out on expandable storage and a headphone jack. If you need a power-packed device with impressive performance and good cameras, you can consider the Nord 2 for sure.

The Tecno Spark 7T comes with a 6.52-inch IPS LCD display and it is powered by an octa-core Helio G35 SoC. The phone packs just 4GB of RAM and offers mediocre performance. The device packs a 6000mAh battery that lacks fast charging support. If you are looking for a budget device with a big display and long battery life, you can consider buying Tecno Spark 7T.

The OnePlus 9 RT is the premium offering by OnePlus. The device boasts a 6.62-inch AMOLED display that has Full HD+ resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate. The device is backed by Snapdragon 888 processor, which offers excellent performance. The camera on the device also takes some good images. Additionally, the handset supports 65W fast charging. The device lacks a 3.5mm audio jack. Overall the OnePlus 9RT is a good phones in Rs 45,000 price range, considering that the device is equipped with Snapdragon 888 SoC, and offers 65W fast charging support, AMOLED display, and up to 8GB of RAM.

Xiaomi Mi 11T Pro 5G 256GB has a lot going in its favour, and for the price it packs quite the punch. You get it with an AMOLED Dolby Vision display that supports 120Hz refresh rate and gets Corning Gorilla Glass Victus protection. The phone uses Snapdragon 888 SoC for performance with 8GB RAM and offers 256GB storage in this variant. The cameras at the back do a good job, and the battery not only offer long support but also gets 120W fast charging. However, it looks like most phones in the market, does not have a card slot, headphone and the front camera is basic. Still, totally worth the money you pay in the market.

The Xiaomi Redmi Note 11 Pro Plus 5G comes with a 6.67-inch AMOLED display that has a 120Hz refresh rate. The device ships with 8GB of RAM and 256GB of internal storage. The device features a 108MP camera which takes some good images. The handset packs 5,000mAh battery that has 67W fast charging support. If you are looking for 5G handset, AMOLED display, decent hardware, and up to 67W fast charging, you can consider buying the Redmi Note 11 Pro Plus 5G.

The Samsung Galaxy M33 5G is a mid-range 5G handset by Samsung. It sports a 6.6-inch TFT display with a Full HD+ resolution. The device uses an octa-core Exynos 1280 SoC and 8GB of RAM, which offers excellent performance. The handset is backed by a 6,000mAh battery which has 25W fast charging support. If your priority is the latest Android version, 5G support, long-lasting battery life, and good cameras, then the Galaxy M33 5G is the device that you can consider buying.

mobile_name: realme GT Neo 3 5G 150W Thor Limited Edition
expert_view: The Realme GT Neo 3 5G 150W Thor Limited Edition packs a punch. The device offers some really good features and specifications for the price point. You are getting a flagship-grade performance and high-grade cameras with this one. Moreover, the phone also packs 150W of fast charging, which is one of the fastest charging technology currently available. Overall, it is a good choice for those who want a Marvel-themed smartphone.

The OnePlus 10T 256GB model is one of the best options in this price segment. The handset packs a premium design language, which looks unique. It also features a great display, which makes it one of the best models in this price range. To top it up, the phone comes loaded with the latest Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Plus Gen 1 processor, which is a rare thing right now. Moreover, you get flagship-grade cameras and ultra-fast charging support. So, if you are looking for a smartphone under the Rs 60,000 price segment, then the OnePlus 10T is the best option.

The Realme C33 can be a good consideration for people looking for a budget device that won't burn a hole in their pocket. It gets most of the basics right, and the performance is optimised on the device.

The Realme GT Neo 3T is a powerful device. For the price, the tablet has some extremely nice features and characteristics. With this one, you get flagship-level performance and high-quality cameras. Furthermore, the phone includes 80W of fast charging, which is one of the quickest charging technologies presently available on the market. Overall, it is a solid pick for people looking for a mid-range gaming smartphone.

The Realme 10 Pro 8GB RAM is yet another stylish smartphone from Realme. The phone has several fantastic features and an excellent design language. First off, the device has a sizable display and a 5G Qualcomm Snapdragon 695 processor that provides reliable performance in all aspects, whether be it daily use or gaming. The device also includes a high storage capacity and provides good fast charging support. Realme 10 Pro with 8GB RAM is undoubtedly a viable option if you're seeking a smartphone with a respectable user experience.

The iQOO Neo 7 256GB is probably one of the best smartphones you get in this price segment. The handset offers a premium design, though it looks a bit similar to the iQOO Neo 6. Moreover, the device features a power-packed performance, all thanks to the new MediaTek Dimensity 8200 chipset. iQOO Neo 7 also features 120W fast charging support and offers some great cameras that are quite good in different situations. Overall, it is a good device to consider under this price range.

The POCO X5 256GB phone boasts a stunning Super AMOLED display with durable Corning Gorilla Glass protection, 5G connectivity, and impressive ultra-wide and macro lenses. However, the slightly underpowered Snapdragon 695 processor and 33W fast charging capability, which could be improved considering the price, might disappoint some users. Additionally, the phone runs on Android 12, not the latest Android 13 version.

Google made significant improvements with the Pixel 3 lineup when compared to its previous attempt. The 3 XL in particular offers improved audio-visual capabilities, complete with HDR10 capable OLED screen and louder stereo speakers. However, the phone is far from perfect. Its notch is hideous, there is no micro-SD card slot, no headphone jack, and no 4k 60fps video recording. The Galaxy Note 9 fulfills all of these needs and then some.

The Samsung Galaxy M10 cannot be called value for money device as there are much better alternatives available in the market. However, for the ones who have made up their mind to get a Samsung phone in the budget, they should only buy this phone if ready to make-do with mediocre performance.
The Nokia 6.2 is a great phone but unfortunately can't match its competitors like the Samsung Galaxy M30s and the Realme 5 Pro.

The Galaxy M20 is a fighting attempt from Samsung to stave off the competition. It has a large screen, a dual-camera on the rear, and a long-lasting battery. We are afraid, though, that it's not enough. The phone needs much more firepower in the processing department to keep things running on time.

The Redmi Note 7S is the perfect phone under Rs 10,000 price segment (after discounted pricing). It has a modern and attractive design, complete with Gorilla Glass 5 on the front and the rear, and water splash-resistant design. Its 48MP camera clicks excellent stills even in low-light conditions, at least for the price. Its performance is fast enough for gaming and day-to-day tasks, and its battery life is more than a day. MIUI software offers dozens of important features. Its connectivity features are all modern, too, including gigabit Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 5.0, and USB Type-C port. The only thing that I can think of it missing is 4K video recording.

The Oppo A52 is a good option for those looking for good design and cameras. But the processor offers moderate performance, and so are the cameras. Also, pricing is a big concern if you consider the specifications. Realme, Redmi, and Samsung offer many affordable smartphones with similar specs.

Nokia 3.4 can be termed as a proper budget phone. Like every other Nokia phone out there, this one also gets a compact and elegant design, built over the 6.39-inch form factor. It comes powered by the average Snapdragon 460 SoC with 4GB RAM that delivers decent performance. You also have quality cameras in tow. But at this price, we now expect better in terms of features and hardware. You are likely to get better value from other devices in the market.

Xiaomi Poco M2 128GB packs 6GB RAM for multitasking, and it houses 128GB onboard internal memory for storing user data and files. It equips quad-camera setup on the rear that clicks beautiful images. Add to it; the device is powered by a 5000mAh battery that offers power backup for longer durations. Overall, it is a go-to option at this price range.

OnePlus 8T 256GB packs flagship hardware for a reasonable price tag. It comes with 12GB RAM, features 120Hz refresh rate AMOLED screen and supports 65W fast charging for the battery. However, the phone's storage is not expandable, it does support wireless charging at the price, does not get IP waterproof rating either and has no headphone jack for wired audio accessories.

The OPPO A33 2020 is a good smartphone in the Rs 10,000 price range. The handset boasts a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display and ships with 3GB of RAM. The device is equipped with Snapdragon 460 SoC, which offers excellent performance. The handset offers long-lasting battery backup, thanks to a 5,000mAh battery. You can go for OPPO A33 2020, if you are looking for a smartphone with fast charging and excellent performance.

Lava Z4 is one of the four latest Z-series smartphones launched by the brand. The phone comes with a tall 6.51-inches display, decent cameras, and a large battery. The device also ships with a responsive fingerprint sensor and Face unlock. As for the cons, the device is bulky, weighing 190 grams and the display offers a low resolution of 720 x 1600 pixels.

Poco M3 is the latest mid-range addition for buyers. It packs a large Full HD+ screen with Corning Gorilla Glass 3 protection. The Snapdragon 662 chipset is reliable and gets the job done without any issues. The triple rear camera shoots decent photos in day light, but nothing worthy to talk about its low light capability. But with a large battery built in, you get long backup with support for 18W fast charging.

Realme Narzo 30A is a notable upgrade over the Narzo 20A and comes with an impressive specs sheet. The device sports a reasonably bright 6.5-inch display with a 120 Hz refresh rate. For power backup, the phone relies on the massive 6000mAh battery with 18W fast-charging. The phone lags when it comes to low-light photography capabilities. However, it makes a good purchase if you are looking for a good performance device within the budget.

Realme C25 is the latest addition to the company's budget lineup. This phone gets a big screen, offers long backup and packs a decent rear camera setup. For performance, it uses the MediaTek Helio G70 chipset with 4GB RAM. The only drawback is you get a HD+ screen quality. Definitely worth considering in the budget segment.

Moto G40 Fusion is a mixed-bag device. It has a Full HD+ screen with 120Hz refresh rate, a reliable hardware powering the device and long battery life. However, the bulky design might off-put some people, and the storage slot loses out second SIM. The fingerprint sensor at this price belongs at the side. Like it if you want a stock Android phone for under Rs 20,000.

The 8GB RAM variant of Realme possesses double the RAM capacity as its base variant, the Realme 8 5G. The device packs great specs and offers great value for money. To start, the handset has a slim design, impressive triple rear cameras (48MP+2MP+2MP). 128GB internal memory and a massive battery with 18W fast-charging support.

Samsung Galaxy M42 5G is an interesting addition to the mid-range lineup. It comes powered by Snapdragon 750G that gives you 5G support with 8GB RAM. You get a Super AMOLED screen but with only HD+ quality and no high refresh rate support for this price. The rear cameras are decent, and you have the One UI based on Android 11 OS. The battery back up is also decent but only supports 15W fast charging. And then, you can only expand storage using the hybrid SIM slot. By the looks of it, Galaxy M42 5G faces tough fight to attract buyers.

Samsung Galaxy F42 offers features that are a mixed bag. You get a Full HD+ 90Hz display but without an AMOLED panel. It uses MediaTek Dimensity 700 5G chipset for performance with 6GB RAM and 128GB storage which is further expandable. The rear cameras are decent and so is the battery life. However, the design is dated and bulky. The front camera is average and the 15W charging speed is not good for the price. You have better options to look at in this price range.

OnePlus Nord CE 5G makes sense if you buy it for Rs 20,000 but the 12GB RAM variant might sound impressive but with its plastic body, slow charging speed and basic 5G chipset, it is hard to see it getting bought, especially when you get the regular Nord with a premium design at the same range. Also, not having a 120Hz refresh rate screen would be a deal breaker for anyone spending Rs 28,000. Go for other phones in this range.

The Samsung Galaxy M21 2021 comes with a 6.4-inch Super AMOLED display. The device is powered by an octa-core Exynos 9611 chipset. The phone features a 48MP triple-camera setup. The smartphone offers average performance and has only 18W fast charging support. If you are looking for a smartphone with an AMOLED display and good cameras, you can consider buying Galaxy M21 2021.

The Samsung Galaxy A22 5G comes with a 6.6-inch TFT LCD display that has a 90Hz refresh rate. The phone is powered by Dimensity 700 SoC. The device runs Android 11 out of the box and offers 5G support. The phone only offers 15W charging support and comes with a TFT display. If you are looking for a device in Rs 20,000 price range you can consider Redmi Note 10 Pro Max, Realme 8 5G, or POCO M3 Pro 5G, considering that these handsets offer value for money and have much better specs than the Galaxy A22 5G.

Realme Narzo 30 5G is another mid-range phone powered by MediaTek Dimensity 700 5G chipset. But for this price you only get it with 4GB RAM and 64GB storage. The primary rear camera clicks decent photos, but others are average. The battery backup is good but 18W fast charging not good for the price. Better options available in the price bracket these days.

The OPPO A16K is a budget-oriented device from OPPO that flaunts a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display. The device is powered by an octa-core Helio G35 processor. The handset ships with 3GB of RAM and packs 32GB of internal storage. The device has a plastic back panel. The smartphone lacks fast charging support. In the Rs 10,000 price range, you can consider some other smartphones from Xiaomi or Vivo, considering that those offer some good features like fast charging support, 4GB RAM, and metal unibody design.

The Poco C31 is an affordable offering by Poco that comes with a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display. The device is powered by an octa-core Helio G35 SoC. It packs up to 3GB of RAM and 32GB of internal storage. The device's hardware and camera performance are average. The smartphone runs an outdated Android 10 version out of the box. The device has microUSB 2.0 port. If you are looking for a device with a larger 6.5-inch display and a longer battery life, the Poco C31 is the best offering. However, you will have to compromise on several things such as performance, cameras, and slower charging speed.

The iQOO 9 SE comes with a 6.62-inch AMOLED display that has a Full HD+ resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate. The smartphone offers excellent performance, thanks to 12GB LPDDR5 RAM and Snapdragon 888 processor. The handset runs Android 12 out of the box. The smartphone takes some good images, thanks to 48MP triple-camera setup. In the Rs 40,000 price range, the iQOO 9 SE is the good smartphone, which you can consider buying.

Poco M4 Pro 4G variant gets an AMOLED display with 90Hz refresh rate. It features a stylish design which makes it easy to use. It comes powered by MediaTek Helio G96 chipset, paired with 8GB RAM. You get a 64MP primary camera which delivers quality photos. The storage is also expandable, the battery life keeps you going, and it gets 33W fast charging support. The only drawbacks are basic front camera and Android 11 out of the box.

Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 1TB variant is the same powerful phone with 12GB RAM and a whopping 1TB storage, which is not expandable any further. We are not sure if a regular user needs this much space, even if they shoot a lot of videos or take photos. And for the price, you are better off buying the other variants of this phone.

The Nokia C01 Plus 32GB is an entry-level smartphone from HMD Global that is targeted towards first-time smartphone buyers. The latest smartphone offers basic specifications and features that are sufficient to run the Android operating system. The phone also comes with some decent cameras on the front and back. So, if you are looking for an entry-level smartphone that you can use as a secondary device, then you can consider Nokia C01 Plus 32GB.

The Tecno Spark 10C is an entry-level smartphone from Tecno priced at under Rs 10,000. The handset features a 6.6-inch display that has an HD+ resolution and a 90Hz refresh rate. The smartphone is powered by a Unisoc T606 processor which offers mediocre performance. Thanks to the 5,000mAh battery, the device can easily last throughout the day. It also supports 18W fast charging and has microSD card support for storage expansion. If you are looking for a smartphone near Rs 10,000 with a good display, fast charging support, and excellent battery life, you can go for the Tecno Spark 10C.

The Realme GT 2 5G 256GB is one of the best smartphones you can get under this price segment. The smartphone comes with a unique design language, which makes it stand out from the crowd. The device is also powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 888 processor that ensures flagship-grade performance. The cameras deliver some good results in different conditions, and the 65W fast charging support is a cherry on the top. Overall, the phone is a worthy option to consider for under Rs 40,000 price segment.

The Xiaomi Mi 12 Pro 12GB RAM is probably one of the best smartphones in the premium segment. The phone comes with a leading display technology and offers flagship performance with the latest Snapdragon chipset. The device also features flagship-grade camera features and comes with a premium design language. However, the company has cut some corners in terms of IP rating. But apart from this, this is one of the best smartphones you can buy in 2022.

The latest flagship smartphone from Vivo offers premium features and specifications. The design is what makes it stand out from the competition. The phone is also the first to be powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 9000 processor in India. Moreover, the handset packs top-of-the-line camera hardware, which makes it one of the best camera-centric smartphones available in the market.

The Infinix Zero 20 sure seems to be a good option, which comes with a host of interesting features. The handset packs a 6.7-inch AMOLED display, which is a rare feature in this price segment. Moreover, you get a decent chipset and virtual RAM support, which will further enhance the device's performance. Moreover, the handset is loaded with decent cameras that are capable of capturing photos in different light conditions. This coupled with 45W fast charging support and a 4,500mAh battery, ensures a longer battery life.

Apple iPhone 14 Pro 1TB model is one of the most powerful and capable device in 2022. This should ideal for all users and even professionals. Apple has improved its camera hardware, and battery efficiency. For the first time, Apple has introduced a 48MP primary camera, which is also well-tuned as expected. The performance gets a boost thanks to the latest A16 Bionic chip with 6GB RAM. However, you cannot expand storage, there is no headphone jack and for this price 20W fast charging speed is not ideal. Buy the iPhone 14 Pro 1TB model if you're upgrading from 2 year-old model or any Android device.

The Vivo V25 5G is another design triumph from the Chinese manufacturer. The phone features a luxury appearance and a sharp 90Hz AMOLED display. The gadget also has a flagship-grade MediaTek Dimensity 900 processor and 44W super fast charging capabilities. The phone's camera is excellent, and it performs consistently in a variety of lighting settings. That said, if you are looking for a stylish smartphone from Vivo under this price segment, the Vivo V25 is a sure shot.

The I Kall Z12 Pro is another entry-level alternative from the manufacturer. The phone has a vintage look and some common characteristics of this price range. Some of the attractions include a large display, extendable storage, and a 20MP back camera. However, if you are searching for an entry-level model, it is recommended that you first evaluate the competitors before choosing this model.

The Redmi 10 Prime 2022 is a cost-effective smartphone that meets this price range's needs. The phone has a large display and a respectable performance. Additionally, the phone has 18W fast charging support and respectable battery life. Therefore, if you are thinking about purchasing a new smartphone in this price range, be sure first to compare the Redmi 10 Prime 2022 with your options.

The Samsung Galaxy A04e is Samsung's latest budget-oriented smartphone. The device boasts a 6.5-inch display that has a HD+ resolution. Under the hood, the A04e is backed by a MediaTek Helio P35 processor which is adequate for regular usage. The handset packs a 5,000mAh battery and runs Android 12 OS out of the box. The device however lacks fast charging support and has a plastic back panel. That being said, in a similar price range, the Redmi 9 Prime, Realme Narzo 30A, or even the Poco M2 could be a good choice compared to Galaxy A04e.

The Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra 5G 1TB option is one of hte best premium Android smartphones of 2023. The smartphone packs state-of-the-art features and specifications, making it one of the most advanced Android phones available in the market. This coupled with great camera features, a smooth user interface, and decent fast charging support makes the Galaxy S23 Ultra is a good contender for the Phone of the year.

For those on the lookout for a reasonably-priced smartphone that ticks all the right boxes, the iQOO Z7 5G is an excellent recommendation. Besides its impressive display, the device boasts a great primary camera, exceptional battery life, and fast charging capabilities, making it an all-around winner.

mobile_name: Xiaomi Redmi Note 13 Pro Plus 5G World Champions Edition

expert_view: The Xperia XA1 Plus is yet another camera-focussed device from Sony. Except for its high-end 23MP rear camera, the phone does not have a worthy hardware.

The Xiaomi Mi A2 is a much-needed upgrade over the Mi A1. It offers solid build quality without comprising of functionality. The upgrade to a Snapdragon 660 chipset is highly appreciated. The cameras are also pretty decent considering the price bracket this device falls in. You also get decent battery life with fast charging support over USB Type-C. However, we do miss the 3.5mm headphone jack and are underwhelmed by this phone's display performance. The phone is still an excellent device to won and gets a solid recommendation from us.

Although the Honor 7S has a tall screen with minimal bezels and a dual-camera at the rear, we wouldn't recommend the phone due to its slow performance and the lack of a fingerprint reader. Battery life and cameras are a disappointment as well.

The Honor 8X is an excellent offering from the Huawei sub-brand as it offers a well-rounded package at an affordable price. It has decent aesthetics and a solid performance to match. The UI might be on the heavy side, but it still comes with tonnes of customization options. You get dual SIM card support alongside a dedicated slot of a microSD card slot. The battery is large enough to last an entire day. However, the cameras should have been better, and it's about time for Honor to be moving over to USB Type-C charging ports.

While the Honor 20 looks sleek and fashionable, it would have been even better if the company had opted for an OLED panel. The phone is fast, has dozens of useful software features, and a great set of cameras that take excellent still images. However, video recording quality could've been much better. Moreover, there's no microSD card slot, no IP68 certification for dust and water resistance, no stereo speakers, and no 3.5mm headphone jack, something phones like the ASUS 6Z offer.

The OPPO Reno 10x Zoom is an excellent phone that often gets overlooked because of the incredibly popular OnePlus 7 and OnePlus 7T. The phone is still a good deal because of its strong features and excellent design.

The Oppo A9 aims to be an all-rounder but because of that, it fails to impress in any one department. Because of aggressive strategies by competing companies, the Oppo A9 can safely be overlooked when looking for a phone in the sub 15k range.

The Oppo A9 2020 4GB RAM does ship with decent enough specifications under the hood. For instance, it has good battery life, reverse charging capability, and good build quality. On the flip side, it has an average display, only two cameras find the value out of four cameras, and average gaming performance. If you consider the price point, then there are plenty of options available with the Realme and Redmi.

The Vivo X50 mobile turns out to be a pretty good all-rounder. The phone scores well when it comes to design, display, cameras, and battery life. It also features an on-screen fingerprint sensor for biometric authentication. The one thing the Vivo X50 struggles in terms of performance owing to the mid-range processor. Also, the device does not have any screen protection, and stereo speakers are also excluded. The phone is a go-to option when it comes to cameras and premium design.
We hate to say this but Honor 9S is just not worth buying. It has an outdated hardware and an exorbitant price tag. You can get much better smartphones in the market for the same price.

Tecno Spark 6 Air budget phone comes powered by quad-core processor with a large 7-inch screen and packs a mammoth 6,000mAh battery. It runs on the latest Android 10 version out of box but the overall performance of this phone is rather underwhelming and you have better options to consider in this price range.

Vivo Y20i gives you a big screen smartphone experience, powered by Snapdragon 460 processor. The triple rear cameras offer versatility which is good option to have for this price. The large capacity battery supports 18W fast charging. However, the screen only gets HD+ resolution at this price, and microUSB port for charging is not ideal either.

Realme 7 Pro comes with 8GB RAM that paired with the Snapdragon 720G gives you decent performance for multi-tasking. It sports a Super AMOLED screen, with Corning Glass protection, and you get 128GB storage.
