The quad rear cameras offers decent quality photos in all conditions, same is the case with the front camera. And finally, the 4,500mAh battery supports 65W charging speed. However, the screen lacks any high refresh rate support.

Oppo F17 sports a Super AMOLED display with a hardware package that patches the price range. The triple rear camera setup offers decent photos and the built-in battery gets 30W fast charging. However, at this price, we'd expect the display to support a higher refresh rate.

Realme Narzo 20 Pro sports a 90Hz refresh rate display, and powered by Helio G95 chipset that delivers on the gaming front as well as hard-core multi-tasking. The rear and the front cameras are more than sufficient for this price range, but the standout aspect of the phone is the built-in 65W fast charging support, and the adapter comes in the box. Having said that, the phone's 4500mAh battery is the reason why you need fast charging speed to quickly boot up.

Apple iPhone 12 is the successor to the iPhone 11 and gives you many reasons to upgrade. New A14 chipset, 4GB RAM, iOS 14 out of box and improved rear and front cameras. Even the battery life is longer, with fast wired and wireless charging support. However, the OLED screen has no high refresh rate support, no headphone jack, no power adapter in the box, storage no expandable and charging speeds slower than competition.

Vivo V20 2021 is an excellent camera-centric smartphone that packs excellent features. Some of them include a 6.4-inches AMOLED display, triple camera setup (64MP+8MP+2MP), excellent 44MP selfie camera, and expandable memory of up to 1 TB. The lack of support for 5G network connectivity is certainly a con. At the same price range, you get OnePlus Nord with 5G support.

The Samsung Galaxy S21 Plus 256GB features a beautiful AMOLED display with HDR 10+. It boasts of an On-screen fingerprint sensor for secure biometric authentication. For power backup, it sports a large 4000mAh battery with 25W fast-charging support. Plus, the device equips a triple camera configuration that offers great camera performance. Coming to the cons, the device is made of the plastic back, it does not support any expandable memory, and it is devoid of the conventional 3.5mm audio jack.

Moto G10 Power live up to its name, almost. It packs a big screen with HD+ quality which ensures you get long backup thanks to the built-in 6000mAh battery that supports 20W fast charging. The rear cameras do a good job for this price, and getting Android 11 out of box is a good sign. But the battery makes the phone bulky, hybrid SIM slot is not expected in this price range and the overall performance is average for most tasks. Go for the G10 Power if you need a phone with long backup and a big screen.

Realme 8 Pro 8GB RAM ships with a power-packed specs sheet. The phone sports a great Super AMOLED display, powerful 8GB RAM and 128GB internal memory. The quad rear camera setup featuring a 108MP primary camera accounts for excellent photography. The other notable features include a 4500mAh battery with 50W SuperDart charging and Qualcomm Snapdragon 720G octa-core processor. On the downside, the phone does not have any glass protection, and it has only a 60 Hz refresh rate display. Overall, the device is a worthy option to consider.

Samsung Galaxy F02s has a lot going for it. The big HD+ screen offers multimedia value, backed up with large capacity battery with support for fast charging. The cameras will deliver for the price and the notch design makes it look elegant. However, the budget segment with flooded with options right now, and we believe you have plenty of them worth considering instead of this one.

Realme C25s sports a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display. The display panel however has a standard 60Hz refresh rate. Powering the phone under the hood is an octa-core Gelio G85 SoC. The device latest Android 11 out of the box. The Realme C25s have average cameras, and only 18W fast charging support. If you are looking for a budget-oriented device with LCD display and a long-lasting battery, you should consider buying the Realme C25s. However, note that you will have to compromise on cameras and fast charging support.

Realme C21Y is the first phone from the brand to come powered by Unisoc T610 chipset. It gets 3GB RAM and offers 32GB internal storage which is further expandable. The device has triple rear camera that delivers basic photos but you get a long battery life which is essential for a large screen device. However, the selfie camera shoots average photos, the performance is limited to normal tasks and it only has microUSB port. Reliable choice if you just need a basic budget phone.

iQOO Z3 5G offers the latest features you need in a phone these days. It packs the new Snapdragon 768G chipset that delivers reliable performance, along with 8GB RAM which meets the requirement of a power user. You get 256GB storage on board and the phone runs on Android 11 which is riddled with bloatware. The 120Hz refresh rate display is decent, the design is compact and having 55W charging support for battery is a bonus. However, the cameras are average. So, make sure to be mindful of why you want to buy a phone. If you need a phone with quality performance, go for the iQOO Z3, but for camera you have other options.

Poco F3 GT makes an impressive debut with its 120Hz AMOLED display that gets Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection. The use of MediaTek Dimensity 1200 chipset with 8GB RAM gives you top-level performance, and this variant offers 256GB internal storage. The cameras do a good job and the battery offers long backup, along with 67W fast charging. However, the phone does not have a storage card slot and no headphone jack either. For this price, Poco F3 GT is worth considering.

Asus ROG Phone 5s Pro is a power-packed device that will delight gamers. You get it with massive 18GB RAM and 512GB storage that translate into excellent real-time performance, and you still have more power left. The cameras don't do much justice for the price tag, and the phone is rather bulky at 238 grams, but the battery life is really long, and you have it with 65W fast charging. Definitely worth buying for heavy users.

Galaxy Z Fold 3 comes with a 7.6-inch AMOLED display. The smartphone packs Snapdragon 888 SoC, 12GB of RAM, 512GB of internal storage. The device offers excellent camera performance. However, the phone has average battery life and it offers just 25W fast charging. If you are looking to buy a new foldable smartphone, the Galaxy Z Fold 3 is the ideal device that offers value for money.

The Realme Narzo 50 5G cuts a few corners to accommodate a 5G-enabled chipset for its price, and these corners are important in terms of user experience. The Narzo 50 Pro, on the other hand, is priced and specced aggressively, making it a good recommendation for someone looking for a phone just above Rs. 20,000.

The Vivo Y21 comes with a 6.51-inch IPS LCD display. The device is powered by Snapdragon 439 SoC, which offers average performance. The phone features a dual-camera setup which consists of 13MP and 2MP camera sensors. The device packs a 5000mAh battery. The phone lacks fast charging support. The storage of the device is expandable up to 256GB only. In a similar price range, Poco C3 or Tecno Pova 2 can be a great option compared to the Y21, considering that these two phones offer some good specs and features.

Redmi 10 Prime features a 90Hz Full HD+ display, powered by the reliable MediaTek Helio G88 chipset with 6GB RAM. This variant gets 128GB onboard storage, and the long battery life comes in handy. But the cameras deliver average photos, and the 18W charging support feels slow for this price. Best to look at other options in the price range.

The Apple iPhone 13 comes with a 6.1-inch OLED display and is powered by Apple's in-house A15 Bionic chipset. The A15 Bionic offers excellent performance. The iPhone 13 sports a 12MP dual-camera setup at the rear. However, the iPhone 13 still lacks a 120Hz refresh rate support and only features 20W fast charging support. If you are looking for the best-in-class hardware and camera performance, you can go for the iPhone 13. However, you will need to comprise on things like 120Hz refresh rate and 20W charging support.
The Realme Narzo 50A Prime feels like a mixed bag for us. Besides the design, display and good battery life, the phone seems average. It appears to be lost in a crowded 5G market now.

Tecno Pop 5 LTE is a basic budget phone that does little to convince us or the buyer. All its features are old, and having 2GB RAM with quad-core chipset is not going to cut out for Android 11 or any OS these days. Better to skip this one.

Itel Vision 3 is a budget device that is going to complete all the requirements of basic users in the market. The camera setup of the smartphone enables users to capture good-quality images. You get a long-lasting power backup with the 5000mAh battery.

Vivo Y21G is a mid-range smartphone from Vivo that has a few things going in its favor. The camera performance on the device is average. The device packs a big screen with a MediaTek Helio G70 chipset that offers decent gaming performance.

The OnePlus 10R is probably one of the best smartphones available in this price segment. The phone packs a 120Hz AMOLED display that provides an enhanced viewing experience. The device also packs some gaming-centric features like a VC cooling system, 9 antennas support, and more. The device is loaded with a flagship-grade MediaTek Dimensity 8100 - Max processor that is capable of handling heavy-duty work. That said, the phone can be considered a good option if you are looking for a smartphone under Rs 45,000 price segment.

The Lava Blaze is quite an interesting smartphone in this price segment. The handset packs a large display and offers some decent features. The device also comes with a decent performance in this price segment, though you might find better-performing phones. Moreover, if you are looking for an Indian brand and your budget is around Rs 9,000, then you can consider this device.

The Samsung Galaxy F13 128GB model provides a good mix of design and specifications. The phone's large 6.6-inch display will be enough for content viewing from different platforms. The camera seems to be decent, given the price point of under Rs 15,000. Moreover, the Galaxy F13 also features a large 6,000mAh battery that is enough to last one full day with some juice still left in the battery. Overall, it is a decent option to consider in this price segment.

The OnePlus Nord 2T sure seems to be an interesting smartphone. The phone comes with a premium design language and offers a good display, which is fast and smooth. The handset also features the latest MediaTek Dimensity chipset that helps it handle most of the tasks quite effectively. Moreover, the cameras seem to be interesting as well. So, if you are looking for a smartphone under Rs 35,000 segment, then OnePlus Nord 2T 256GB variant seems to be a good choice for you.

The Realme C35 is a decent smartphone in this price segment. The phone features a tall display and comes with 180Hz touch sampling rate. It also features a unique design, which may attract many potential customers. Moreover, the 18W fast charging is also a welcome move here.

The newest Redmi 11 Prime 5G 128GB model boasts an appealing look and specifications. The gadget is equipped with the most recent MediaTek Helio G99 processor and a premium design language. The phone also features a 90Hz display with good viewing angles. In addition, the smartphone offers a long battery life and good day-to-day performance. So, if you're looking for a smartphone for around Rs 15,000, this is an excellent option.

The Realme C30s is yet another interesting option from the brand. The budget-centric smartphone certainly ticks all the boxes when it comes to features. The model packs a premium design language and offers some decent performance for day-to-day task. The phone also comes with a decent battery life, which makes it one of the best options you can get for an entry-level smartphone.

The POCO X5 Pro 256GB model offers specifications and features at an aggressive price point. The handset offers a premium design and is loaded with some top-of-the-line features. The performance is good, and so are the cameras. The 67W fast charging also helps the device to charge at a faster rate. Overall, it is a good smartphone to consider in this price segment.

The OnePlus 11 is probably one of the finest smartphones from OnePlus. The handset comes with a premium design language, and the Hasselblad cameras deliver top-notch performance. Moreover, the handset is powered by the latest Qualcomm chipset that can take on any task you throw at it. The battery is decent, and the 100W fast charging support is just the cherry on top. Overall, it is one of the best smartphones you can get this year.

The Lava Blaze 5G features a good design language and offers some interesting features. The handset has a 5G support, and a 6.5-inch display with a HD+ resolution. The phone is equipped with Dimensity 700 SoC which can handle all the tasks with ease. The device runs Android 12 out of the box. The handset packs a 5,000mAh battery which can easily last throughout the day. If you are looking for a 5G smartphone with good performance, and battery life near Rs 10,000, you can surely go for the Lava Blaze 5G.

The Vivo Y22 2022 offers a decent performance with its MediaTek Helio G70 chipset and 4GB of RAM. The 6.55-inch IPS LCD display with a waterdrop notch provides a satisfactory viewing experience. The 5000mAh battery with 18W fast charging is a plus. However, the plastic build may feel less premium, and the 720p resolution could be a drawback for some users.

Tecno Spark 10 5G 256GB is a solid smartphone that delivers great performance and camera capabilities. However, the plastic build and lack of certain features like full HD display, fast charging might be a drawback for some users.

The Infinix Hot 30 5G impresses with its sleek design, 5G connectivity, and capable camera. Despite some room for improvement in software and camera quality, it remains a budget-friendly choice for those seeking 5G and reliable performance.

The realme narzo 60x 5G boasts a slim and lightweight design. It captures decent 50MP shots, performs well with the Dimensity 6100+ chipset, and features realme UI 4.0. Its a good choice for those seeking a 5G smartphone in the     '         10,000 to     '         15,000 range with good design, performance, and cameras.

With the Zenfone Max Pro M2, you will experience the fastest and smoothest performance at this end of the market. Its cameras might not be the best, but they are still quite impressive. There are some drawbacks such as the lack of a USB Type-C port and fast charging, and a glossy back that is prone to scratches, but the phone more than makes up for these with its excellent display, bloatware-free stock Android UI, and an excellent audio quality.

The Redmi 7 is a worthy upgrade over the Redmi  6. the phone offers a good display, amazing battery life, and more than acceptable performance. The only problem is that the base variant offers only 2GB of RAM now, and the higher RAM model only offers 32GB of storage and not 64GB like the Redmi 6. Overall, the Redmi 7 is a great phone, but perhaps waiting for a discount might be a better idea.

The Oppo Reno is an excellent phone with a chink in its armor, the Snapdragon 710. Even though the phone performs decently, at this price range you expect your phone to offer a lot more. But photography enthusiasts should definitely give this phone a look as that rear camera is capable of some interesting shots.

The Vivo Y90 is strictly okay in terms of the specs and features it offers but it's a better idea to increase your budget by a little bit and look at better options. For the price, it makes more sense to consider a phone like the Realme C2.

Xiaomi Poco M2 Pro 128GB variant features a Full HD+ display, powered by Snapdragon 720 processor and gets a quad rear camera setup. The phone comes loaded with a 5,000mAh battery that supports 33W fast charging. However, at this price, we would have liked the screen to support 90Hz refresh rate on the Poco M2 Pro.

Realme 6i is the only phone in this segment to offer 90Hz refresh rate support for display. It packs a decent set of hardware and the quad rear cameras deliver on the quality for the price. And even the battery on board manages to offer solid performance with 20W fast charging. However, the OS is filled with bloatware that can be annoying. All in all, the phone delivers for the price in more than one way.

Realme Narzo 20A sports a HD+ display that gets Corning Gorilla Glass 3 protection. The octa-core chipset offers decent performance and the cameras on the phone give you quality photos. The built-in battery offers long backup but charging will take time. Having said that, the phone comes with 3GB RAM only and has microUSB port for charging.

The Vivo Y20 6GB RAM is the latest addition to the budget Y-series. It packs specs that are more or less similar to the Vanilla Y20. The 6GB RAM and 5000mAh battery are the major pros for the device. On the other hand, the phone features a poor camera setup and lacks a Type-C USB port.

The Xiaomi Poco X3 8GB RAM comes with amazing specifications and features. Thanks to its 8GB RAM, the phone delivers smooth performance. It has an impressive quad-camera setup on the rear that clicks decent images. As for the power backup, the device features a 6000mAh battery with 33W fast charging support. However, the device is bulky to hold weighing 225 grams, and MIUI 12 has bloatware and ads.

Realme 7i gives you HD+ screen resolution but it does support 90Hz refresh rate. The hardware powering the phone is decent and will offer respectable performance. The cameras at the back are good and so is the shooter on the front. The battery backup will last you for day or two and 18W charging support will come in handy. But all said and done, the display resolution is not at par with the competition.

Samsung Galaxy A21s is an all-round mid-range phone that offers standard set of features for the segment. It sports a 6.5-inch big display with Full HD+ resolution, running on the Android 10 version. The cameras at the back are dynamic and offer good quality images. The built-in battery with 15W charging offers decent backup, and with 6GB RAM and 128GB storage, the phone is meaty. However, the chipset under the hood lacks in performance, compared to the rivals, and the screen offers no refresh rate support.

Oppo F17 Pro Diwali Edition is just another variant of the regular model. The screen gets Super AMOLED panel, with 8GB RAM and Helio P95 offering decent performance. There is ample storage that is further expandable. Cameras on front and back are pretty good, but the battery life is likely to be hit because of the overall package. Having said that, the screen at this price comes without any high refresh rate support.

Realme Narzo 30 Pro 128GB is one of the affordable 5G offerings from the brand. Despite that, the device is never short of features. It sports a 6.5-inches IPS LCD with a refresh rate of 120 Hz, an impressive 8GB RAM for smooth multitasking performance. The phone packs 128GB internal memory with an expandable memory option of up to 256GB via a microSD card. However, it includes a Hybrid SIM slot and does not have a dedicated memory card option. Another disappointing aspect is that the phone runs Android v10 (Q) operating system and not the latest Android v11 operating system.

The Oppo F19 Pro 256GB comes with a decent specs sheet. As for the specifications, the handset sports a 6.43-inches Super AMOLED display with a high pixel density of 409ppi. The display features a Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection. Performance-wise, the smartphone comes powered by a MediaTek Helio P95 processor with 8GB RAM. It packs an ample internal storage capacity of 256GB and is further expandable up to 256GB using a microSD card. The battery capacity of 4310mAh is certainly on the lower side.

Samsung Galaxy M12 128GB is the latest budget offering from the brand with an impressive specs sheet. The phone sports a 90Hz AMOLED display, 128GB internal memory that is expandable up to 1TB. For optics, there are quad-rear cameras (48MP+5MP+2MP+2MP) and an 8MP front-facing camera. The phone is powered by the company's  Exynos 8 Octa 850 chipset paired with 6GB RAM. As for the cons, the device does not feature any screen protection, and it is difficult to operate with a single hand for long hours owing to its bulky nature (221grams).

Tecno Spark 7 is the latest budget phone in the market to come with Android Go OS. It comes powered by octa-core chipset, with 2GB for adequate performance. The storage is expandable and the 6,000mAh battery offers long backup. But you only get 2GB RAM which might feel on the lower side and it has microUSB port for charging. Strictly meant for those who want a big screen device with long battery life on a budget.

Vivo V21 5G can be recognised as a mid-range selfie phone that competes with better and capable devices. The device gets Dimensity 800 chipset which is easily available on phones that cost less. The design works in favour of the V21 5G but even then having a notch at this price is a big drawback. Add to that, you have no headphone jack, only 90Hz refresh rate offered and Hybrid SIM slot to expand storage. Vivo V21 5G only caters to the selfie enthusiasts, so if that's not your priority look elsewhere.

Realme 8 5G is the most affordable 5G phone you can buy in the market right now. The device gets a 90Hz refresh rate display, and powered by the new MediaTek Dimensity 700 chipset. This variant comes with 4GB RAM and 64GB storage, that is further expandable. However, the cameras are average on both sides, you have 18W fast charging support for the 5,000mAh battery that offers long battery life. Realme 8 5G has strong competition from the Redmi Note 10 series and we suggest you pick the latter.

Itel Magic 2 4G is a typical budget feature phone that offers long battery life, gets a QWERTY keypad and yet still supports 4G connectivity. It also has Wi-Fi and Bluetooth options, and the storage is expandable. However, the phone gets 64MB RAM only and the main camera is average. Buy if you need a rugged secondary phone for usage.

Vivo Y51A 6GB RAM is an option for buyers but its features are a mixed bag. You get 6GB RAM on board with 128GB storage for the price, which is further expandable. The Full HD+ display is bright and colorful but misses out on AMOLED panel and high refresh rate support. The cameras are decent but we expect better in this range. The battery life is good but 18W fast charging is not the standard anymore. Buy this phone if you need more RAM and storage.

The Infinix Smart 5A comes with a 6.52-inch display that has HD+ pixel resolution. The phone packs 2GB of RAM and is powered by Helio A20 SoC. The device offers average hardware performance. You get a dual-camera setup on the device which consists of a 13MP main camera. The smartphone packs a 5000mAh battery which can deliver a day's battery life. You can go with the Infinix Smart 5A if you are looking for a smartphone with long-lasting battery life. However, don't expect the handset to offer impressive performance.

Realme C21Y is a hard-core budget phone that offers 4GB RAM with 64GB storage for under Rs 10,000. It is the first Realme phone to use Unisoc chipset that results in average overall performance. The triple rear cameras give you photos in decent quality, and the long battery life is always a bonus. Having said that, the phone's selfie camera shoots mediocre images, the performance takes a hit because of the hardware and microUSB port for charging is a drawback.

The Redmi Note 10 Lite comes with a 6.67-inch IPS LCD display that has Full HD+ resolution. The device is powered by Snapdragon 720G SoC. The smartphone features a 48MP primary main camera. The device packs a 5000mAh that has 18W fast charging support. The smartphone lacks higher refresh rate. The device is heavier in weight, as it weighs 209 grams. If the higher refresh rate and 209 gram weight isn't a concern, the Redmi Note 10 Lite is the best device as you can expect the phone to offer longer battery life and excellent performance.

The Tecno Spark 8P is loaded with a host of interesting features that make it a good device to consider. The phone packs a decent processor and comes with a large display. The phone also features 18W fast charging support and a 5,000mAh battery, which can last one full day of usage. Moreover, it comes with a decent set of cameras, if not great. Overall, if you are looking to buy a smartphone under this price range, then you can consider this as one of the options.

Samsung Galaxy A52s 5G sports a 6.5-inch AMOLED display and it is powered by Snapdragon 750G SoC. The smartphone can take some good images, thanks to a 64MP quad-camera setup. The selfie camera on the device is of 32MP. The phone packs 8GB of RAM. However, the device is costlier and it is filled with bloatware. The phone offers only offers 15W fast charging. If your budget is less than Rs 35,000, you can go for the OnePlus Nord 2 or the Realme GT Master Edition 5G as they offer some excellent specs when compared to the Galaxy A52s 5G.

Moto E40 comes with a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display. The device is powered by an octa-core Unisoc T700 chipset. The smartphone packs 4GB of RAM and 64GB of internal storage. The smartphone boots Android 11 out of the box. The device packs a 5000mAh battery. The performance of the device is average. Additionally, the phone lacks fast charging support. If you are looking for a smartphone with a bigger display and longer battery life, then the Moto E40 is the ideal offering.

Apple iPhone 13 Pro features a 6.1-inch Super Retina OLED display. The display panel has a 120Hz refresh rate. The phone comes powered by Apple's A15 Bionic chipset which offers impressive performance. The iPhone 13 Pro packs 512GB of internal storage. The rear-facing camera takes good images, thanks to a 12MP triple-camera setup. However, you cannot expand storage and there's no headphone jack port either. The charging capability is limited to 20W. You can go for the iPhone 13 Pro if you are upgrading from a two or three year old iPhone model.

Apple iPhone 13 Pro is the first from the company to get ProMotion 120Hz display. It also features a 6.1-inch Super Retina OLED display, powered by new A15 Bionic chip with 6GB RAM and offers 256GB storage. The triple cameras have gotten much better thanks to bigger sensors on board. The battery life sees a big improvement as well. However, the model comes without headphone jack, memory card slot and 20W fast charging is not sufficient for the price. Get the new iPhone 13 Pro for its improved screen, cameras and battery but you have to pay a premium for it.

The Realme Narzo 50i comes with a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display. The display panel has a HD+ resolution. The device is powered by a Unisoc chipset, which offers average performance. The phone lacks a fingerprint sensor. It packs a 5000mAh battery. The device has a microUSB port. In a similar price range, the Redmi 9 Activ is a much better device, considering that it comes with a Helio G35 SoC and has a fingerprint sensor as well.

iQOO Z5 5G is the latest device to get Snapdragon 778G chipset and with 12GB RAM you get top-notch performance and battery life. The display supports 120Hz refresh rate but misses out on AMOLED panel for better quality. The 256GB storage is not expandable, the primary rear camera clicks good photos, and 44W charging speed is always helpful. However, the software needs a bit of clean up because of bloatware. Worth buying if you need a performance-centric phone.

Tecno Spark 8 64GB variant is pretty much the same phone, except you get it with 4GB RAM and 64GB storage which is further expandable. The camera gives you decent quality but only a single sensor is not appealing for buyers anymore in this range. Again, you have other options in the market that are better.

Xiaomi Redmi Note 11T is the new 5G mid-range phone from the brand. It uses the new Dimensity 810 chipset with 8GB RAM for reliable performance. You get 128GB storage for the price but the expansion comes at the cost of second SIM. The screen misses out on AMOLED panel as well. But you get long battery backup with 33W fast charging support. The dual rear cameras are average for the price.

The Xiaomi Mi 11i comes with a 6.44-inch AMOLED display. The display panel has a 395 PPI pixel density and a Full HD+ resolution. The device offers excellent performance in terms of cameras and hardware. The handset offers 67W fast charging support. However, the device lacks wireless charging support. Overall the Xiaomi Mi 11i is a good phone as you get a AMOLED display, faster charging and excellent cameras.

The Infinix Note 11 boasts a 6.7-inch AMOLED display. The device is powered by Helio G88 processor, which offers excellent performance. The device comes with 128GB of internal storage, packs a 5,000mAh battery, and offers 33W fast charging support. However, it doesn't offer higher refresh rate display, and storage is expandable up to 512GB only. If you are you to purchase smartphone with long battery life, and want an AMOLED display, you can consider buying the Infinix Note 11.

The Moto G22 is a decent budget-centric smartphone from the company. The handset offers a tall design and packs a good display to help you with your daily usage. The phone can also perform day-to-day tasks easily and offers a decent pair of cameras. Overall, if you are looking for a stable smartphone under Rs 10,000 budget, you can consider the Moto G22 handset.

The Realme 9i is a decent option for buyers in the market. The device flaunts a 6.6-inch IPS LCD display and it is powered by Snapdragon 680 processor. It packs 128GB storage which is expandable using a dedicated microSD card slot. The cameras also take some good images. The handset offers 33W fast charging support. Overall, the Realme 9i is a good phone in the Rs 14,000 price range.

Redmi Note 11S 8GB RAM variant has everything you can ask from a mid-range phone. And because it comes with a 4G chipset other features are more than appealing for this price tag. You get an AMOLED display, 8GB RAM, 128GB storage which is expandable and quality rear cameras. Buy it with all confidence.

Realme 9 5G SE is the latest 5G phone from the brand, and the first in this range to offer 144Hz refresh rate display. It also gets the Snapdragon 778G chipset which has become a reliable choice for gamers. The main camera does well, the storage is expandable, and the battery gets 30W fast charging. However, it comes without an AMOLED panel, the design has been done a lot, Android 11 out of the box isn't good now, and the front camera gives you normal selfies. You can consider other options available in the range.

The iQOO Z6 5G comes with a 6.58-inch IPS LCD display that has Full HD+ resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate. Thanks to the Snapdragon 695 processor and 8GB of RAM, the device offers excellent performance. The smartphone features a 50MP camera which takes some good images. The device runs the latest Android 12 version out of the box. If you are looking for a 5G handset with the latest Android 12 software version and a 120Hz refresh rate display, then you can consider buying the iQOO Z6 5G.

The Galaxy A13 is a 4G device by Samsung priced at Rs 15,999. The device sports a 6.6-inch TFT display that has Full HD+ resolution. The smartphone packs an Exynos 850 processor which is paired with 4GB of RAM. Thanks to the 50MP quad-camera setup, the handset takes some good images. The device runs the latest Android 12 software version and packs a 5,000mAh battery. In the Rs 15,999 price range, you can explore other options like Poco M4 Pro 5G or iQOO Z6 5G, if you are looking for a smartphone with 5G support and a higher refresh rate display.

The iQOO Z6 Pro 5G 256GB model is meant for those who want to have the best of iQOO on a budget. The latest smartphone from the brand brings some interesting features and specifications like the 66W fast charging support, AMOLED display, and more. However, the phone also misses on some points like no headphone jack and no option to expand the storage. That said, if you consider the price segment, this is probably one of the best offerings from the brand.

The OnePlus Nord CE 2 Lite 5G offers a host of interesting features in this price point. The phone is loaded with a 120Hz display, though it misses out on AMOLED panel. The device is powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 695 processor, which delivers some good performance in different conditions. The cameras seem to be decent as well, though an ultra-wide-angle lens will be missed. Moreover, the phone also misses the iconic alert slider, which is present in all OnePlus smartphones. That said, if you are looking for a smartphone with fluid user interface and good performance, then you can consider buying OnePlus Nord CE 2 Lite 5G.

The Vivo T1 44W 6GB RAM is the company's attempt to provide more options in the sub Rs 20,000 price segment. The smartphone brings a host of interesting features like 44W fast charging support, an AMOLED display, an in-display fingerprint sensor, and a reliable Snapdragon 680 processor. The company has added enough arsenal to compete with other phones present in this price segment. Overall, if you are looking for some rare features like an in-display fingerprint sensor and 44W fast charging support in this price segment, then the Vivo T1 44W 6GB RAM will make sense to you.

The Vivo Y15c 64GB is an interesting option in this price range. The smartphone comes with some standard specifications, though the design makes it stand out from the crowd. So, if you are looking for a stylish smartphone that handles most of the daily tasks, then you can consider Vivo Y15c 64GB model.

The Realme C30 3GB RAM option is easily one of the best recommendation under the Rs 8,000 price segment. The smartphone comes with a pleasing design and is available in attractive colour options. The phone also bears some decent specifications and features, which is enough for an entry-level smartphone. Moreover, you get a decent battery life, though the cameras could have been better.

The Infinix Smart 6 HD is a decent smartphone for people looking for long battery life and a large display. However, it falls short in terms of providing a dependable camera, solid build quality, quick charging and a zippy performance.

The latest POCO M5 128GB model offers some good features and specifications at this price point. The handset offers the latest MediaTek Helio G99 processor and comes with a premium design language. The phone also brings a 90Hz display that provides some good viewing angles. Moreover, the model also delivers good battery life and good day-to-day performance. So, if you are looking for a smartphone under the Rs 15,000 price segment, you can definitely consider this device.

The Lava Yuva Pro is quite an interesting smartphone in this price segment. The handset packs a large display and offers some decent features such as 5000mAh battery, 3.5mm headphone jack, and expandable storage option. The device also comes with a decent performance in this price segment, though you might find better-performing phones. Moreover, if you are looking for an Indian brand and your budget is around Rs 7,799, then you can consider this device.

The Infinix Zero 2023 is a good option in this price range. The smartphone delivers some good performance in this segment and packs a decent set of specifications that gives stiff competition to other models in this price category. Overall, it can be considered as a good option if you are looking for a budget-centric smartphone.

The Realme 10 128GB is yet another stylish smartphone from Infinix. The phone has several fantastic features and an excellent design language. First off, the device has a sizable display and a MediaTek Helio G99 processor that provides reliable performance. The device also includes a high storage capacity, which is also extensible. Realme 10 128GB is undoubtedly a viable option if you're seeking a smartphone with a respectable user experience.

The Infinix Hot 20 boasts a 6.67-inch IPS LCD display. Under the hood, the phone is equipped with Dimensity 810 SoC which offers great performance. The device features a 50MP camera, which takes some average images. The phone still runs Android 12 OS out of the box. The handset offers 18W fast charging support and has 5G connectivity support as well. If you are primarily looking for a 5G phone with bigger display, and good performance, then the Infinix Hot 20 is a good option.

The Vivo V27 Pro is a stylish device that offers reliable performance and excellent camera capabilities for both front and rear cameras. Its standout feature is the color-changing back panel, and its slim design adds to its overall appeal. Priced under Rs 40K, it's a great option in its category.

The Tecno Spark 10 offers impressive 5G capability and performance on a budget. Powered by the Mediatek Dimensity 6020 SoC, it delivers solid performance and battery life. However, it lacks a full HD display and fast charging. Ideal for 5G seekers on a budget under Rs 12,000.

The Redmi Note 12 256GB is a little step up over the Redmi Note 11. The smartphone features a new design language and performs well in this price range. You get a 120Hz AMOLED display as well as a 5G chipset with adequate performance. The phone also includes a 33W fast charging port, which is a welcome feature. Overall, if you're searching for a dependable choice around Rs 20,000, this gadget is worth considering.

The Tecno Spark 10 5G 128GB offers impressive features, including a powerful MediaTek Dimensity 6020 chipset, 8 GB of RAM, and a vibrant 6.6-inch display. However, it falls short with its lower resolution display and lack of NFC support.

The Nokia C22 is a budget smartphone with a good balance of features and performance. It has a large 6.5-inch HD+ display, a long-lasting 5000mAh battery, and a capable 13MP dual-camera system. However, it is powered by an entry-level Unisoc SC9863A processor, which can be slow at times. Overall, the Nokia C22 is a good option for budget-minded buyers who are looking for a reliable smartphone with a large display and long battery life.

The Xiaomi Redmi A2 2023 64GB offers a budget-friendly option with a sleek design, vibrant display, and reliable performance. The dual rear camera captures decent photos. However, the low-resolution display and absence of a fingerprint sensor are drawbacks. Overall, it's a solid choice for those seeking affordability and basic smartphone functionalities.

The budget-focused Realme C53 has some drawbacks, particularly in camera performance and overall speed. While the battery life and display are decent, the device faces tough competition within its price range. However, Realme fans on a tight budget might find the 4GB RAM variant of the C55, priced at Rs 9,999, a more suitable option.

The Galaxy Z Flip 5 impresses with its versatile appeal for its durable, and pocket-friendly design. With enhanced specifications, a durable build, and increased storage, it stands out as the top choice for flip-style phones. It is an excellent choice if budget is not a concern.

mobile_name: Infinix Note 40 Pro Plus 5G Racing Edition

expert_view: The Mi Mix 2 lacks behind in UI design and camera performance. Also, other smartphones in the price, like the OnePlus 5T and Nokia 8 perform better.
The Redmi 5 is one of the better alternatives available in the entry-level segment. The phone is equipped with decent hardware and software for moderate tasks.

Apart from its boring design, most other aspects of the Honor 7A are better than or similar to best-selling phones. It has a modern screen layout, decent performance, good-quality cameras, fingerprint reader and a dual-camera setup at the rear.
The Vivo Y71i is a mediocre offering in its price range. There are way better alternatives from Xiaomi and Asus.

The Vivo Y83 Pro features a larger screen and a power-efficient processor, but its dual-camera setup is quite basic and the software design looks outdated. Phones from Honor, Realme and Xiamo offer better specifications for the same price.

The Vivo V9 Pro is the first smartphone from the brand in a long time that is worth purchasing. The smartphone has its flaws, like the small battery capacity and not so impressive camera performance, but I think the strong processor helps it overcome its weaknesses. If you are in the market for a mid-range smartphone, you should consider the Vivo V9 Pro.

The OPPO K3 is one of the best phones under Rs 15,000 in the Indian market (as of September 2019). It has a sober design, an AMOLED screen with an in-display fingerprint reader, a fast processor, a cleaner and better version of ColorOS, a long-lasting battery life, 20W fast charging, and a USB Type-C port.  It is essentially a rebranded Realme X with a 16MP+2MP rear camera setup rather than a 48MP+5MP camera. The only areas where it falls slightly short is its cameras and its software UI. The OPPO K3 comes with just two rear-facing sensors. OPPO also needs to improve ColorOS to add more customizability and cohesiveness. If you don't care too much about ultrawide-angle cameras, you should definitely consider the OPPO K3.

The Moto One Action seems like a good buy but the battery life is one factor that works against it. It's worth looking at if you don't want to go for the usual Redmi/Realme/Oppo/Vivo phones and also prefer stock Android.

All in all, the Moto G8 Plus is a pretty sweet deal as it offers excellent value for money. The rear camera system is impressive and definitely one of the highlights of this device. The phone is a good option if you're looking for something other than Realme and Xiaomi devices.

The only reason for you to buy the Infinix S5 Pro would be that its screen is free of any kind of notch. Other than that, the Infinix S5 Pro, unfortunately, lacks behind the other smartphones in the segment like the Redmi Note 8 and the Realme 5 Pro in almost every aspect.
Honor 9A could have been a great device if the brand had spent money on the processor and connectivity options of the device rather than spending it on offering premium design and large display.

The Realme X3 Super Zoom Edition packs impressive cameras, massive battery life and also offers smooth performance. Low-light camera performance is still a bit of concern. However, the overall performance of the phone is quite impressive.

Xiaomi Poco M2 Pro 6GB variant packs a Full HD+ display, comes powered by Snapdragon 720 processor and features a quad rear camera setup. You also get a 5,000mAh battery that supports 33W fast charging. However, at this price, we would have liked the screen on M2 Pro to support 90Hz refresh rate.

Infinix Smart 4 Plus comes with Helio A25 processor, and the 6.8-inch display supports HD+ resolution. The phone packs dual rear cameras but it comes loaded with a mammoth 6,000mAh battery and runs on the latest Android 10 version out of box.

Vivo X50 256GB gets an AMOLED display with 90Hz refresh rate, 8GB RAM and offers 256GB storage. The quad rear cameras and the front camera are pretty good and the battery onboard supports fast charging. But the chipset used on the phone ranks as a mid-ranger, and the storage is not expandable. Even the battery life is average.

Xiaomi Redmi Note 9 Pro features a big display with Corning Gorilla Glass 5 for protection. The phone packs the powerful Snapdragon 720G processor and you have a quad rear camera setup that features an ultrawide sensor. Also, you get a 5,000mAh battery that offers decent backup. Having said that, Redmi Note 9 Pro misses out on high refresh rate support and the charging speed is on the slower side in the market as well.

The Vivo Y1s lacks basic features that even the cheaper smartphones offer. Going by the feature-set it offers, the Vivo Y1s should have been priced at a much lower price point. However, if you find a good deal on the smartphone, the Vivo Y1s is by all means a capable smartphone to carry out day to day tasks.
The Itel Power 110 is a great choice for those who want an affordable feature phone with a long battery backup. Although, if you need a large display, you need to look elsewhere.

Moto G9 gives you the promise of clean Android interface without any bloatware. Its design has an appealing effect, and the water-repellent coating is a bonus. The triple rear cameras can click decent photos in daylight and the battery backup is pretty solid as well. Having said that, you get HD+ resolution on a 6.5-inch screen and the hardware fails to match with the performance of others in the segment.

Xiaomi Poco X3 gives you everything that a competent phone should offer. Big screen, with high refresh rate support, solid hardware under the hood, quality cameras on board, at the front and back, and solid battery life with fast charging in tow. However, the X3 comes with hybrid SIM slot and the overall dimensions make it heavier on the hand.

The Samsung Galaxy F41 128GB is a decent phone with a stylish design and crisp AMOLED display. The 6000mAh battery offers power backup that lasts easily for more than a day of usage. The camera performance is another notable aspect of the phone. Overall, it is a good phone to purchase.

Samsung has added the Galaxy M02 to its lineup. This budget Android phone features a big 6.5-inch HD+ screen but using quad-core chipset in 2021 is rather inexplicable. Add to that, you have 2GB RAM which does not cut out for smartphone users nowadays. Having said that, you get Android 10 pre-installed, it has dual rear cameras and a big capacity battery for long backup. If you are on a strict budget, the Galaxy M02 is worth looking at.

The new Realme X3 SuperZoom Edition is an elegantly designed handset with great specs under the hood. It packs an excellent display, fantastic camera setup, huge 4200mAh battery. When it comes to cons, the device lacks a 3.5mm headphone jack and does not support expandable memory; overall, it is a good device to have at this price range.

Vivo Y20A is a budget offering from the brand that comes with decent specifications. The brand's budget offering does pack features such as a tall 6.51-inches bezel-less display, decent camera configuration, and a large 5000mAh battery. When it comes to cons, the device is powered by an outdated MediaTek Helio P35 chipset, it has no USB Type-C port, and it also does not support fast charging.

Lava Z2 is an Android Go device that runs toned-down apps with the help of 2GB RAM. The phone gets dual rear cameras and a decent selfie camera that supports video calls as well. The octa-core chipset will deliver performance, and the HD+ screen is big enough for all your needs. In fact, having a 5,000mAh battery means you get long backup on a single charge. Decent choice for budget buyers.

Realme C21 is a new budget offering in the brand's C-series lineup of smartphones. The brand brings in impressive specs at an affordable price range. The notable features of the smartphone include a big 6.5-inches display, a triple camera setup on the rear that comprises a 13MP primary camera, and two 2MP cameras. Upfront, the phone features a single 5MP selfie camera. The MediaTek Helio G35 processor is a bit below average. Also, the other down points include the absence of fast charging support and only 32GB internal memory.

The Redmi Note 10 Pro 128GB is a quality offering from the brand packed with an impressive specs sheet. The device's notable features include 6.67-inches Super AMOLED, HDR10+ display, quad-rear cameras (64MP+8MP+5MP+2MP), 6GB RAM, 128GB storage, and a solid 5020mAh battery with 33W fast-charging support. The device makes up for little flaws like camera performance and MIUI12 user interface skin with its scorching performance.

Samsung Galaxy A52 competes in a crowded market with average hardware in tow. Yes, the Super AMOLED screen is a big plus but only supports 90Hz refresh rate at this price. The cameras do a decent job and even the selfie camera is quite competent. But having 4500mAh battery might not prove adequate for most power users. Worth going for if you rely on a brand name and want to avoid the Chinese devices. Otherwise, much better options available in this price range.

Samsung has added the Galaxy F12 to its budget lineup. This phone packs an intriguing set of features. While it sports a 6.5-inch HD+ display, you get 90Hz refresh rate support which is exciting to have at this price. Then you get the Exynos 850 chipset paired with 4GB RAM for decent day-to-day performance. The cameras deliver on both fronts, and 6,000mAh battery promises life of day or more with ease. Worth having in your buying list among other options.

Oppo A54 runs on Android 10 OS which is not ideal in 2021. It comes powered by Helio P35 chipset with 4GB RAM that gives you basic performance for daily usage. The triple cameras get the job done in daylight, but the low light quality is average. The 5,000mAh battery offers long life and supports 18W fast charging. But the screen gets HD+ resolution, it lacks refresh rate support. We'd recommend you to look at other capable devices in this price range.

Realme X7 Max 256GB is the first phone to use MediaTek Dimensity 1200 chipset, and it gets major hardware power to support performance needs. You have 12GB RAM onboard, 256GB storage. The AMOLED screen supports 120Hz refresh rate and gets Dragontrail protection. The cameras at the back do a fine job in limited conditions and having 50W charging support is always handy. However, the design is flat, the storage is not expandable and both the battery life and selfie camera are average. You can consider the Mi 11X or the iQOO 7 for this price.

Realme C25s comes with a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display. The display panel however has a standard 60Hz refresh rate and only HD+ pixel resolution. The device is powered by octa-core Helio G85 SoC. The phone latest Android 11 out of the box. The C25s have average cameras, and just 18W fast charging support. If you are looking for a budget-oriented device with LCD display and a bigger 6000mAh battery, you should go with Realme C25s. However, you will have to compromise on cameras and fast charging support.

Nokia 110 4G is a feature phone with colour display that lets you take 4G voice calls, including VoLTE. The device features a TFT screen, offers expandable storage and like other phones in this segment, gets long battery life. However, 48MP internal storage is not adequate and the camera is average. Go for this device is you need a secondary 4G phone that offers long backup.

Infinix Hot 10 Play comes with a 6.82-inch IPS LCD display and is powered by a Helio G35 chipset. The phone packs 3GB of RAM and runs Android 11 out of the box. The device offers mediocre performance and has average cameras. Also, it doesn't offer any kind of fast charging. If you are looking for a smartphone with the latest Android 11 and 6000mAh battery, you can go with Infinix Hot 10 Play.

OnePlus Nord 2 256GB variant gets 12GB RAM which bumps up the performance of the Dimensity 1200 chipset by a notch. You get a 90Hz AMOLED display, premium design, decent cameras, and fast charging support for this price. However, Nord 2 misses out on expandable storage, headphone jack and even with fast charging, the overall battery takes a hit. If you need a power-packed device with 12GB RAM for under Rs 35,000 you can consider the Nord 2 for sure.

Samsung Galaxy A03s 64GB is a basic phone that feels slightly overpriced. You get a large display but only HD+ screen quality, that too a TFT panel. It comes powered by MediaTek Helio P35 chipset with 4GB RAM that will get simple computing tasks done. The cameras click average photos, but you get long battery life out of all this. Better to skip this for other options in this price range.

The Vivo Y21 2021 features a 6.51-inch IPS LCD display. The smartphone is powered by Helio P35 SoC, which offers average performance. The camera on the device are also average. The phone sports a 13MP selfie camera. The device packs a 5000mAh battery which can last throughout the day. However, you only get an 18W fast charging support. In a similar price range, you can go for Redmi Note 10, or Poco M2 Pro as these devices offer some great specifications and faster-charging support.

Apple iPhone 13 Pro Max gets bigger and heavier thanks to the new battery added inside. It features 120Hz Retina OLED display, comes powered by A15 Bionic chip with 6GB RAM and gives you the best camera experience in all conditions. The front camera is not too bad either. But the bigger size can be unwieldy, the phone comes without headphone jack and memory card slot. And for this price, we expect better than 20W charging speed. Buy the latest iPhone Pro Max model for its screen quality and cameras.

The Redmi 9A Sport comes with a 6.53-inch IPS LCD display that has HD+ resolution. The device is powered by a Helio G25 chipset. It features a 13MP primary main camera. On the front side the handset sports a 5MP selfie camera. The device lacks a fingerprint sensor and it has a microUSB 2.0 port. The smartphone packs a 5000mAh battery. If the camera and hardware isn't a concern and you are looking for a smartphone with a longer battery backup, the Redmi 9A Sport is the ideal device.

OPPO Reno6 Pro 5g Diwali Edition is the same phone like the regular model, except it gets 12GB RAM with 256GB storage by default. It comes powered by Dimensity 1200 chipset, sports a 90Hz AMOLED display, the gets decent rear cameras. Having said that, the storage is not expandable, and it comes without headphone jack. Worth considering for the price.

Redmi 9i Sport is a basic smartphone that helps people upgrade from a feature phone. It features a large 6.53-inch display, offers long backup and comes with 4GB which is decent for the price. However, the performance is not very good, cameras are basic and you get microUSB 2.0 port for charging. Only worth getting if you need a basic phone on a budget.

The Redmi 9A Sport is another budget phone that helps people if they need a secondary device. It sports a 6.53-inch HD+ display, powered by MediaTek Helio G25 chipset with 3GB RAM. The cameras are mediocre, but the battery life is good for dual SIM usage. Better to skip this one.

Samsung Galaxy F42 with 8GB RAM delivers better performance and gives 5G support via MediaTek Dimensity 700 chipset. The rear triple cameras click decent photos. And the storage is expandable. But the TFT display, bulky design with notch and just 15W charging speed bring its value down. Far better options available in this price range worth  buying.

The Xiaomi 11 Lite NE 5G has a 6.5-inch AMOLED display. The display panel offers Full HD+ resolution and up to 120Hz refresh rate. The device is powered by an octa-core Snapdragon 778G SoC. The smartphone has a 5000mAh battery that supports 33W fast charging support. The device lacks a 3.5mm headphone jack. If you are looking for a smartphone in the Rs 30,000 price segment, the Xiaomi 11 Lite NE 5G is the ideal phone, considering it offers excellent performance and 5G connectivity.

The Tecno Camon 18 sports a 6.8-inch IPS LCD display with a 90Hz refresh rate. The device is powered by an octa-core Helio G85 processor which is accompanied by 4GB of RAM. The handset takes some good images, thanks to a 48MP dual-camera setup. The device lacks a 5G support and has only a 60Hz refresh rate. If you want decent cameras and long-lasting battery life, then you can buy the Tecno Camon 18.

The Lava Agni 5G boasts a 6.78-inch IPS LCD display with a Full HD+ resolution. The has a 90Hz refresh rate and decent viewing angles. An octa-core Dimensity 810 SoC accompanied with 8GB of RAM, powers the Agni 5G. The device offers decent performance. The smartphone runs Android 11 out of the box with near-stock Android UI on top. A 5,000mAh battery powers the handset that supports 30W fast charging support. If you are looking for a good battery life along with fast charging, and decent hardware performance, you should definitely go for the Agni 5G.

The Vivo V23 5G comes with a 6.4-inch AMOLED display that has Full HD+ resolution. The display panel has HDR 10+ support. The device has a 64MP triple-camera setup, which takes some good images. Thanks to Dimensity 920 SoC and 12GB of RAM, the device offers excellent performance. The smartphone has 44W fast charging support. The Vivo V23 overall is a good phone in Rs 35,000 price range, considering that the device has a brighter AMOLED panel, up to 44W charging support and a 64MP triple-camera setup.

Samsung's new Galaxy S21 FE model in the market top-end features at a lower price. But this year the pricing does not match up with the hardware. You get it with a smaller 6.4-inch AMOLED 120Hz display, with 8GB RAM and 256GB storage which is non-expandable. The phone gets IP68 rating for dust and water resistance. The cameras also deliver quality. Still a decent bet for most users.

The Redmi Note 11 features a 6.43-inch AMOLED display that has Full HD+ resolution and a 90Hz refresh rate. The device is powered by Snapdragon 680 processor, which offers great performance. The handset has 33W fast charging support. It packs a 5,000mAh battery, which offers long-lasting battery life. In Rs 15,000 price range, the Redmi Note 11 is a good smartphone, as the handset offers an AMOLED display, decent performance, and up to 33W fast charging support.

The Poco M4 Pro 5G is a good smartphone for the price. The device boasts a 6.6-inch IPS LCD display with a 90Hz refresh rate. Thanks to 8GB of RAM and Dimensity 810 SoC, the device offers excellent performance. The smartphone packs a 5,000mAh battery which lasts throughout the day. The handset has a 33W fast charging support. That said, the Poco M4 Pro is a powerful smartphone, as you get a 90Hz panel, good hardware and fast charging support.

The entry-level smartphone from Lava offers optimum features for everyday activities. The smartphone offers a good display for viewing. The Octa-Core CPU provides decent performance while multitasking. The device lacks a fingerprint sensor.

Redmi has been slowly expanding its Redmi Note 11 line-up and the latest to join the Note series is the Redmi Note 11 Pro 8GB. The Redmi Note 11 Pro 8GB comes with an IP53 rating, which makes it resistant to dust and splashes. The phone has a stylish design, good display, large battery, and quick charging speed. The phone's gaming and CPU performance are impressive.

The Oppo K10 is extremely similar in look and features to the newly introduced Oppo A96 but offers greater value due to its stereo speakers, macro camera, and IP54 certification. The K10 offers excellent battery life, a relatively short charging time, an attractive display, and snappy overall performance. The Oppo K10's primary flaws are its subpar video recording capabilities.

The Samsung Galaxy A33 5G 8GB RAM is probably a better option than the 6GB RAM model. The phone delivers better RAM capacity, which translates to better multitasking. Moreover, the phone comes with a reliable Exynos processor that can handle most of the day-to-day tasks with ease. The phone also comes with a 5,000mAh battery, which can last one full day, though we wished the company could have introduced a faster charging solution. That being said, the Samsung Galaxy A33 5G 8GB RAM model can be considered a decent option in this price range.

The Vivo T1 Pro 8GB RAM is probably one of the best options in this price range. The smartphone comes with a premium design language and offers reliable performance. The cameras are also decent, which can click high-quality images in different conditions. The 66W fast charging support is the star of the show here, which makes it an interesting option to consider if you are looking for a fast-charging phone in this price range.

The Motorola Edge 30 8GB RAM is one of the best options you can get under the Rs 30,000 price segment. The smartphone packs an OLED display and comes with the highest 144Hz screen refresh rate, which is a rare thing in this segment. The device is loaded with a reliable Qualcomm chipset and comes with decent cameras. Overall, if you are looking for a clean Android experience and reliable performance, then Motorola Edge 30 with 8GB RAM can be considered a good option.

The Realme Narzo 50 Pro 5G 8GB RAM model is probably one of the most premium Narzo smartphones available in the market. The smartphone packs a premium design language and offers some great features and specifications. So, if you are looking for a stylish yet reliable smartphone in this price range, then Realme Narzo 50 Pro 8GB RAM suits you best.

The Moto G82 5G 8GB RAM is probably one of the best options you can get under the Rs 25,000 price segment. The handset offers a premium design and comes with reliable performance. The star of the show is the display, which offers vivid colours and good viewing angles. This coupled with a 5,000mAh battery with 30W fast charging support makes it an interesting choice in this price segment.

The Nokia G11 plus features a 6.51-inches HD+ IPS LCD panel that renders a 90Hz refresh rate and 400 nits brightness. In the camera department, you will get a dual camera offering a 50MP primary with a 2MP depth with 1080p video recording. This phone has a fingerprint sensor on the back side body. The device packs a 5000mAh battery with 18W fast charging support. There is no 5G support, if you are fine with 4G LTE broadband connections, then NOKIA G11 PLUS is recommended to buy.

The Samsung Galaxy M13 128GB option is considered a good option in this price segment. The smartphone is loaded with a decent design and offers a large 6.6-inch display. One of the major highlights of the handset is the 6,000mAh battery and RAM Plus technology that delivers a decent performance. Moreover, the cameras seem to be an upgrade as compared to their predecessor.

The Vivo T1x 6GB RAM option seems to be quite a decent option in this price segment. The handset comes loaded with some premium design and packs some competitive internals. The model features a 7-layer cooling system, which is a segment-leading feature and will help in the gaming performance. Moreover, the phone also features a decent set of cameras, though the ultra-wide-angle lens is missing. That said, it is still one of the best options to consider in this price segment.

In this pricing range, the Xiaomi Redmi A1 Plus certainly appears like an intriguing choice. The device has a respectable design aesthetic and a dependable MediaTek CPU that can manage the majority of daily duties. The model also has a respectable battery, however, it would have been nice to have some type of rapid charging. As a result, You may take this into consideration if you're searching for a cheap smartphone.

The Moto E22s is yet another interesting smartphone from Motorola. The latest smartphone offers a good design language in this price range. Moreover, you get a reliable processor and close-to-stock Android experience, which makes it easier to use the device for day-to-day usage. On the downside, the cameras need some improvements. That being said, if you are looking for a budget-centric smartphone with a stock Android feel, then you can consider this device.

The Nokia C31 is designed for individuals looking for an entry-level smartphone with security features. The smartphone has a 6.7-inch HD+ display with a 20:9 aspect ratio. The device is powered by an octa-core Unisoc SC9863A CPU and a PowerVR GE8322 GPU. The Nokia C31 has a triple-camera setup that includes a 13MP main sensor and two 2MP sensors. The Nokia smartphone has a plethora of exciting connectivity possibilities as well as an intriguing design language. So, if you're searching for a low-cost smartphone with a simple Android user interface, this is a good option.

The iQOO Z6 Lite 5G 128GB model is undoubtedly an interesting option to consider in this price segment. The handset comes loaded with the latest Qualcomm Snapdragon 5G chipset, which is an excellent addition to this segment. Moreover, it also features a good combination of the right features and aggressive price points. This makes it one of the best devices you can get at this price range.

The Nokia C31 64GB is meant for those who want an entry-level smartphone with peace of mind. The device features a 6.7-inch HD+ display with a 20:9 aspect ratio. An octa-core Unisoc SC9863A CPU and a PowerVR GE8322 GPU power the gadget. The Nokia C31 features a triple-camera configuration with a 13MP primary sensor and two 2MP cameras. The Nokia smartphone comes with a slew of intriguing connection options and an intriguing design language. So, you can consider this smartphone if you are looking for a budget smartphone with a clean Android user interface.

The Samsung Galaxy M04 128GB is the latest smartphone in the budget segment from Samsung, which is targeted towards the masses. The phone has a nice look and solid performance. It is equipped with a MediaTek Helio P35 processor that is suitable for everyday use. Furthermore, the battery backup is adequate, despite the fact that the manufacturer only offers 15W fast charging support. Having said that, the phone is a decent buy in this price range.

The Redmi Note 12 Pro 5G features an AMOLED display. The screen of the device measures about 6.67-inches which offers up to 120Hz refresh rate. Under the hood, the phone packs an octa-core Dimensity 1080 SoC which offers good performance. The phone also supports 5G and offers up to 67W fast charging. Priced at near Rs 28K, the Redmi Note 12 Pro 5G is a good phone, as users get a 120Hz AMOLED display, 67W fast charging support, 5G, and good performance.

The Poco C55 is an entry-level smartphone from Poco. The device comes with a 6.71-inch IPS LCD display that has HD+ resolution and a standard 60Hz refresh rate. The phone is equipped with an octa-core Helio G85 SoC, which handles all the tasks with ease. The camera performance on the device is average. Additionally, the smartphone runs Android 12 OS, and it has only 10W charging support. In the near Rs 11,000 price range, the Redmi 11 Prime 5G, Realme 10 are better smartphones than the Poco C55, considering the specifications you get.

The vivo V27 256GB offers a super smooth display with a 120Hz refresh rate, along with a colour-changing back panel and stunning back and selfie cameras. However, its battery capacity could be better, and there's no expandable storage option or 3.5mm audio jack. Other options to consider in this price range include the Oneplus 11R and realme GT 2 Pro 5G.

The Nokia C12 Pro is an entry-level 4G smartphone from Nokia priced at Rs 6,999. The device features a 6.3-inch HD+ display and it is powered by Unisoc 9863A1 processor, which offers average performance. The handset runs Android 12 Go Edition out of the box, and it is promised to receive 2 years of security patches. If you are looking to buy a smartphone priced at under Rs 10,000 for all your basic needs, then you can consider Nokia C12 Pro.

The Nokia C12 Pro is an entry-level smartphone with the Android Go operating system and scratch-resistant glass. However, it has a low battery capacity of just 4,000mAh and no Full HD display. Its processing performance is also low, thanks to the 28nm Unisoc chipset. Other options to consider in this price range include the POCO C31 and Redmi A1.

The Vivo Y100 is a great budget phone that boasts an AMOLED display with impressive brightness and a sleek, ergonomic design. It also has a powerful 64MP camera. However, it falls short on battery life and lacks a dedicated expandable storage slot. The Nothing Phone (1) and Redmi Note 12 Pro Plus are good alternatives to consider.

The vivo X90 is a premium flagship smartphone with a slim and curved design, high-end CPU and GPU performance, impressive camera performance, and super-fast 120W charging speed. It also features a stunning 120Hz 10-bit AMOLED display and FunTouchOS 13 perks with Android 13. At Rs 60,000+, the X90 is a great choice for those looking for a powerful smartphone.

If you are on a tight budget and looking for a good 5G phone, the consider Poco M6 Pro at Rs 10,999, a more affordable choice than Redmi 12 5G with edgy design and software update assurance. A budget-friendly alternative to Redmi 12 5G, even Poco M6 Pro's 6 GB/128 GB version costs less. Amid options like Samsung Galaxy F14, budget 5G choice seems like a clone attack - no complaints.

The Galaxy J2 is the reason why Samsung should stop bringing out entry-level devices that are priced as the current mid-range phones on the market. With its low-end performance and specifications, the Galaxy J2 disappoints.

The Honor 7C is a good looking phone that certainly offers a good value. It has a decent display despite its low, HD+ resolution. The Snapdragon 450 chipset of this phone performs as one would expect from a budget smartphone. Multitasking might not be a strong suit but everyday task are possible. EMUI does offer enough customizations to keep you busy. The only gripe here is with the cameras which could have been better.
The Vivo Y83 can only make up for a good buy when the company decides to bring down its price under 8K.

The Redmi 6 is a step backward when compared to its predecessor, the Redmi 5. The phone is not a complete disaster as its cameras are quite good. However, its uninspiring plastic build and weak chipset running under the hood are let downs. You are likely to be better off with the Realme C1 at this price.

While it might look attractive and comes packed with a large capacity battery, the OPPO A5 has a low-res screen and 4K video recording. There are phones that offer these features and more at a lower price.

Realme 2 is a promising contender in its price bracket. It offers superior looks paired with an exceptionally long battery life. However, the camera performance is a bit lacking, and its low resolution display offers a lackluster viewing experience. This phone will not be ideal for those looking for a camera-centric budget device, but it will be a great option for those solely concerned with great battery life.

To sum it up, the Lenovo K9 cannot be tagged as an ideal pick under its price segment. The phone has a lot going against it, be it the processor, RAM capacity, or storage. Although the dual cameras look good on paper, they fail to leave a positive impression in reality.

The Nokia 5.1 Plus does a good job for a budget smartphone, but missed to get some shots. For the ones who want a phone with stock Android and zero bloatware, the Nokia 5.1 Plus makes the cut. However, for the heavy users, the battery could be a big setback.

The Galaxy A10 is Samsung's attempt to rejuvenate its entry-level smartphone lineup. However, the phone can't match offerings from other brands like Honor, Realme, and Xiaomi. Its design is uninspiring, the screen is okay, cameras are quite average, performance is poor, and battery life is below par in its price segment. Nothing about the phone is competitive enough. We would advise you to steer clear from this phone as there are better phones out there.

The Realme C1 2019 is a decent refresh over its standard variant. The added storage and RAM options are much appreciated. The phone still manages to offer a superb battery life. Despite being an HD+ resolution screen, the color reproduction is decent, and outdoor visibility is acceptable. It is hard to complain about the camera too much as other phones at this end of the market aren't any better. This a good entry level smartphone and is indeed worth your consideration.

The Nokia 4.2 is a bit overpriced in the Indian market. Offerings such as the Redmi Note 7 and Realme 3 can be had for about the same price, and they will undoubtedly get you a much better overall experience. Even the Nokia 5.1 Plus can be found for about the same price these days, making the Nokia 4.2 that much harder to recommend.

The Pixel 3A XL performs just as well in imaging as its more affordable sibling. Notable improvements here can be found with the increased battery capacity and inclusion of stereo speakers. However, at a price of Rs. 44,999, the Pixel 3A XL is tremendously overpriced for what it offers.

The Oppo A1K is a good option in its price range if you're looking for a smartphone that can do it all. It makes more sense to push your budget a bit and look at the phones in the 10-12K range. But if you're looking for a battery beast under 10k, then this phone is a worthy consideration.

On its own, the Pixel 3a is a refreshing smartphone that offers astounding photography capabilities, clean UI, robust build quality, acceptable battery life, and a headphone jack. Furthermore, the performance hit isn't too bad thanks to how well optimized the software is. Unfortunately, the INR 39,999 price tag for the Pixel 3a is just too much when options like the OnePlus7, Vivo Nex, Galaxy A80, and Zenfone 6 exist at around the same price point. Somewhere around the INR 30,000 mark is where this phone should have been positioned.

While the Honor 9X Pro has a great display, camera, performance, and battery backup, its lack of GMS makes it as good as a feature phone because you can't use Gmail, YouTube, Maps, and Play Store, which are the apps that we use the most.

While the One Macro comes with a triple camera sensor, an octa-core processor, a large screen, clean software and a large battery, it fails to make its mark due to below par cameras and low-res screen. The competition is offering far prettier designs, faster processors, and better cameras.

The Oppo A5 (2020) would be considered a good option for those looking for a budget phone which is balanced in terms of specs, plus it has a massive battery. The display is a bit disappointing and so are the camera offerings. Once could consider one of the A5's competitors instead, if you have a preference in the camera or display department.

Motorola G8 Power Lite comes with a bright screen, offers long battery life and features a decent set of triple rear cameras. But the hardware is suited for basic usage only, it runs on dated Android version and comes with microUSB port for charging. This is strictly meant for normal users, and gamers should look at others options.

Samsung Galaxy M01 is a decent budget handset packed with a good camera setup and standard hardware configuration. An upgrade in RAM configuration might have made it an interesting prospect. However, still, the phone excels as it offers an sAMOLED display, a long-lasting 4000mAh battery, and runs the latest Android 10 operating system.

Realme Narzo 10 packs excellent features for its price. The phone comes powered by the Helio G80 gaming processor, which is a welcome move at this price point. The display is on the downside as it comes with IPS LCD. That said, it is one of the best gaming smartphones available in the budget.

The Realme 6i is a budget offering from the brand and gives value for money features. However, there have been compromises when it comes to design and storage. But it gets a Helio G90T, which is great at this price range. Still, the phone is the go-to option in the affordable mid-range price bracket.

The Motorola Razr (2019) is the complete foldable phone with an elegant design. The Snapdragon 710 processor is more suited to mid-range phones. On the pricing aspect, the device is priced fairly higher when you take a look at its camera performance and questionable battery life.

We don't see a reason why Samsung has launched the Samsung Galaxy J2 Core (2020). It is just not cut out for an era where there are so many smartphones in the market that offer much better specifications than the J2 Core (2020) for the same price.

The Xiaomi Mi 10 5G offers good value for money, thanks to its excellent display, camera performance, and battery life. With that said, the fingerprint sensor isn't the fastest, and also, the phone lacks an IP rating. Overall, the phone offers you a good bang for the buck.

The Vivo V19 is a mid-range phone that flaunts an attractive design with solid display, and offers decent performance. It offers good camera performance but not the best. The price of the phone could have been slightly lower. Both Redmi K20 Pro and Realme X2 Pro offer flagship-grade performance around the same price bracket.

The Nokia 125 might be new to the market but it has the same stuff inside that we've been seeing in feature phones for many years. It is basically an old-school feature phone wrapped under a new body and comes with a new name.

Tecno Spark Power 2 packs a mammoth 6,000mAh battery with support for 18W fast charging. It also comes with a 7-inch HD+ display and runs on Android 10 OS. But with the MediaTek Helio P22 on board, the price of the phone is on the higher side. Overall, a good budget option.

Realme X3 8GB RAM variant packs a Full HD+ display with 120Hz refresh rate. The phone comes powered by Snapdragon 855+ processor which offers powerful performance. It features quad rear camera setup. However, at this price, we would have liked to see AMOLED panel on the X3.

The Oppo A12 64GB comes in handy for performing day to day tasks with ease. The phone certainly lags when it comes to the camera department as other smartphones under Rs 10,000 price segment ship with better camera specifications. Also, the device runs Android 9.0 Pie operating system, and many phones are running the latest Android 10 operating system.

Tecno Spark 5 Pro gets a large display with support for a big capacity battery and runs on the Android 10 version. However, with the Helio A25 on board, the performance will be underwhelming and the cameras will barely satisfy with their quality.

Realme 6 6GB RAM variant carries the same 6.5-inch display with 90Hz refresh rate and powered by MediaTek Helio G90T chipset. The battery offers fast charging support and the cameras on the phone do a fairly decent job. All in all, an ideal mid-range powerhouse device that meets all your needs.

I Kall K 110 is an entry-level smartphone with good features such as a good camera, enough storage, and modest battery life. The phone runs on an older version of Android (Marshmallow) as compared to other phones running on the latest Android Q operating system. However, being an affordable smartphone, it is an ideal option for basic usage.

Infinix Zero 8i is an interesting addition to the mid-range segment. For its price, you get a Full HD+ screen with 90Hz refresh rate. The Helio G90T with 8GB RAM offers solid performance, and 128GB expandable storage is ample space to keep all the important stuff on the phone. The cameras at the back and front are more than competitive for this price and the 33W fast charging support offers quick charge up of the 4,500mAh battery.

Moto E7 Plus packs a big display with waterdrop notch that carries the front camera. The dual rear cameras deliver decent quality photos and with the 5,000mAh battery you get long backup on a single charge. However, the screen resolution is limited to HD+ quality and the charging happens via microUSB port.
