The octa-core MediaTek Helio A25 processor in Tecno Spark 6 Air 3GB RAM is good for normal use but not great for gaming purposes. The phone comes with a lot of bloatware that needs to be disabled. Overall, it is a good phone under the Rs 8,000 price segment.

The Nokia 5.3 6GB RAM is a good bet if you are looking for good design and pure Android experience. Also, Nokia offers regular software and security updates to the handset. With that said, the brand could have focussed a bit on powerful internals for a complete experience.
The Xiaomi Redmi 9 128GB does pack exciting features under its hood. The phone sports full HD+ LCD screen, larger battery capacity of 5000mAh. However, the phone disappoints in terms of its hardware.
The Xiaomi Redmi 9A 3GB RAM is a decent value for money device with acceptable gaming performance. It also offers decent camera performance and outstanding battery life.

Samsung Galaxy M31 Prime packs all the impressive specs that one wishes to have at this price segment. It has an AMOLED display, 64MP quad-camera setup, and a monster size battery that offers power backup for longer durations.

The Apple iPhone 12 Pro 256GB is an expensive offering from the Cupertino giant. The device does pack impressive features such as an OLED display that offer stunning visual experience, Dolby digital speakers, and 6GB RAM for smooth multitasking. The absence of a fingerprint sensor and lack of expandable storage option are drawbacks of this handset.

The Xiaomi Mi 10T 8GB RAM has a high refresh rate display and packs a fingerprint sensor for securely unlocking the device. It packs an impressive camera setup that captures excellent images. It also packs an impressive 5000mAh battery along with 33W fast-charging support.

Micromax In 1b is a pretty good phone for its price tag in the market. This device sports a HD+ screen, with water drop notch, powered by Helio G35 processor with 4GB RAM. The storage on offer is 64GB that is further expandable and dual rear cameras are good for the price. The large capacity battery gets charging support via USB Type C port which is not very common with phones in this bracket. There's very little to complain about, except that you have brands like Redmi, Realme as alternatives.

Tecno Pova gives you a large screen experience with HD+ quality and powered by reliable octa-core Helio G80 from MediaTek. This variant comes with 6GB RAM and 128GB storage that is further expandable. The phone has triple camera sensors at the back, along with an AI lens. And with the built-in 6,000mAh battery, you will forget charging. However, the screen quality is low for its price, you only get microUSB for charging and the overall build makes it heavy.

Vivo Y30 6GB RAM is a stylish looking phone built with user-centric features. The device is pretty well built, flaunting a premium finish. The quad-camera configuration (13MP+8MP+2MP+2MP) on the rear and a single 8MP front-facing camera offers a decent performance. The device comes loaded with a large battery capacity of 5000mAh. The device's slow performance and low-resolution display are its flaws.

Infinix Hot 10 Play is yet another affordable offering from the brand that packs decent specifications. The phone features a decent display, good camera configuration with a 13MP primary camera on the rear, and an 8MP front-facing camera. The smartphone is backed by a large 6000mAh battery capacity. The phone comes powered by the MediaTek Helio G35 octa-core processor. As for the cons, the handset does not support fast charging, and it offers a low-resolution display (720 x 1600 pixels).

Redmi 9 Power gives you bang for the buck. It sports a big screen with high quality resolution, comes powered by Snapdragon 662 chipset with 4GB RAM for mid-range performance. Even the cameras offer good quality, while the built-in battery offers long backup with fast charging support. Only drawback is, the phone comes with Android 10 out of box.

Vivo Y20G 64GB is a value for money mid-range offering from the brand. The key highlights of the device include a decent 6.51-inches bezel-less display, a triple rear camera setup (13MP+2MP+2MP),  and MediaTek Helio G80 octa-core processor. Also, the phone packs an impressive 5000mAh battery with 18W fast-charging support. Low HD+ resolution display and no support for USB Type-C port are certainly its cons. Overall, the Vivo Y20G 64GB makes a good value for money device.

Oppo A15s 128GB is a decent offering from the brand, going by the specs sheet. The device's key notable features include a decent display, 4GB RAM, triple rear cameras, and an impressive 128GB internal storage. The processor is undoubtedly on the average side, and the battery capacity of 4230mAh is a bit on the downside.

Moto G30 features a host of impressive features under the hood. The mid-range handset packs an impressive quad-rear camera setup composed of a 64MP primary sensor. It is followed by an 8MP ultra-wide-angle camera, a 2MP macro camera, and a 2MP depth camera. The phone is powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 662 chipset. It draws power from the large 5000mAh battery aided by a 20W Turbo power charging. Overall, the device packs good features for its price.

Moto E7 Power 64GB is a compact performer with a decent specs sheet. Some of the notable features of the device include daylight photography and clean software with future updates. The phone comes with a Hybrid SIM slot. Hence you need to sacrifice a second SIM to accommodate the memory card. Also, it is bulky, weighing 200 grams and is difficult to operate with a single hand.

The LG W41 Plus sports almost nearly identical specs as the LG W 41. The one additional feature is higher internal storage (128GB) than the LG W41. Performance-wise, the device comes powered by the MediaTek Helio G35 octa-core processor paired with 4GB RAM. The device packs a robust quad-camera setup, decent internal storage, and standard RAM. The phone does disappoint in certain aspects, such as poor display, and the device does not support fast-charging.

LG W41 comes across as a budget device priced in the mid-range bracket. It gets a HD+ display without any high refresh rate support for its price. Add to that, you can get phones with Helio G35 for much lower these days. Android 10 should give way to the new version by now but at least we're pleased to see quad rear camera and long battery on offer. Would probably skip this for so many other options in the market.

Realme Narzo 30A is a hard-core device that promises decent performance along with a long battery backup. It gets a big screen that is ideal for watching videos on the move but having HD+ screen resolution does not cut out in the market these days. You also only have dual rear cameras and basic selfie camera. Also, Realme needs to upgrade its latest phones to Android 11 now, and that could become a sticking point for buyers very soon.

Redmi Note 10 has finally made its way to the Indian market and gets a lot of things right. Starting with the Super AMOLED display that is bright and offers rich colours. The use of Snapdragon 678 octa-core chipset makes it a reliable performer with 6GB RAM at this price. You get a dedicated slot to expand storage, quad rear cameras and a capable selfie shooter too. The 5,000mAh battery supports 33W fast charging which is impressive. The device as a whole offers good value for money spent.

mobile_name: Xiaomi Redmi Note 10 Pro Max 8GB RAM
expert_view: Xiaomi Redmi Note 10 Pro Max is a massive upgrade on its predecessor. This phone now has a Super AMOLED display with support for 120Hz refresh rate. It runs on Android 11-based MIUI version and comes powered by the reliable Snapdragon 732G chipset with 8GB RAM. The primary 108MP rear camera clicks decent photos and having a big battery with fast charging is always a plus. However, storage expansion relies on a hybrid SIM slot.

The Nokia G10 is an entry-level smartphone by Nokia which comes with a 6.5-inch HD+ display. The display panel has a 60Hz refresh rate. The handset is equipped with Helio G25 SoC, which offers mediocre performance. The smartphone even lacks fast charging support. In the Rs 12,000 price range, you can explore some other options from Xiaomi, Realme, or OPPO which offers some good specifications.

Realme 8 8GB RAM variant sports the same Super AMOLED display, powered by Helio G95 chipset for decent performance, and you have Android 11-based Realme UI as the software. The 64MP quad rear camera offers decent images and the 5,000mAh battery provides adequate backup, with support for 30W charging. But the screen misses out on high refresh rate.

Realme 8 6GB RAM variant also features Super AMOLED display, powered by Helio G95 chipset for decent performance, and you have Android 11-based Realme UI as the software. The 64MP quad rear camera offers decent images and the 5,000mAh battery provides adequate backup, with support for 30W charging. But the screen misses out on high refresh rate.

Realme C21 is the latest entry level device from the brand in the market. This budget phone features Helio G35 chipset with 4GB for decent performance. You get a 5,000mAh battery that offers long backup and for software the phone gets Android 10 out of box. Even the triple rear cameras deliver for the price. Definitely worth buying if you are on a budget, and don't mind ads on your phone.

The Xiaomi Poco M2 Reloaded is an excellent device and packs value-for-money features. Despite its bulkiness, the smartphone packs excellent features under the hood. The phone packs an impressive quad-rear camera setup (13MP+8MP+5MP+2MP) on the rear and a single 8MP camera at the front. The phone comes powered by the gaming chipset, the MediaTek Helio G80. It has a standard 4GB RAM configuration and has an internal memory of 64GB that is expandable up to 512GB using a microSD card. Fueling the device is a large 5000mAh battery with 18W fast-charging support.

The new mid-ranger from the Vivo sub-brand iQOO, offers excellent value-for-money features. Starting with an AMOLED display, the phone packs an 8GB RAM configuration, 256GB internal memory, and triple rear camera setup on the rear. With a 6600mm2 graphite layer and liquid cooling system, playing graphic-rich games is hassle-free. Rounding off, the iQOO 7 256GB is backed by a 4400mAh battery with 66W fast-charging support. As for the cons, the phone lacks a 3.5mm headphone jack.

The Vivo QOO 7 12GB RAM has all the specs that would make it a top contender in the mid-range segment. It packs a beautiful 120 Hz AMOLED display, impressive camera configuration, a triple rear camera setup (48MP+13MP+2MP), and a single 16MP selfie camera. The smartphone is an ideal choice for hardcore gamers, thanks to its 6600mm2 graphite layer and liquid cooling system. Further, the device packs a massive 12GB RAM and 256GB internal memory. The phone comes powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 870 chipset. The device does lack a 3.5mm headphone jack on the downside.

Vivo V20 2021 is a phone that will delight shutterbugs. The main rear and front 44MP snapper let you shoot in all conditions, and deliver quality in low-light as well. The design is appealing, and it weighs just 171 grams. Besides that you get 8GB RAM with 256GB onboard storage which is further expandable. Android 11-based OS is running out of the box and you get an AMOLED screen. However, the screen comes without any high refresh rate, the hardware used for the device is average at this price and the battery life is underwhelming as well.  Better to look at other options if you want a all-round package in the sub Rs 30,000 bracket.

Nokia C30 is an expensive Android Go phone that faces tough competition from regular Android smartphones in the market. The device uses basic hardware and comes with regular cameras that are no longer acceptable in the sub Rs 10,000 price bracket. Better to skip this one.

The Nokia C20 Plus flaunts a 6.5-inch HD+ display. The handset comes with Unisoc SC9863A processor which offers average performance. Additionally, the cameras on the C20 Plus take some average images. The device packs a 5,000mAh battery which offers a long-lasting battery life. If you are looking for a smartphone with big battery life and stock Android, then Nokia C20 Plus is the smartphone you can get in Rs 8,000 price range.

The iQOO Z3 comes with a 120Hz display. The phone has powerful hardware equipped in. Also, the device runs Android 11 out of the box. It has decent rear and selfie cameras. The phone also supports 44W fast charging. However, the battery on the device is of 4400mAh. If you are looking for a decent smartphone with excellent gaming performance, iQOO Z3 is the device you should buy in this price range.

The Micromax In 2C can excite the budget buyers with its premium-looking design and large display. The phone also comes with long battery life and a clean user interface, which makes it easier to operate. Moreover, the dual-SIM support and rear-mounted fingerprint sensor are an added bonus that you get with the Micromax smartphone.

The Realme Narzo 30 sports a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display. Under the hood, the phone comes equipped with an octa-core Helio G95 SoC. The device has a triple-camera setup that takes some good images. The selfie camera on the device is of 16MP. The phone packs a 5000mAh battery that has 30W charging support. However, the device comes equipped with an IPS LCD panel. You can go for Realme Narzo 30 if you are looking for decent performance, cameras, and satisfactory battery life.

Poco M3 4GB RAM variant sees upgrade in the memory department for a minor price bump. The phone features a Full HD+ screen, using the reliable Snapdragon 662 chipset, giving you expandable storage. The cameras shine bright for the price, and the 6,000mAh battery will never let you down. However, the size of the device might feel uncomfortable for some. Worth getting if you need a reliable and value for money phone in the market for the price.

Tecno Pova 2 is a powerhouse device with its 7000mAh battery with 18W fast charging support. For this price, you get 6GB RAM with 128GB storage which is quite decent. The phone features a large Full HD+ display with punch hole design that gives you more viewing area. The performance is decent with the built-in hardware and the rear cameras offer good quality photos. If you are not really bothered about brands, the Pova 2 is a decent choice for its price.

Realme Narzo 30 6GB RAM variant comes to you with the same features like the regular model. It is powered by MediaTek Helio G95 chipset, 128GB storage is available, which is further expandable, the cameras at the back are decent, and you get long battery life with support for 30W fast charging. Worth going if you need a reliable 4G phone for under Rs 15,000.

Samsung Galaxy A12 is a basic mid-range phone that has features you might like and some you won't. The 6.51-inch display gets a notch and supports only HD+ screen quality, without AMOLED panel or high refresh rate. The hardware performance is reliable but only with 4GB RAM and 64GB storage might feel limited for many. The cameras are decent, and the battery life should keep you happy. Buy it if you don't need a high-powered screen and device.

The Samsung Galaxy A12 comes with a 6.5-inch PLS IPS LCD display that has HD+ resolution. The phone is powered by Samsung's in-house Exynos 850 chipset which offers good performance compared to the earlier A12 model which is equipped with Helio P35 SoC. The new Galaxy A12 model packs 8GB of RAM. It features a 48MP camera setup. However, the device lacks an AMOLED panel and it offers just 18W fast charging support. You can go for Galaxy A12 if you are looking for a smartphone with a big 5000mAh battery and 8GB of RAM in the Rs 16,499 price range.

Samsung Galaxy M32 5G is future-ready thanks to MediaTek Dimensity 720 chipset that delivers performance as well. Its quad rear cameras click good looking photos, and the battery life should easily get you through the day. But that's it, everything else does not make sense for the price. It sports a 6.5-inch TFT HD+ display, without any support for high refresh rate and has a notch design. The storage is not expandable without compromising the second SIM slot, and the battery only gets 15W charging speed. Not worth the money you are paying, even for a 5G phone.

Well, i must admit the Tecno Spark 8T is a definite surprise addition to the sub Rs 10,000 bracket. It has a full HD+ display, built over a stylish body that offers 4GB RAM. The performance is not up to the mark, but still you can easily get a day's work done. The battery is good, and the main camera delivers decent photos. Worth considering in this range.

Realme C11 2021 is a phone that offers basic performance with Unisoc 9863A chipset. Using Android Go means you can use lightweight apps easily. The cameras are average, but thankfully you get long backup. Worth skipping and look at other budget options at this price.

The Realme 8s 5G is powered by Dimensity 810 SoC. The device packs 8GB of RAM and 128B of onboard storage. It features a 64MP primary main camera, which takes some good images. Speaking about the cons, the device has a IPS panel, and lacks stereo speakers. In the similar price range, if you are looking for a AMOLED panel and good camera performance, you can go for the Redmi Note 10 Pro Max.

The Vivo Y21A is a mid-range smartphone by Vivo. It boasts a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display with a HD+ resolution. An octa-core Snapdragon 662 processor powers the device which offers good performance. However, the handset still runs Android 11 OS out of the box and it also lacks 5G support. In the Rs 14,000 price range, you can explore other options such as Realme Narzo 30 or Redmi Note 11, considering that they offer some good specifications.

Realme Narzo 50A is a phone that offers mixed results. It sports a 6.5-inch display but only supports HD+ screen resolution without any high refresh rate. The hardware delivers basic performance but not good enough for heavy tasks like gaming. You get 128GB storage, which is further expandable but 4GB RAM might feel limiting. The 50MP primary camera shoots decent photos, but the other sensors are average. The 6,000mAh battery offers long backup with 18W charging speed which takes a long time to charge. Buy the Narzo 50A if you need a phone for basic daily use.

The OPPO A55 flaunts a 6.51-inch IPS LCD display with has HD+ resolution. The device is powered by Helio G35 SoC which offers mediocre performance. The phone features a 50MP triple-camera setup which takes some good images. However, the storage of the handset is expandable up to 256GB. The device packs a 5000mAh battery that 18W fast charging support. If you are looking to purchase a smartphone in a Rs 15,000 price range, the Poco M3 Pro 5G or even the Redmi Note 10T can be a better choice compared to the OPPO A55.

Realme GT Neo 2 5G features a 6.62-inch AMOLED 120Hz display. The device is powered by an octa-core Snapdragon 870 SoC which offers impressive performance. The device packs 256GB of internal storage. The smartphone has 65W charging support. However, the storage on the device is not expandable. Also, the phone lacks a 3.5mm audio jack. If you are looking for the best performance handset along with faster charging, and 120Hz AMOLED display, the Realme GT Neo 2 5G is the ideal offering.

Vivo Y3s is an Android 11 Go phone that is unlikely to find takers for this price tag. It offers 2GB RAM with MediaTek Helio P35 chipset, and even the main rear camera is decent, and battery life will keep you going the whole day. But for Rs 10,000 there are way better options.

The Nokia C30 flaunts a larger 6.8-inch IPS LCD display. The display panel has a HD+ resolution and a 400 bits of brightness. The camera and hardware performance is not that great. The device also lacks fast charging support. You can go for the C30 if you are looking to buy a smartphone with a stock Android UI and a long-lasting battery. However, do note that you will have to compromise on the performance of hardware and cameras.

Samsung Galaxy A32 4G is a hard-core mid-range phone and its 8GB RAM variant offers a mixed bag of features. You get it with 90Hz Super AMOLED display with Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection. It comes with 128GB storage which is expandable. The quad rear cameras offer quality and the 5000mAh battery provides long backup. However, the notch design is not appealing at this price, and so is 15W fast charging support.

Moto G31 is another phone in the mid-range bracket that has some good and some bad parts. It sports an AMOLED display but misses on high refresh rate. The hardware includes 6GB RAM with 128GB storage which is expandable at the cost of second SIM. The cameras do a good job in normal conditions, but lack in low light. The long battery life helps but no fast charging at this price is a big miss.

The Redmi 10 Prime 2022 is a value-for-money smartphone that ticks all the checkboxes in this price segment. The handset comes with a decent performance and offers a large display. Moreover, the phone packs a decent battery life and comes with 18W fast charging support. So, if you are considering buying a new smartphone under this price segment, make sure to compare the Redmi 10 Prime 2022 with your choice first.

The Infinix Hot 12 is probably one of the best options from the brand. The budget-centric smartphone offers a decent design and packs some standard specifications and features. The phone features a large display and comes with a reliable MediaTek processor. The rear camera seems to do a good job in broad daylight, while the front camera could have been slightly better. Overall, it is a good option to consider in this price segment.

Infinix Hot 11S is another budget phone in the market that looks to grab buyer's attention. It has a few strong features like Full HD+ display, powered by Helio G88 chipset and offers 128GB storage which is further expandable. The battery life should keep you happy as well, and you get 18W fast charging support. However, the cameras are basic, the design is slightly bulky and you get Android 11 only.

The Tecno Spark 8C is a budget-oriented smartphone from Tecno. It has a 6.6-inch IPS LCD display that supports a 90Hz refresh rate. The device is equipped with Unisoc T606 SoC which offers average performance.  The handset runs Android 11 Go Edition out of the box and packs a 5,000mAh battery. The device shall easily last throughout the day. If your priority is a 90Hz display and long-lasting battery life, you should go for the Tecno Spark 8C. However, you will have to compromise on performance and camera quality.

Poco M4 Pro 5G is another mid-range 5G phone using the new Dimensity chipset. It misses out on AMOLED panel but gets 6GB RAM and this variant offers 128GB storage but only expandable if you skip using the second SIM. The cameras are good, and the battery life is good as well. This is one good looking device.

You can enjoy a seamless performance on the Lava X2 with the MediaTek Helio G35 processor. The smartphone has a massive 5000mAh battery that ensures long-lasting usage. Lava X2 is an ideal option if you are searching for an all-inclusive bundle at a reasonable price.

iQOO Z6 5G 6GB RAM model offers good value for the money. You get with a 120Hz display that lacks an AMOLED panel, powered by Snapdragon 695 chipset, 128GB storage is expandable, the primary camera at the back does offer quality. And the battery life is decent. But the notch design makes it look dated, and 18W fast charging is not good for the price these days. Still a reliable choice for regular users.

The POCO X4 Pro 5G 8GB option can be considered one of the best offerings under the Rs 25,000 price segment. The smartphone comes is loaded with all the ingredients that make a great smartphone, including an AMOLED display, the latest Snapdragon chipset, ultra-fast charging support, and more. This coupled with some advanced triple rear cameras adds a cherry on top.

You can enjoy a seamless performance on your phone as it is equipped with Samsung Exynos 8 Octa 850, which offers a clock speed of 2GHz. The phone comes with 4 GB and 64 GB inbuilt storage so that you can store your local files, songs, videos, and more without worrying about space constraints.

The Realme 9 8GB RAM model can be considered an option for those who are looking for a 4G smartphone. The major highlight of the device is the 108MP rear camera that delivers some stunning results in daylight, while the 6.4-inch AMOLED display offers an enhanced viewing experience. That said, the company has also cut some corners for this device. The device lacks a stereo speaker setup, which could have been a cherry on top.

The iQOO Z6 4G offers a plethora of features that make it an interesting option to consider. The phone comes with a 44W fast charging support and offers an in-display fingerprint sensor, which is quite rare in this price segment. The phone also comes with a decent camera setup that gives good results in different conditions. So, if you are considering a smartphone under Rs 15,000 price segment and want to have some segment-leading features, then you can consider iQOO Z6 4G.

The iQOO Z6 Pro 8GB RAM model offers some interesting features. The phone is loaded with a 90Hz AMOLED display that offers good viewing angles and colours. The performance of the device is satisfactory and you will not face many issues, all thanks to the Snapdragon 778G processor. On the downside, the phone lacks expandable storage and there is no option for stereo speakers. Overall, if you are looking for a sleek smartphone that provides some stable performance and ultra-fast charging support, then you can consider iQOO Z6 Pro 8GB RAM model.

The POCO M4 5G is the company's latest attempt to get more market share in this price segment. The latest smartphone comes loaded with an unique design language and offers higher refresh rate display. The POCO M4 5G packs decent processor and is currently one of the cheapest 5G smartphones you can get in the market. However, the phone only features a dual-camera setup, which may bother some.

The OnePlus 10R 150W edition is one of the best OnePlus smartphones you can get under the Rs 40,000 price segment. The smartphone comes with ultra-fast charging technology, which is a leading feature in this segment. The phone also features gaming-centric features that make it a desirable phone to those who want to experience a flagship-grade gaming experience. The phone's cameras are also capable of performing well under different conditions. Overall, if you are looking for a smartphone that offers ultra-fast charging technology and comes with flagship-grade specifications, then the OnePlus 10R 150W is the right option for you.

The Realme Narzo 50 6GB RAM model comes with a host of special features, which makes it an interesting smartphone in this segment. The device is loaded with a premium design language and the 33W fast charging is a good addition. The phone also delivers reliable performance and you can thank the MediaTek Dimensity 810 processor for it. Overall, it is a good device to consider in this price range, albeit the competition is fierce.

The Infinix Note 12 128GB sure seems to be a good option, which comes with a host of interesting features. The handset packs a 6.7-inch AMOLED display, which is a rare feature in this price segment. Moreover, you get a decent chipset and virtual RAM support, which will further enhance the performance of the device. This coupled with 33W fast charging support and a 5,000mAh battery ensures a longer battery life.

The Lava Z3 Pro seems to be a decent option in this price range. The smartphone comes with an interesting design language and features a tall display. The Lava Z3 Pro also features a 5,000mAh battery, which can easily last one full day of charge. Moreover, the expandable storage option, 3.5mm audio jack, and decent processor, makes it a comparable option under the Rs 9,000 price segment.

The I Kall Z1 Premium is a low-cost smartphone with fairly typical specs. The device has 4GB of RAM, which is a plus. Furthermore, the phone has a wide display, making it suitable for daily use. However, the phone runs an outdated Android version and has an unknown chipset, making it difficult to predict how well it will work.

The Redmi K50i 256GB model is an easy recommendation for this price segment. The company has managed to bring the flagship-grade MediaTek Dimensity 8100 processor into this price segment, which is a rare thing. Moreover, the phone offers a premium design language and packs some interesting features like a liquid cooling system, RAM expansion technology, and more, which makes it one of the best options to consider in this price segment.

The Itel A23s is an entry-level smartphone that offers pretty basic specifications and features. The handset packs a good design language and comes with an expandable storage option, which is a good thing. The day-to-day performance should be decent, if not bad. Apart from this, the phone is only meant for first-time smartphone users.

The Redmi 10A Sport packs some interesting features and specifications, which makes it a good alternative in this price segment. The phone offers a large display and 128GB of internal storage, which is rare in this price range. Moreover, the device delivers some decent performance when it comes to day-to-day usage or light gaming. It also features some decent battery life, which can easily last for one full day with light to moderate usage.

The Infinix Note 12 Pro is a decent option to consider in this price range. The smartphone features a decent design language and offers some nifty features like virtual RAM support. The phone also comes with a large display that delivers up to 480nits of brightness. The performance would be standard, though there is some room for improvement when it comes to cameras and user interface.

The Infinix Note 12 Pro is a decent option to consider in this price range. The smartphone features a decent design language and offers some nifty features like virtual RAM support. The phone also comes with a large display that delivers up to 480nits of brightness. The performance would be standard, though there is some room for improvement when it comes to cameras and user interface. The phone also comes with a virtual RAM feature that will further help to enhance the performance.

The I Kall K470 New is a budget-friendly smartphone with some basic features. The gadget features 4GB of RAM, which is an advantage. Furthermore, the phone features a large display, making it perfect for daily usage. However, because the phone runs an ancient version of Android and has an unknown chipset, it is difficult to anticipate how well it will perform. As a result, before purchasing this smartphone, you should look into the competitors.

One of the top choices in this price range is the OnePlus 10T 16GB RAM variant. The device has a premium design language that makes it stand out. It also has an excellent display, making it one of the best models in this price range. To top it all off, the phone is equipped with the newest Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Plus Gen 1 chipset, which is quite rare right now. You also get flagship-level cameras and compatibility for ultra-fast charging. So, if you're searching for a smartphone in the Rs 60,000 pricing range, the OnePlus 10T is your best bet.

At this pricing range, the newest Redmi 11 Prime 128GB variant has some attractive design and specs. The device features the newest MediaTek Helio G99 chipset and a premium design language. The phone also has a 90Hz display with some decent viewing angles. Furthermore, the device has a long battery life and decent day-to-day performance. So, if you're seeking a smartphone for around Rs 15,000, you should absolutely consider this handset.

The iPhone 14 Pro Max sports a beautiful surgical-grade stainless steel and textured matte glass design in four stunning colors. The iPhone 14 Pro Max features the Always-On display, a 48MP camera, Crash Detection, Emergency SOS via satellite, and an innovative new way to receive notifications with the Dynamic Island. So, if you're in the market for a new iPhone and want the best experience and a larger display size, then the iPhone 14 Pro Max is the way to go.

The Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max is expected to be one of the most popular models in the iPhone 14 series. The phone achieves an excellent balance of style and performance. The device offers an easy-to-read 6.1-inch display. In addition, the gadget sports a powerful Apple A16 Bionic CPU and great photography skills thanks to its 48MP triple-camera system. If you're looking for a new iPhone and want the greatest experience possible, the iPhone 14 Pro Max is the right option for you.

From a redesigned notch area called '     Dynamic Island', always-on display to a new 48-megapixel wide-angle camera, the iPhone 14 Pro feels like the best smartphone in the market. If you're looking for a new iPhone and want the best experience, then the iPhone 14 Pro is the way to go.

The Infinix Hot 20 Play is a very capable device. Unfortunately, it is tied down by the need for more optimisation. The massive display is good for watching movies, while the humongous battery can easily last for well over a day. It is a contender under Rs 10,000, but the competition has fewer bottlenecks when it comes to performance.

The Elephone U3H is a mid-range device by Elephone. The handset sports a 6.53-inch AMOLED display which offers Full HD+ resolution. The device is equipped with a MediaTek Helio P70 chipset which offers average performance. The smartphone ships with only 3,500mAh battery which also lacks fast charging support. If you are looking to buy a new smartphone in the Rs 13,998 price range, the competition is offering much better specifications and features at a similar price point.

The Samsung Galaxy A04e 128GB is the company's latest smartphone in the budget category aimed at consumers. The phone has a lovely design and a good performance. It has a MediaTek Helio P35 CPU that is adequate for regular use. Furthermore, even though the manufacturer only provides standard charging support, the battery backup is acceptable. Having said that, the phone is a good bargain at this price point.

The Samsung Galaxy A04 128GB is the company's latest cheap smartphone aimed towards consumers. The phone has a beautiful look and excellent performance. It contains a MediaTek Helio P35 CPU, which is sufficient for everyday use. Furthermore, despite the fact that the manufacturer only offers basic charging support, the battery backup is adequate. Having said that, at this price, the phone is a good buy.

Another fashionable smartphone from Realme is the 10 Pro 5G Coca-Cola Edition. The phone has a great design language and many great features. First of all, the smartphone includes a huge display and a 5G Qualcomm Snapdragon 695 CPU that offers dependable performance in all areas, including gaming and regular usage. Additionally, the gadget has a large storage capacity and offers reliable, quick charging support. If you're looking for a smartphone with a positive user experience, the Realme 10 Pro 5G Coca-Cola Edition with 8GB RAM is unquestionably an excellent choice.

Realme C55 is an excellent budget smartphone with decent features and performance. It offers a great design and build quality. While lacking 5G support, the mini capsule feature, camera specs, and micro SD card slot make it a fantastic option for those on a budget.

The Redmi Note 12 4G boasts an AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate. The device is powered by Snapdragon 685 processor which can handle all the tasks with ease. The phone runs Android 13 out of the box, and it also has microSD card support. If you are looking for a smartphone with good display, latest Android version, and fast charging support, then you can go for Redmi Note 12 4G. However, you will need to compromise on 5G support, as the device offers 4G support. In the same price range, if you are looking for a 5G handset, you can explore other devices such as Galaxy F23 5G, iQOO Z6 Lite 5G, Redmi 11 Prime 5G, Poco M4 Pro 5G.

If you are looking for a smartphone with good performance, excellent battery life, and microSD card support, then the Redmi 12C is a good option. However, do note that the handset runs Android 12 OS, lacks 5G, and has a standard 60Hz refresh rate display. In conclusion, the Xiaomi Redmi 12C is the perfect smartphone for those who need long battery life and hardware which can run all the basic tasks with ease.

The realme Narzo N55 packs some impressive features such as a 64MP camera,5000mAh battery that offers solid battery life with fast charging capabilities. The camera takes great photos. However, the absence of 5G support and ultra-wide lens is a letdown, and the phone comes with bloatware. If you need a 5G phone with an ultra-wide lens, you may want to consider alternatives like the Vivo T2x or Samsung Galaxy F14.

The Nokia C32 impresses with its sturdy design, vibrant display, and powerful camera capabilities. The octa-core processor and ample RAM deliver smooth performance. However, the absence of fast charging may be a drawback for some users. Overall, it is a reliable smartphone offering a range of features at an affordable price.

The Redmi 12C 4GB RAM Mobile offers powerful performance, a sleek design, and impressive camera capabilities. With its long-lasting 5000mAh battery, 128GB storage, and seamless connectivity options, it provides a complete smartphone experience at a budget price

The Vivo Y56 is a mid-range smartphone which comes with a 6.58-inch display. The device is powered by an octa-core Dimensity 700 SoC which offers good performance. The device also has a microSD card slot and 5G connectivity support. However, the smartphone has a standard 60Hz refresh rate, average cameras, and only 18W fast charging support. In a similar price range, if you are looking for more alternatives then you can consider Realme Narzo 60 5G, OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite 5G, or the Galaxy M34.

Xiaomi's Redmi 12 series stands out with premium glass-protected back cover, sturdy mid-frame, and IP53 water-splash resistance. It's an excellent budget phone choice for regular users, providing long battery life, smooth performance for day-to-day activities, and decent camera hardware. Gaming performance may not be outstanding, but overall, it offers great value for the money.

The Lava Blaze 5G succeeds as a budget 5G smartphone with strengths in design and performance, despite weaker camera performance. Battery life is excellent. With eight 5G bands, it targets those seeking an affordable 5G experience. The display exceeds expectations for its price range, catering to budget-conscious users interested in trying 5G without overspending.

Surprisingly exceeding expectations, the Redmi Note 12 Pro is a successful upgrade from the Note 11 Pro. The 50MP main camera, supported by a stabilized Sony sensor, offers value in a sub 30k midrange smartphone, now capable of UHD video recording. Beyond the camera, it excels in Wi-Fi 6 speed, AMOLED display with 120Hz refresh rate, long battery life, efficient SoC, and fast charging. Notably, a 67W charger is included.

mobile_name: Tecno Spark 10 Pro  Moon Explorer Edition

expert_view: The iPhone 15 Pro Max brings significant improvements: a sleek titanium design, a versatile Action button, USB-C port for the future, a powerful A17 Pro chip, and 5x optical zoom. Although the phone carries a hefty price tag, it is worth considering the latest technology it equips.

The iPhone 15 Pro is overshadowed by its sibling, the 15 Pro Max, mainly due to a lack of an upgraded zoom lens. However, it features the potent A17 Pro chip and offers a sleek titanium design, USB-C support, flagship-level performance, and the useful Action button. If you prefer a compact phone with premium features, the iPhone 15 Pro is a compelling upgrade from the iPhone 14 Pro.

The iPhone 15 may seem overshadowed with last year's CPU and the old silent/ring switch, but the A16 Bionic remains impressively fast. It features a USB-C port and the dynamic island. With a 48MP camera and new camera tricks, it offers a more affordable entry into the Apple iPhone ecosystem.
The Lenovo K8 Note is a decent buy at its price. The phone is equipped with hardware that can handle moderate tasks. However. for heavy users, the K8 Note may disappoint.

The Lenovo K8 Plus is a surprisingly well made entry-level smartphone. It offers impressive performance and battery especially considering how affordable it is. It is hard to complain about the camera performance as most of its competitors fare much worse. The phone offers quite a value for potential buyers,
One of the go-to choices in the entry-level segment.
Except for the AMOLED screen, there's nothing that the Galaxy On6 offers over entry-level 2018 smartphones.

mobile_name: Asus Zenfone Max Pro M1 6GB RAM

expert_view: The Realme C1 is one of the best entry-level smartphones one can buy in India. It offers one of the best battery lives we have seen thus far from a phone of this caliber. While the phones large HD+ display makes the image pixelated, the color accuracy is decent, and it does get bright enough for outdoor use. We do wish the performance and camera could have been better, but it is hard to complain considering how affordable this device is.

The Nokia 7.1 is a phone that can't survive because of the alternatives available in the market which offer far better specs, even basic ones like battery life and better displays. The battery capacity is a major drawback that is sure to push buyers towards better alternatives.
Under its price range, the Asus Zenfone Max M1 makes up for a good buy.

It is hard to suggest the Vivo Y93 when much better offerings from Xiaomi and Realme are offered at about the same price. The Y93 also lacks in the display resolution aspect, and its cameras are pretty average considering the phone's asking price.

The Nokia 8.1 is a good all-rounder package but what makes it difficult to choose over the aggressive competition is the small capacity battery. Luckily it does support 18W fast charging so this might be something a buyer could overlook. All-in-all, the phone is still a good device in the sub-15k bracket.

The Realme 3 is one of the most consistent packages you can find at this end of the market. there are some shortcomings like the HD+ screen and poor low-light performance, but these aspects can be overlooked considering its asking price. Once its price goes up, however, you are likely to be better off spending your cash on a Redmi Note 7.

The Zenfone Max M2 makes a strong case for itself thanks to its aggressive price tag. With that said, its 4GB RAM variant's price is not too far off from the Redmi Note 6's. The additional investment is completely worth it as the latter comes with a better screen and a more powerful processor.

The Redmi Go offers great value for what it is. This is an Android Go edition smartphone with a simple and intuitive UI. Those looking for an entry-level smartphone to perhaps upgrade from a feature phone will find the Redmi Go to be a good starting point.

The Samsung Galaxy A2 Core is a classic example of what phones were available in the budget range before the Chinese wave of smartphone makers like Xiaomi, Oppo, and Vivo entered India. Today it would make no sense to purchase this phone because you get far better features and specs in the budget range.

Huawei P30 Lite is a mid-range phone that offers solid hardware performance, thanks to 6GB RAM paired with Kirin 710A chipset. Ample storage space available on board, and the triple rear cameras give you a lot of quality. The battery supports fast charging as well. However, like most Huawei phones, Android apps will not work and to expand storage you have to sacrifice one of the SIM slots.

The Galaxy A10s is an entry-level phone that just can't survive the pricing segment it is in. It makes a lot more sense to look at options like the Galaxy M30 or the Redmi Note 8 as these devices are significantly better than the A10s be it display technology and specs, or superior cameras, or even performance.

The Nokia 7.2 is a great phone but seems a bit overpriced, but this is mainly because of the price wars by competitors like Xiaomi and Realme. The 3500mAh battery is great for people who use their phones extensively but the lack of a bundled quick charger is annoying. The phone's design puts it in a class of its own and the display is stunning.

The HTC Wildfire X was a modest attempt at being a budget phone, but it simply can't survive in the aggressive segment. The phone does not match up to its peers in any way  -  be it specs or features. Better to consider a phone like the Galaxy M30 from Samsung or the Realme 5 Pro.

The Lenovo A6 Note is a very average phone for its price. It has a large display, a dual-camera on the rear, and its battery lasts an entire day on a single charge. Apart from that, there's nothing going great about it. Its processor is unremarkable. It still uses a microUSB port and its front-facing camera has below average resolution as per 2019 standards in its price segment.

The Lenovo K10 Note was the company's chance to show the world that it still cares about making good mid-range phones. At Rs 13,999, the K10 Note offers every bit of goodness its fiercest competitors offer on their similarly priced phones. It has a large and sharp display, a powerful processor, stock Android like UI, a triple rear-facing camera, Dolby Atmos sound, a 4000mAh battery with fast charging, and a USB Type-C port. Its cameras might not be as impressive as Realme's or Xiaomi's cameras, but they are not bad either. Now it just has to deliver on frequent and fast software updates to show consumers that it still cares about phones and that they can count on the company.

It's difficult to defend the Motorola E6s when players like Xiaomi and Realme have changed the game. Motorola will have to pack a lot of specs and features into its phones to make them competitive in the Indian smartphone market. The phone is an okayish product that you should only look at if you like the Motorola brand name.

The Realme 5s 128GB is a good option when you consider its pricing. The phone comes with a large display, splash resistant design, Quad-rear camera setup, and a large battery. The cameras perform well in daylight but struggle when it comes to low-light performance. Overall, the phone turns out to be a decent alternative to the Vivo U20 and the Redmi Note 8.

The Samsung Galaxy M01s is an excellent budget device from the South Korean giant. The phone offers a decent display, impressive camera performance, and has a great RAM. The Dolby Atmos and 4000mAh battery is a wonderful combination as music enthusiasts can continue listening to music for longer durations.

The Realme Narzo 10A comes with a good quality display. Thanks to the MediaTek G70 processor, the phone is one of the best performers in the price segment. The sturdy hardware configuration accounts for the smooth performance of the smartphone. The phone is a good bet to own at this price range.

The iQOO 3 5G is one of the cheaper 5G smartphones available in the market currently. The device comes with Snapdragon 865 processor that offers flagship-grade performance to the gaming enthusiasts. What users have to worry is in the camera and battery department, but at the selling price, the iQOO 3 5G is a worth enough device to buy in 2021.

Infinix Note 7 packs a large screen and comes powered by octa-core Helio G70 processor with 6GB RAM for decent performance. It features triple rear cameras that are decent for the price and the selfie camera does a good job too. But for this price, it only features a HD resolution screen. You can consider other options in this price bracket.

The USP (universal selling point) of the Nokia 5.3 is its Stock Android experience and promise of regular software updates. Although the device has built-in four cameras on the rear, it turns out to be an average performer. However, there are better options available in the market.

The Infinix Hot 9 Pro packs many good features such as an HD+ display, 48MP Quad rear cameras, and a large 5000mAh battery. On the downside, the handset features an entry-level MediaTek Helio P22 chipset to power the unit. There are other good options at this price range, such as Redmi Note 8 and Realme Narzo 10A.
If you want a smartphone that looks much more premium than its price suggests, the Tecno Spark 5 is the way to go. But if you want anything else, you have to look at other options.

The Samsung Galaxy M11 packs a large display without the notch and loaded with large capacity battery. Having said that, for over Rs 10,000 the phone comes powered by a dated Snapdragon processor which will offer basic computing power and a HD+ display. There are other options in the market from Xiaomi and Realme that offer better features for the price.

Realme Narzo 10A sports a big screen with HD+ resolution, packs a large capacity battery with 10W fast charging support. It offers decent performance with MediaTek Helio G70 processor and you get ample amount of space for apps and photos with the 64GB of onboard storage.

Lava Z61 Pro budget phone features an 18:9 display, powered by octa-core processor for basic performance. The phone gets single rear and front camera and comes loaded with a 3,100mAh battery for decent backup. However, the phone runs on old Android version and only offers 16GB internal storage. We would recommend you to spend a little extra and get something better.

Xiaomi Redmi Note 9 6GB RAM offers decent gaming performance on the Full-HD+ display which gets Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection. It also packs a large capacity battery with reverse charging support and features a decent quad rear camera setup for the price. However, the MIUI version is filled with bloatware.

Oppo F15 features a decent AMOLED display with Corning Gorilla Glass 5 for protection. It gets a solid battery life with 20W fast charging support and features a dependable set of quad rear cameras. However, the Helio P70 from MediaTek is an old processor in the market and it runs on the old Android version as well. You have better options to look at in the market right now.

Asus ROG Phone 3 features a vibrant display with 144Hz refresh rate and Corning Gorilla Glass 6 for protection. It comes packed with the latest chipset in the market for impressive gaming performance. The main triple rear cameras click decent images in all conditions and the battery life is solid for all this power in tow. However, ROG Phone 3 comes without headphone jack and no support for wireless charging or IP rating. A definite buying choice for hard-core mobile gamers.

Infinix Smart 5 is a decent budget phone, running on Android 10 Go platform to support small size apps. It gets a large screen with support for HD+ screen quality. Even the hardware under the hood is impressive for the price but having a single rear camera makes no sense anymore, no matter what the price bracket. Having said that, the phone will offer long backup with its large capacity battery.

Samsung Galaxy M31s features a bright and vibrant display with Corning Gorilla Glass 3. It runs on the Android 10-based One UI and gets quad rear cameras that deliver in daylight conditions. The phone packs a 6,000mAh battery with 25W fast charging that will easily last for more than a day. But the phone's hardware fails to live up to the billing of its package, especially at the sub-20K price bracket, where the competition is fierce.

Nokia C3 2020 is a budget phone running on the Android 10 version and features a large HD+ display. The battery is removable but performance is average, while the main camera does an okay job with clicking photos. The hardware under the hood is also quite underwhelming. Worth buying only if you want the latest Android version and trust the Nokia brand name.

Xiaomi Redmi 9 Prime offers Full HD+ resolution for under Rs 10,000 with Corning Gorilla Glass 3 protection. It runs on MIUI version built over Android 10 version out of box and packs a competent set of hardware for decent performance. The phone also gets quad rear cameras and loaded with a 5,000mAh+ battery for more than day's backup on a single charge. Worthy budget option in the market.

I Kall K1000 is certainly a mixed bag as it shines in certain aspects like huge internal memory and 4G VoLTE support. On the other hand, the handset ships only with a single rear camera, whereas dual-camera smartphones are available at this price point. Further, the below-average processor and older Android version (Marshmallow) does add to its woes.

Oppo A52 8GB packs a large Full-HD+ display and looks appealing with its fit and finish. The software out of box is the latest ColorOS version built over Android 10 and will get future updates as well. The 5,000mAh battery offer decent backup with 18W fast charging support. That said, the phone's performance is underwhelming and the cameras are average for the price and compared to what the competition offers.

Infinix Hot 10 offers a decent range of features for its price. You get a large display, with a capable MediaTek chipset that is paired with 6GB RAM. Add to that, you have 128GB storage that is further expandable. It has three cameras at the back, the screen has a punch hole that houses the front camera. And the 5,200mAh battery will suffice for long usage. However, the screen gets HD+ resolution and it uses microUSB for charging.

Realme has managed to resolve two major issues that consumers face with budget smartphones -- performance and battery backup  -  with the C15. The phone comes with a fast, Helio G35 processor and a 6000mAh battery. The brand has also managed to pack an ultrawide camera in the phone, put it ahead of all its competitors in terms of imaging. The only bummer is that the phone misses out on a USB Type-C port. But if that is okay with you, the Realme C15 is one of the best smartphones you can buy in the price range.
If you need a smartphone around INR 5,000 that has a large display and a long-lasting battery, the Gionee Max is the way to go. But for anything else, you have to go for other smartphones.

The Oppo A53 2020 128GB fares well when it comes to design, battery, and audio-video experience. On the downside, the entry-level Snapdragon 460 processor lags when it comes to gaming performance. Oppo A53 2020 128GB is the ideal option for those looking for a big battery handset within the budget.

Tecno Camon 16 comes with a stunning design with a tall display. The phone boasts of excellent cameras and also has a Penta LED flash for better night shots. On the downside, the display does not have any protection and there is also no fast charger that is offered along with the phone. But given the price segment and its best line specifications, it is a worthy pick.

Tecno Camon 16 Premier comes with many exciting features under its hood. The phone sports a superb 64MP quad-camera setup, 48MP+8MP Dual selfie camera, and a good battery capacity of 4500mAh. Overall, the phone is a worthy option and gives tough competition to other brands in the same price segment.

mobile_name: Xiaomi Redmi Note 9 Pro Max 8GB RAM
expert_view: The Xiaomi Redmi Note 9 Pro Max 8GB RAM is quite powerful with good camera configuration, better battery life than the Xiaomi Redmi Note 9 Pro. The phone packs a powerful Snapdragon 720G processor, and a 5000mAh battery with a 33W fast charger is certainly a good addition. Redmi 9 Pro Max's hardware is nearly similar to that of its predecessor. Go for it only if you are willing to spend more else, you can settle for Redmi Note 9 Pro.

The Xiaomi Redmi 9i 128GB boasts of specs that are more or less similar to Redmi 9. It is an entry-level smartphone but does pack amazing specifications under its hood. Design-wide, it has a splash-proof resistant body and has a tall 6.53-inches display. Even Though the phone lacks a fingerprint scanner, it does support the Face Unlock feature. Although it has flaws in terms of display resolution and bloatware, the phone is a decent option at this price range.

OnePlus Nord gets AMOLED display with 90Hz refresh rate, packs a 5G processor with 6GB RAM and has quad cameras at the back that do a decent job. The built-in battery supports 30W charging speed but the storage is not expandable further and the battery life is average at best.

Realme Narzo 20A is an affordable phone, which is why it sports a big screen but with HD+ screen resolution. The Snapdragon 665 offers decent performance, with 4GB RAM in tow. The triple rear cameras shoot good photos and the selfie camera is quite acceptable as well. The large size battery offers long backup. However, the charging happens via microUSB port.

Realme Narzo 20 comes powered by Helio G85 processor from MediaTek that is good for multi-tasking, and with 128GB storage, you will never run out of space to download apps. The triple rear shooters dynamic and offer decent quality photos. The 6,000mAh battery gets 18W fast charging which is a bonus. However, for this price we expect more than HD+ screen resolution these days, and also microUSB port does not cut out any more.

Tecno Spark Air 64GB gives you ample storage, that is further expandable and features triple cameras at the back. The phone comes with a big screen but the resolution quality is not at par with the size. The hardware is meant for basic usage but the large capacity battery will easily last you for day or two.

Lenovo A7 64GB is an entry-level offering from the brand. It packs a good enough display, decent camera setup and a large 4000mAh battery. On the flip side, the display does not feature a Corning Gorilla Glass protection. The phone does not have fast-charging support.

Xiaomi Poco C3 is a budget phone with support for HD+ screen resolution. It packs a decent hardware under the hood, with 4GB RAM and 64GB storage on offer. The cameras capture well in bright conditions and the built-in battery offers adequate backup. But, the front only has a 5MP shooter and you have a microUSB port for charging and data transfer.

Asus ROG Phone 3 is a powerful phone made for hard-core gamers. They even have accessories to aid them. This phone, comes with 12GB RAM, powered by latest Snapdragon 800 series chipset. It has triple cameras at the back, packs a mammoth 6,000mAh battery that lets you charge other phones as well. However, the storage is not expandable, it's heavy, has bezels on the front screen and has no headphone jack.

Apple iPhone 12 Mini 256GB gets the OLED XDR display with a pixel density of 477ppi. It comes with an IP68 rating that offers water resistance at a depth of 6-metres for up to 30 minutes. It also packs Dolby Atmos Plus speakers for the superior audio experience. The drawbacks of the phone include the absence of a fingerprint sensor and no expandable storage support.

Apple iPhone 12 Pro sports an OLED screen, powered by A14 Bionic chipset with 6GB RAM and 512GB storage. The new cameras at the back and front are excellent, in both day and night conditions. It comes with iOS 14 out of box, and supports wireless charging. However, for a high-end phone, it does not support high refresh rate display, storage is not expandable, no Touch ID sensor, no headphone jack and the battery life is average.

Apple iPhone 12 Pro Max 512GB is the premium model from the company this year. The phone is powered by A14 Bionic chipset, with 6GB RAM that promises powerful performance, and 512GB storage should be more than enough. The new cameras, along with LiDAR sensor add variety to the model from last year. The battery size has also been bumped for better backup. However, storage is non-expandable, the front screen has a notch, no touch ID sensor and the fast charging speeds are not comparable to the competition in this segment.

The iPhone 12 Pro Max 256GB is a bigger phone, making it difficult to hold with a single hand. The phone delivers excellent performance, thanks to its hexa core Apple 14 Bionic processor. The phone has the best cameras and captures stunning images. Although the battery life is excellent, the brand does not provide a charging adapter in the box. You can prefer iPhone 12 or 12 Pro, wherein you can get the same features for a lesser price.

Gionee F8 Neo is an entry-level smartphone and the features prove that. A small 5.4-inch display gets a dated design, with bezels, and offering HD+ screen resolution. The hardware in tow is just about average with its performance and the cameras are also there to make the numbers. The battery life also is low because of its size. Not the phone we'd recommend to anyone in the market these days.

Realme has launched another variant of the C15 but this time it gets Snapdragon 460 chipset. Besides that, the phone still sports a HD+ screen, quad rear cameras, and a large-capacity battery with fast charging support. However, for this price, 3GB RAM is not sufficient anymore, and even the use of microUSB port for charging. Buy this phone for long battery backup and a big screen.

Realme C15 Qualcomm Edition 64GB is a budget offering from the brand having a robust specs sheet. Some of the notable features include a 13MP quad-rear camera configuration, 4GB RAM, and 6000mAh battery with 18W fast charging support. Available at an affordable price tag, the smartphone is a worthy option at this price range.

Micromax IN Note 1 128GB packs a FHD+ display, a decent quad-rear camera setup and a large 5000mAh battery with fast charging support. The smartphone comes with a stock Android experience at a reasonable pricing.

Micromax IN 1B is a budget offering from the brand and packs decent specifications. The phone comes powered by MediaTek Helio G35 processor and runs Android 10 operating system. Also, the device packs a 5000mAh battery with 10W fast charging support that offers backup for longer durations.

LG W31 Plus is a budget-oriented offering smartphone from LG. The device features a big display, but it only has HD+ pixel resolution. The phone offers average hardware performance. Additionally, the camera performance is not great when compared to other devices in this price range. The phone disappoints in certain aspects, such as poor display, and the device does not support fast charging.

Nokia 5.4 is a good looking device with a strong build quality. But the big screen only supports HD+ quality at this price, which is not acceptable. The octa-core chipset with 4GB RAM will offer basic performance and nothing besides that. The 64GB onboard is expandable but the triple rear cameras are there to make the numbers, quality in the other sensors is lacking. The selfie camera does a decent job but we would have liked more than 4,000mAh battery on board. This device has to face stiff competition from Chinese brands at this price range.

Tecno Spark 6 Go is an entry-level phone with a focus on helping new users to migrate to Android smartphone. It packs a 6.5-inch HD+ screen that is big and the quality is good enough for surfing the web and watching videos. It is powered by octa-core chipset with 4GB RAM that should offer decent performance. The 5000mAh battery will ensure you get long backup. The selfie camera is good for use and having Android 10 out of box is a plus. However, the phone features a single camera at the back, is slightly bulky and gets microUSB port for charging.

Lava Z1 is an affordable budget offering from the brand that packs decent specifications. Some of the device's notable features include a decent camera configuration, the good expandable storage capacity of up to 256GB, and a 3100mAh user-replaceable battery. The low-resolution TFT display and 2GB RAM are certainly its low points. Given the price point, it makes a reasonable purchase.

Samsung Galaxy M02 3GB RAM is a decent offering from the brand with a standard specs sheet. The entry-level offering from the brand packs 3GB RAM, 32GB internal storage (expandable up to 1TB). Equipped with 5000mAh battery, the device offers battery backup for longer durations. However, the device does not have any fingerprint sensor for biometric security, and also the battery does not support fast charging.

Infinix Note 10 Pro gives you a decent package for the price. It sports a modern and durable design, with a large display at 1080p quality. The built-in chipset offers decent performance with 8GB RAM and you get ample storage onboard which is further expandable. The quad rear cameras deliver in most conditions, and the built-in battery offers long back and 33W fast charging support. But lack of high refresh rate for the screen is a big miss. Worth buying it but you have better options with 5G support in the market right now.

Nokia 5.4 is the latest device from the brand in the market. This device sits in the mid-range bracket, with focus on pure Android experience and not going overboard with hardware capabilities. Having said that, the phone has quad rear camera with diverse lenses and a capable front camera. The punch hole design is welcomed in the segment and having a phone that does basics is a necessity. But HD+ screen quality at this price, with 64GB storage is a downer. You have other options with better hardware in this price range.

Samsung has launched another mid-range Galaxy A series phone. But if you want a big screen with long battery backup and decent quad rear camera, only then you should consider the Galaxy A12 smartphone. For everything else, you have plenty of other options to choose from in this price range.

The LG 41 Pro is the third smartphone variant in the brands W41 series of smartphones along with LG W41 and LG W41 Plus.  The device does flaunt some attractive specs such as quad rear camera setup (48MP+8MP+5MP+2MP), 6GB RAM configuration, the expandable storage capacity of up to 512GB and a 5000mAh battery. As for the cons, the device sports a poor display that comes with an average processor. Also, the smartphone gets the Android v10 operating system despite the latest Android v11 operating system.

Gionee Max Pro is a workhorse device that offers a big screen for entertainment, social media browsing and web surfing. It promises to give you long battery life that will last for day or two with ease. The design is quite decent for the price and having 2.5D curved glass is hard to ignore. But the overall performance is basic, and having a single camera at the back is no longer acceptable. Worth looking at better devices in this price range.

Asus ROG Phone 5 is a hard-core gaming phone that provides you with the later hardware in the market. You get a big screen with support for 144Hz refresh rate for smoother gaming experience. Corning Gorilla Glass Victus gives the screen added protection and running Android 11 makes it ideal. The cameras are decent but the long battery backup along with 65W charging is a sweet deal for this price. However, the storage is not expandable, the design looks boring now and wireless charging was expected at this price.

Samsung Galaxy M42 5G is yet another affordable 5G offering from the brand's M-series lineup of smartphones. Some of the notable features of the mobile include an impressive chipset, robust 5000mAh battery capacity with 15W fast-charging. The camera configuration is impressive as it packs an impressive quad-rear camera setup (48MP+8MP+5MP+5MP) and a single 20MP selfie camera. On the downside, the device features a Hybrid SIM slot and does not have a dedicated slot for a microSD card.

Tecno Camon faces strong competition in the market but its overall features make the phone quite the value for money offering. You get a 6.6-inch Full HD+ display with 90Hz refresh rate. It runs on Android 11 version over customised skin, comes powered by octa-core MediaTek Helio G85 chipset with 6GB RAM that offers decent performance. The quad rear cameras offers versatility. The 5,000mAh battery gives long battery backup. You can buy this phone if you are not brand conscious.

Vivo X60 is the successor to the X50 from 2020. And the new model gets a host of improvements, including the new Snapdragon 870 chipset in tow. The phone comes with dynamic and capable cameras on both the sides. With 12GB RAM you get multi-tasking done without any hiccups and the battery supports fast charging. Running on Android 11 is a sweetener. However, the phone misses out on headphone jack and memory slot.

Samsung Galaxy F02s 64GB is an affordable entry-level device from the brand with decent specifications. The device sports a 6.5-inches bezel-less display, a standard 4GB RAM, and 64GB inbuilt memory. As for photography, the smartphone features a triple rear camera setup (13MP+2MP+2MP) and a single 5MP front-facing camera. The phone packs an impressive battery capacity of 5000mAh coupled with 15W fast-charging. On the downside, the device lacks a fingerprint sensor, and it is bulky, weighing 196 grams.

The Nokia G20 is the mid-range offering from Nokia. The device features a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display and is powered by an octa-core Helio G35 chipset. The smartphone offers the average selfie camera and has just 10W charging support. The phone doesn't justify the price tag and fails to deliver customer's needs, considering that we have many other good devices in the same price range like Redmi Note 10, Realme Narzo 30, etc.

Tecno Spark 7 Pro features a 6.6-inch HD+ display with a 90Hz refresh rate. The device runs Android 11 out of the box. It comes powered by an octa-core Helio G80 SoC, which is aided with 6GB RAM for excellent performance. The device houses a massive 5,000mAh battery that offers a long backup. However, you only get 10W charging support. The Tecno Spark 7 Pro is the best device in the Rs 10,000 segment if you are looking for that 90Hz display and excellent hardware performance.

Vivo Y12s 2021 is a budget phone that does hard to convince buyers but the competition around it means most of you will look the other way. It has a big display, the performance is good and the main camera does well. However, 3GB RAM and microUSB for charging aren't desirable anymore.

Infinix Note 10 is a solid budget smartphone that has all the basics covered and still gives you more for the price. You get a Full HD+ display, a powerful chipset, enough storage space to keep apps and store data. The cameras are also decent for the price and you also get long battery life. Worth going for, if you are not brand conscious.

Lava Z2 Max is a decent smartphone that sports a 7-inch display with HD+ resolution. On the software front, it runs Android 10 Go Edition out of the box. The device is powered by an octa-core Helio G35 SoC, paired with 2GB of RAM. The phone gets 13MP + 2MP dual rear cameras and an 8MP decent selfie camera that supports video calls as well. The device ships with a massive 6000mAh battery which means you get a long backup on a single charge.

The Xiaomi Redmi Note 10S 128GB features a 6.43-inches AMOLED display that has Full HD+ pixel resolution. The device has Corning Gorilla Glass v3 protection that provides sturdy protection for the screen. The Helio G95 SoC handles the processing work. The phone is equipped with a quad-camera setup that consists of a 48MP primary main sensor. The device draws power from a 5000mAh battery that supports 33W fast charging.

Itel A23 Pro is a buget-offering from Itel that features a 5-inch display. The phone packs 1GB RAM, 8GB storage, and has expandable storage support. It also has 4G connectivity support. However, the device only has FWVGA pixel resolution, a quad-core processor, and just a 2400mAh battery. If you are in search of a budget device with 4G in Rs 4200 price range, Itel A23 Pro is the device you should look forward to purchase.

Tecno Spark 7T is a hard-core budget phone that gives you a big display and large battery for long backup. The performance is meant for basic usage but having 4GB RAM is a bonus. The phone only features a single rear camera and the quality is average. The large capacity battery pushes the weight of the phone above 200 grams that can be unwieldy. Go for this phone if you want prefer buying from offline store.

Infinix Note 10 faces a tough fight in a competitive segment. The device itself has all the requisites to succeed, like a big screen, long battery life, latest Android version, 6GB RAM on this variant and more. The cameras fair decent for the price and you get storage expansion slot which comes in handy. But most people might avoid buying this because of the brand name and what it is up against right now. Solid device but people might overlook it.

Poco M3 Pro 5G will impress you with its looks, especially for what you pay. The phone supports 5G with the help of MediaTek Dimensity 700 SoC along with 6GB RAM that delivers decent performance. The screen gets 90Hz refresh rate support and Corning Gorilla Glass 3 protection. But it only has a hybrid SIM slot, the cameras are average for the price and you only get 18W charging support. Worth going for if you need a reliable daily usage device that has the looks.

Well, as you can see from the above list, this device has more cons than pros for its price. The Y1s 3GB RAM is strictly a budget phone that carries a big display with promise of long battery life. Everything else is average. So we suggest you look at other options in this price range that offer better value and features.

The Infinix Note 11 is a mid-range offering from Infinix that comes with a 6.7-inch AMOLED display. Thanks to the Helio G88 processor, 4GB of RAM and 64GB of internal storage, the device offers lag-free performance. The handset packs a 5,000mAh battery that offers 33W fast charging support. The camera and software experience on the device is average. Additionally, the handset's display supports only a 60Hz refresh rate. If you are someone who wants a long battery device, AMOLED display, and fast charging, you can consider buying the Infinix Note 11.

Infinix Hot 11 is a decent budget phone sporting a Full HD+ display but only with a notch. It powers on with the help of MediaTek Helio G70 chipset that gets 4GB RAM. The storage is expandable, it runs on Android 11 version and offers long battery life. However, the phone's design looks old, it only has a single rear camera which is average for the price. And lacks fast charging support for the battery. We suggest you look at other value options from brands like Realme, Redmi in this price range.

Vivo Y53s 4G is a phone that offers decent performance thanks to the MediaTek Helio G80 chipset with 8GB RAM. The storage is also expandable. The screen misses out on high refresh rate, and no AMOLED panel either. The main 64MP camera delivers quality photos, and the long battery life keeps you going. However, 18W fast charging for this price is not good these days. Better options out there in the market.

Redmi Note 10T is another mid-range 5G phone in the market that comes powered by MediaTek Dimensity 700 chipset which delivers reliable performance. This variant comes with 6GB RAM and offer 128GB storage which is further expandable. The screen gets 90Hz refresh rate and Corning Gorilla Glass 3 protection. And yes, the battery life is decent too. However, for this price, the phone lacks an AMOLED panel, the cameras are average and you only have 18W fast charging support. If you don't need a 5G phone right now, there are better 4G phones in the market at this price.

Samsung Galaxy M21 2021 makes a decent shout in the mid-range segment for buyers. You get it with quality Super AMOLED display, performance from Exynos 9 Octa chipset with 6GB RAM and 128GB storage with this variant which is further expandable. The cameras are decent, and the battery life keeps you going for long time. However, the notch design is a drawback, so is 15W fast charging speed. Still definitely worth buying.

Poco F3 GT is the first gaming smartphone by Poco for the Indian market. The device comes with a 120Hz AMOLED display and it offers impressive hardware performance thanks to Dimensity 1200 chipset. The device takes some good images. The phone packs a 5065mAh battery that has 67W fast charging support. If you are looking for a gaming phone under Rs 30,000 with some impressive hardware and AMOLED display, you can consider Poco F3 GT.

The Nokia C20 Plus comes with a 6.5-inch HD+ display. The device boots Android 11 out of the box with stock Android UI. The hardware and camera performance on the C20 Plus is average. The smartphone ships with a 5,000mAh battery which offers a long-lasting battery life. If you are looking for a smartphone with stock Android, then Nokia C20 Plus is the smartphone you can get in Rs 8,000 price range.

The Motorola Edge 20 Fusion comes with a 6.67-inch OLED 90Hz display that has Full HD+ resolution. The device offers excellent hardware and camera performance thanks to the Dimensity 800U chipset and 108MP camera. The device packs 8GB of RAM. The smartphone has average battery life and misses out on stereo speakers. If you are looking for a new device in around Rs 20,000 price range, you can go for Motorola Edge 20 Fusion.

The third-generation of Galaxy Z Fold 3 gets a sub-1 lakh price in India. And it's good to have the device with Snapdragon 888 in the country as well. The foldable form factor is evolving and Samsung is leading the segment. As for the Galaxy Z Flip 3, the cameras click decent photos, as well as handle water thanks to IPX8 rating. However, the selfie camera is average, the storage is not expandable and the average battery life only gets 15W charging support for its price, which is not acceptable these days. Definitely worth buying if you want to own the foldable experience.

The Realme GT 5G sports a 6.43-inch AMOLED display that has Full HD+ resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate. The hardware and camera performance of the device is top-notch, thanks to Snapdragon 888 SoC and 64MP camera. However, the selfie camera performance of the device is average. Additionally, the phone lacks IP rating. You can go for the Realme GT 5G if you are looking for smartphone purchase in Rs 40,000 range.

Tecno Spark 8 is an average budget phone that is priced on the higher side for its features. You get it with Android Go version because of which it only has 2GB RAM but the storage is expandable. The cameras are strictly average but you get long battery life. We suggest you to look at other options in this price range.

The Tecno Spark 8 Pro is an entry-level handset by Tecno. The device boasts a 6.58-inch IPS LCD display with a standard 60Hz refresh rate. The device is powered by Helio G88 processor. It features a 48MP dual-camera setup. The whole package draws power from a 5,000mAh battery which can easily last throughout the day. The handset supports 33W fast charging. If your priority is fast charging, long-lasting battery, and decent performance, you can buy the Tecno Spark 8 Pro.

Realme 8i is the latest device part of the 8 series from the company. It features an LCD 120Hz Full HD+ display with punch hole design. The device comes powered by Helio G96 chipset with 6GB RAM and 128GB internal storage for this price. The primary 50MP cameras shoots decent photos but the others are average. Having a 5,000mAh battery is helpful but with 18W charging speed, it take a while to fully charge. Realme 8i is a decent 4G mid-range phone worth buying right now.
