The Apple iPhone 13 Mini comes with a 5.4-inch OLED display. It is powered by Apple's A15 Bionic chipset, which offers excellent performance. The imaging aspect of the phone is handled by dual 12MP cameras at the rear. The device has only a 60Hz refresh rate and 20W fast charging support. If you are looking for a compact phone with best-in-class hardware and camera performance, then you can go for the iPhone 13 Mini.

Apple iPhone 13 Pro Max this year gets a whopping 1TB storage model. This should idea for all users and even professionals. The cameras have improved, the performance gets a boost thanks to A15 Bionic chip with 6GB RAM. iOS 15 brings new features, and having OLED display with 120Hz refresh rate is a different experience. The bigger model promises longer backup as well. However, the size can be unwieldy, the lack of headphone jack and memory card slot is there too. But for a phone costing this much 20W charging speed is not good. If you have the money, this is the phone to get in 2021.

The Apple iPhone 13 Pro Max comes with a 6.7-inch OLED display that has 120Hz refresh rate. The performance of the device is great, thanks to Apple's A15 Binoic chipset The front and back cameras also takes some good images. It packs up to 256GB of onboard storage. However, the charging capability of the handset is limited to 20W. If you are willing to spend above Rs 1 lakh for a smartphone and want good camera and hardware performance, you can go for the iPhone 13 Pro Max.

Redmi 9 Activ is another budget phone from Xiaomi that caters to entry-level buyers, who need a large screen phone, with support for basic apps and feature dual rear cameras to shoot pictures. Thanks to 4GB RAM its performance will keep you going without any hassle. However, the front camera is basic, the design is bulky and because of microUSB port the charging of battery is slow.

Redmi 9 Activ is a budget-oriented offering by Xiaomi's sub-brand Redmi. The phone features a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display that has HD+ resolution. The device is powered by an octa-core Helio G35 SoC. It runs Android 11 out of the box. However, the smartphone has a microUSB port and it supports 10W charging. If you are looking for a device with a longer battery backup and a larger display, you can go for the Redmi 9 Activ.

The Redmi Note 10 Lite sports a 6.67-inch IPS LCD display with a Full HD+ resolution. Powering the device under the hood is an octa-core Snapdragon 720G SoC. The smartphone has a 48MP quad-camera camera. The device ships with a 5000mAh that offers 18W fast charging support. However, the display panel lacks a higher refresh rate, and the phone is also heavier in weight. If the higher refresh rate isn't a concern, the Redmi Note 10 Lite is a good choice in the Rs 16,000 price range.

Xiaomi Redmi Note 10 Lite borrows its good looks from the other phones in the series. It sports a Full HD+ display without an AMOLED panel and high refresh rate support. The performance is reliable but it only supports 4G connectivity. The storage is expandable, and the cameras click good photos. The long battery life also helps. However, 18W charging speed at this price is not ideal anymore.

mobile_name: Motorola Moto G Turbo Virat Kohli Edition

expert_view: Vivo Y20T is an average phone that is overpriced for its features in the current market. It doesn't have an AMOLED panel of high refresh rate screen, the performance is average, even though it has 6GB RAM. The storage is expandable but very few things will appeal to the buyer at this price.

Realme C25Y 64GB variant gives users more of the same. It comes with a 6.52-inch HD display, powered by Unisoc chipset but with 4GB RAM. The storage is expandable, the rear cameras are good for the price and the battery life keeps everyone happy. But even then we don't recommend this phone to buyers.

The Tecno Spark 8 comes with a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display. The display panel offers 480 nits of brightness. The device boots Android 11 out of the box. The hardware and camera performance on the device is average. The smartphone lacks fast charging support. If you are looking for a long battery backup device, you can go for the Tecno Spark 8. However, you will have to compromise on performance, fast charging, and image quality of cameras.

Xiaomi Redmi Note 11T 5G offers 128GB storage, comes powered by Dimensity 810 chipset to give 5G support. The camera at the back are average, the screen misses out on AMOLED panel but you get decent overall performance. Still, we suggest you consider other, possibly 4G phones with better features.
Tecno Spark Go 2022 is a budget Android Go device that only has a quad-core chipset which is unlikely to deliver performance that users want for apps and other functions. Better to skip this one.

Xiaomi 11i HyperCharge scores most of the marks for its 120W fast charging support. But apart from that it is a regular mid-range phone with Dimensity 920 5G chipset, 8GB RAM for performance, 128GB storage which is expandable using the second SIM slot. The battery life is average. Still worth buying in current market.

The Infinix Hot 11 2022 offers some interesting features in this price range. The phone comes with a large 6.8-inch Full HD+ display which is a rare thing in this price segment. Moreover, the phone comes with a decent camera setup and delivers a good battery backup. Overall, it is a worthy option to consider under Rs 10,000 segment.

Vivo T1 8GB RAM is basically the same phone but with 8GB RAM. The 5G chipset is able to give you decent performance because of this but other features are still lacking, and for this money you have other better options right now.

The Vivo T1 is a mid-range device by Vivo that boasts a 6.58-inch IPS LCD display. The device is powered by Snapdragon 695 SoC, which offers excellent performance. The SoC includes 6GB of RAM and 128GB of UFS 3.1 internal storage. The smartphone runs the latest Android 12 version out of the box. A 5,000mAh battery easily lasts throughout the day, which supports 18W fast charging. One should go for the Vivo T1, if you want the latest Android 12 version and powerful hardware.

Redmi Note 11 4G variant with 128GB storage offers 6GB RAM and powered by Snapdragon 680 chipset. The cameras have been downgraded in megapixels but the quality is still good. The battery life is reliable and 33W fast charging helps.

Itel A27 gets Android 11 Go version which means you have it with 2GB RAM and just 32GB storage. But the overall package is basic and very few people should consider this as their first smartphone, even though it offers decent battery life.

Realme 9 Pro+ is a quality addition to the market, giving equal focus to performance and design. The Super AMOLED display gets Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection. The Dimensity 920 chipset offers 5G support along with 8GB RAM for reliable performance. The storage is not expandable though. The main rear camera does really well in most conditions, but the front camera is average. The battery life is also average but having 60W fast charging is useful.

The Realme 9 Pro Plus comes with a 6.4-inch AMOLED display that has Full HD+ resolution. The display however supports only 90Hz refresh rate. The device offers good performance, thanks to the Dimensity 920 SoC. The smartphone offers up to 65W fast charging support. It runs latest Android 12 OS version out of the box with Realme UI 3.0 on top. Overall, in the Rs 28,999 price range, the Realme 9 Pro Plus is an excellent device which you can consider buying.

The iQOO 9 boasts a 6.5-inch AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate. The display quality is excellent for the viewing experience. The device is powered by Snapdragon 888 Plus processor which offers great performance. On the software front, the handset boots latest Android 12 software version. The phone supports 120W fast charging, and the charger is included in the box. If your budget is close to Rs 50,000, the iQOO 9 is the best handset that you can consider buying.

The Realme Narzo 50 has solid features and comes with a Rs 15,500 price tag. The Helio G96 processor is powerful, and the 5000mAh Li-Polymer battery is strong. The camera performance is average. The device offers excellent game performance and includes 6GB RAM, which is mostly found in high-budget smartphones.

The Poco M4 Pro comes with a 6.43-inch AMOLED display that has Full HD+ resolution. The device is powered by an octa-core Helio G96 processor. Thanks to 6GB of RAM and 128GB of internal storage, the handset offers excellent performance. The smartphone features a 64MP triple-camera setup. The handset offers a long-lasting battery life and the battery supports 33W fast charging. If you are looking for a smartphone with an AMOLED display, decent hardware, and fast charging support, the Poco M4 Pro is the device that you can consider buying. However, do note that the handset lacks 5G support and it still runs Android 11 out of the box.

Realme C35 is a budget segment smartphone in the price range of Rs. 13,000 only. The primary camera is great on the rear with a 50MP resolution. The device has a massive battery of 5000mAh that offers longer backup.

The iPhone SE 2022 offers 5G support thanks to the A15 Bionic chipset which now comes with 4GB RAM. You still get a single 12MP rear and 7MP front camera. The design sees no change, and the Touch ID has been retained. The battery life has improved but you only have 20W fast charging. For the price, iPhone SE 2022 faces tough competition with other Android brands.

mobile_name: Xiaomi Redmi Note 11 Pro Plus 5G 8GB RAM
expert_view: Xiaomi Redmi Note 11 Pro Plus 5G with 8GB RAM offers better performance. It has an AMOLED display 120Hz refresh rate, along with Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection. The storage is expandable but using a hybrid SIM slot. The rear cameras offer good quality, the battery life is great and you get it with 67W fast charging. Definitely worth buying for the price.

The Realme 9 5G flaunts a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display that has Full HD+ resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate. The device is powered by Helio G96 SoC which offers good performance. The handset packs 128GB of internal storage and has 6GB of RAM. The handset even has 5G support, microSD card slot, and up to 33W fast charging support. If you are looking for a 5G Realme phone with 120Hz display, and decent hardware, you can consider buying the Realme 9 5G. However, do note that the device runs Android 11 and has a plastic build.

OPPO A16e is nearly similar to its A16 series smartphone in terms of specifications. The difference between A16 and A16e is the processor and camera setup. It is built with an octa-core processor, which along with the 4GB RAM let it perform seamlessly. You can click the pictures with a 13MP rear camera and for selfies, you will get a 5MP front camera that enables you for clicking average selfies.

The Samsung Galaxy A23 comes with a 6.6-inch TFT display that has a Full HD+ resolution and a 60Hz refresh rate. Thanks to Snapdragon 680 processor, 8GB of RAM, and 128GB of internal storage, the device offers excellent performance. The smartphone features a 50MP quad-camera setup, which takes some good images. The handset is equipped with a 5,000mAh battery which support 25W fast charging. However, Samsung is bundling only 15W fast charger in the box. If your priority is hardware and good battery life, then A23 is a good option. However, you will have to compromise on display, charging speed, and 5G support.

The Infinix Smart 6 Plus is a great alternative in this price segment. The handset offers some great design and decent performance at this price point. The phone also packs good battery life, enough to last one full day. Moreover, you get the latest version of the Android operating system and multiple colour options to choose from.

Tecno Spark 8C 4GB RAM runs the Android v11 operating system and is packed with a 5000mAh battery that lets you enjoy watching movies, playing games, and a lot more without worrying about battery drainage. On the front, the mobile sports an 8 MP front camera that let you click some amazing selfies.

The Realme C31 64GB offers entry-level specifications for the users. The phone comes with a tall design and the octa-core chipset has enough power to run basic day-to-day tasks. The major highlight of the smartphone is the 50MP triple-camera setup at the rear, which is a rare thing in this price segment. So, if you are considering a budget-centric smartphone with a tall display, decent cameras, good storage, and long-lasting battery life, then the Realme C31 64GB can be considered a good option.

The Vivo Y15s 64GB looks slim and comes with decent specifications at the mid-range price segment. It runs the Android Go version, which is designed for low-end smartphones. As for the rear cameras, the smartphone comes with a dual camera setup compared to a triple camera setup as seen in the Vivo Y15. Thanks to Helio P35 SoC, the device offers a mediocre performance.

The Redmi 10A model is a decent offering in this price range. The smartphone comes with all the ingredients that are standard in this price segment. The phone offers a large-screen display that provides a decent experience for watching videos. The handset also packs MediaTek Helio G25 chipset, which is enough to handle most of the daily tasks like internet browsing, light mobile games, and more. The camera is a bit let down and the issue of bloatware still persists on this device.

The Tecno Pova 4 is a mid-range 4G smartphone priced at Rs 11,999 in India. The device flaunts a 6.82-inch IPS LCD display that has 720p resolution and a 90Hz refresh rate. The phone is equipped with Helio G99 SoC which offers excellent performance. On the software front, the device runs Android 12 OS. The device packs a massive 6,000mAh battery which can last throughout the day. However, the cameras on the phones are average, and there is only 18W fast charging support. If you are looking for a big display device with a 90Hz refresh rate and good performance, then you can go for Tecno Pova 4.
The Realme Narzo 50A Prime feels like a mixed bag for us. Besides the design, display and good battery life, the phone seems average. It appears to be lost in a crowded 5G market now.

The Nokia G21 is the latest budget-centric smartphone from HMD Global. The smartphone comes with a decent design language and offers some good camera features at this price range. The phone also comes with 18W fast charging support, which is a good thing. Apart from this, the phone seems to be an underdog when compared to the competition in terms of performance and display department. That said, if you are looking for a stock Android smartphone in the budget segment, then you can consider Nokia G21 128 model.

The Nokia 105 Plus gets an MP3 player for streaming the music and a 1000mAh battery to provide a long backup. The feature phone from Nokia is an excellent option for those looking for a secondary phone or elderly people. The sturdy body and feather touch keypad are some of the USPs of the Nokia 105 Plus.

The iQOO Z6 4G comes with a 6.4-inch AMOLED display that has Full HD+ resolution. Thanks to the Snapdragon 680 processor and 6GB of RAM the handset offers lag-free performance. The device sports a 50MP triple-camera setup. However, the camera module lacks a ultra-wide lens. The smartphone runs latest Android 12 software version and offers 44W fast charging support. In the Rs 15,499, the iQOO Z6 4G is a good smartphone considering you get AMOLED display, latest Android OS version, and up to 44W fast charging. However, do note that the device lacks a 5G support and it has a plastic back panel.

The Vivo T1 44W 8GB RAM packs some segment-leading features, including the support in-display fingerprint sensor and 44W fast charging support. The phone also comes with a reliable Snapdragon 680 processor and the 50MP triple-camera setup also seems to be decent. However, the company has skipped an ultra-wide lens in this phone, which is an odd choice. That said, if you are looking for a phone with super-fast charging support and some unique features, then you can consider Vivo T1 44W 8GB RAM model.

The Vivo Y15c launches with a plastic body and has the same design as the Y15s. The 5000mAh battery and 90Hz refresh rate display make decent additions to the smartphone in the price segment. The Helio P35 SoC isn't capable enough for gaming and delivers relatively lower performance than the other smartphones in the price range.

The Realme Narzo 50 128GB model offers some interesting features. The device comes with a premium design and offers reliable performance, all thanks to the MediaTek Dimensity 810 processor. The device also packs 33W fast charging, which ensures to quickly fill up your battery. Overall, it is a decent device to consider in this price segment, though the competition is quite tough.

The Moto G42 is a good option to consider in this price segment. The phone comes with a different design language, and the display also seems good. The device also packs a bloat-free user interface and provides good performance in day-to-day usage. Moreover, you get capable stereo speakers along with long battery life, making it one of the best options in this category.

The Moto E32s is probably one of the best options you can get under the Rs 10,000 segment. The smartphone packs some interesting hardware and features that makes it a worthy option in this price segment. The Moto E32s packs an octa-core MediaTek processor and comes with a 90Hz screen refresh rate. The phone also provides a stock Android experience and offers comes with a decent set of cameras. Overall, it is a good phone to consider in this price range.

The Tecno Camon 19 comes loaded with some interesting features. The device packs a large display and offers a good screen-to-body ratio. The device also delivers some good performance in day-to-day usage, though heavy gaming may be a bit laggy. Apart from this, the phone also features a large battery backup, which can last one full day.

The Tecno Camon 19 Pro 5G is the brand's decent 5G smartphone. The handset comes loaded with some interesting features and specifications. Some of these include a premium design, a reliable 5G processor from MediaTek, fast charging support, and more. On the downside, the phone does come with some noticeable bloatware.

The I Kall Z9 is an entry-level smartphone from I Kall that sports a 5.99-inch display. The device uses a quad-core processor which offers average performance. The smartphone still runs Android 10 out of the box. It packs a 4,000mAh battery which lacks fast charging support. If you are looking for a good display, the latest Android software version, and excellent hardware, then the I Kall Z9 might not be the best device for you.

The Vivo T1x 128GB appears to be a good value in this pricing range. The handset features a luxurious design as well as competitive features. The model comes with a 7-layer cooling system, which is a segment-leading feature that will improve gaming performance. Furthermore, the phone has a competent camera setup, however, the ultra-wide-angle lens is missing. Nonetheless, it remains one of the best options to consider in this price range.

The Tecno Spark 9 128GB model seems to be an interesting option in this price segment. The device is loaded with a premium design language and offers a large display that is enough for multimedia consumption. The handset also features a reliable processor that can deliver some good results in different aspects. Moreover, the large battery backup is also good, which can easily last for one full day.

The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 is yet another design marvel from Samsung. The latest handset comes with a clamshell design that reveals a gorgeous foldable display. The phone also bears flagship-grade features and specifications like the Snapdragon 8 Plus Gen 1 processor and top-of-the-line cameras. So, if you are looking for a unique and lifestyle smartphone, then Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 5G is the right choice for you.

The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 is the South Korean smartphone manufacturer's finest innovation. The phone not only has flagship-level features and specifications, but it also has a revolutionary folding mechanism that has transformed the smartphone market. If price is not a factor, the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 is one of the greatest alternatives available right now.

mobile_name: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 5G Bespoke Edition
expert_view: The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 5G Bespoke Edition is one of the classic examples of premium design and latest innovations. The newest device features a clamshell design that opens to expose a stunning folding display. The phone also has flagship-level features and characteristics, such as the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Plus Gen 1 engine and top-tier cameras. So, if you're searching for a one-of-a-kind and lifestyle smartphone, the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 5G Bespoke Edition is the way to go.

Buyers will find the OPPO K10 5G 6GB RAM model to be a fantastic value for money. The device has a strong design language and an IP54 rating, which is a nice feature. The phone also has a strong battery life, and the 33W fast charging capability is useful. The display is smooth and responsive, and the performance is adequate. On the other hand, the omission of an ultra-wide-angle lens may raise some questions. Nonetheless, it is a viable alternative in this price range.

The Realme C33 is a decent smartphone in this price segment. The phone features a tall display and comes with decent day-to-day performance. It also offers a flashy design language, which looks quite unique. Moreover, the phone delivers a good battery life and cameras are also fine on this one. So, if you are looking for a budget-centric smartphone, then you can put Realme C33 on your shortlist.

The Apple iPhone 14 Plus 512GB model is unquestionably an excellent addition to the iPhone lineup. The phone has a tall display, making playing games or watching films a pleasurable experience. The phone is powered by one of the industry's fastest chipsets, which gives a great performance in all areas. Furthermore, the iPhone has excellent photographic capabilities, making it one of the most sought smartphones in 2022.

The Apple iPhone 14 model is probably one of the most-selling iPhones in the iPhone 14 series. The phone offers the right balance of style and performance. The device packs a 6.1-inch display, which is comfortable to hold. The handset also comes with a powerful Apple A15 Bionic chipset and offers some great camera capabilities, thanks to its dual-camera system. So, if you are planning to buy a new iPhone and want a compact phone, then the iPhone 14 is the right choice for you.

The iPhone 14 Pro Max is a beast of a phone. This big-screen flagship packs a new 48MP camera, an always-on display, a new A16 Bionic processor and a Dynamic Island feature. If you're looking for a new iPhone and want the best model from Apple's iPhone 14 series lineup, the iPhone 14 Pro Max 1TB is the right option for you.

The Apple iPhone 14 Pro model is likely to be one of the most popular iPhones in the iPhone 14 series. The phone strikes a good mix between design and performance. The gadget has a 6.1-inch display that is easy to grasp. The device also has a strong Apple A16 Bionic CPU and excellent photographic capabilities owing to its 48MP triple-camera system. So, if you're in the market for a new iPhone and want the best experience, then the iPhone 14 Pro is the way to go.

The Vivo Y22 2022 128GB model is a phone with some interesting features and functions. The phone features a premium design and offers a tall display. The model is also powered by a decent and reliable MediaTek G70 processor and offers a large 128GB of internal storage. However, we have the competition offering better display and camera in this price range. Overall, it can be considered a decent option in this section.

The Realme Narzo 50i Prime is the latest addition in the Narzo series that delivers a good mix of premium design and decent specifications. The model from the brand packs a tall aspect ratio and is available in attractive colour options. Apart from the looks, the phone also delivers a decent performance and offers some standard specifications for this price segment. So, if you are looking for a stylish smartphone in this price segment, then you can easily consider the Realme Narzo 50i Prime.

The Tecno Spark 9 3GB RAM is an entry-level smartphone that can handle most of your daily activities. The phone is equipped with a large 6.6-inch display and offers decent internal storage, which is expandable as well. The phone also features a good battery backup, which can comfortably last one full day of charge. Overall, if you are looking to buy a smartphone under this price range, then you can consider this as one of the options.

The Xiaomi Redmi A1 Plus 3GB RAM sure seems to be an interesting option in this price segment. The model comes with a decent design language and offers a reliable MediaTek processor that can handle most of the daily tasks. Moreover, the model also features a decent battery, though some sort of fast charging would have been appreciated. That said. If you are looking for a budget smartphone then you can easily consider this one.

The Lava Blaze Nxt offers some decent features such as large display, a 3.5mm audio jack and a 5000mAh battery. The display panel supports only HD+ 720 x 1600 pixels resolution. The device comes with a decent performance in this price segment, though you might find better-performing phones. Moreover, if you are looking for an Indian brand and your budget is around Rs 9,000, then you can consider this device.

The I Kall Z18 is a regular option in this price range. The phone has an intriguing design language, but the rest of the specs are very conventional for this price range. So, if you're looking for an entry-level smartphone, be sure to look at other possibilities that provide a far more modern version of Android.

mobile_name: OPPO Reno8 Pro House of Dragon Edition
expert_view: The OPPO Reno8 Pro House of Dragon Edition is a great smartphone from OPPO. The handset is equipped with modern features, and specifications are on point as well. The handset features a great display, which enhances the viewing experience. Moreover, it also features a good set of cameras (both rear and front) that provides stable performance in different scenarios. Overall, if you are looking for a stylish smartphone in this price range, then you can consider the Reno8 Pro House of Dragon Edition.

The Samsung Galaxy M32 Prime Edition is a budget-oriented smartphone from Samsung that comes with a 6.5-inch AMOLED display featuring a Full HD+ resolution and a 90Hz refresh rate. An octa-core Helio G80 equipped with the device offers average performance. The camera on the device takes some images, thanks to a 64MP primary sensor. However, the phone only offers 15W fast charging support, and the back panel of the device is made of plastic. If you are looking primarily for a good display, design, latest Android 12 OS, and a good battery backup phone, then you can go for the Galaxy M32 Prime Edition.

The Samsung Galaxy M32 Prime Edition is the latest smartphone in the budget segment from Samsung, which is targeted towards the masses. The phone has a nice look and solid performance. It is equipped with a MediaTek Helio G80 processor that is suitable for everyday use. Furthermore, the battery backup is adequate, despite the fact that the manufacturer only offers 15W fast charging support. Having said that, the phone is a decent buy in this price range.

The Redmi Note 12 Pro with 8GB RAM is a major improvement over the Redmi Note 11 Pro. The smartphone features a new design language and performs well in this price range. You get a 120Hz AMOLED display as well as a 5G chipset with adequate performance. The phone also includes a 67W fast charging port, which is a welcome feature. Overall, if you're searching for a dependable choice around Rs 28,000, this gadget is worth considering.

mobile_name: Xiaomi Redmi Note 12 Pro Plus 5G 12GB RAM
expert_view: The Redmi Note 12 Pro Plus flaunts a 6.67-inch AMOLED display which supports a 120Hz refresh rate. The device features a 200MP camera which takes some good images. The handset also offers excellent performance, thanks to a 6nm octa-core Dimensity 1080 SoC. Furthermore, the phone also packs 12GB of RAM and has 5G support. The handset offers good battery life and it also supports 120W fast charging. If you are looking for a phone with 5G, AMOLED display panel, and excellent cameras, then the Redmi Note 12 Pro Plus is an ideal option.

The Samsung Galaxy A04s is the latest smartphone in the budget segment from Samsung, which is targeted towards the masses. The phone has a nice look and solid performance. It is equipped with a Samsung Exynos 850 processor that is suitable for everyday use. Furthermore, the battery backup is adequate, despite the fact that the manufacturer offers no fast charging support. Having said that, the phone is a decent buy in this price range.

In its pricing range, the Moto E13 is a balanced smartphone. It features a nice design, respectable performance, a long battery life, loud speakers, and the most recent Android version. The camera quality and display are mediocre, and charging the device takes a lifetime.

Tecno Pop 7 Pro 3GB RAM is a basic budget phone that does little to convince us or the buyer.  The device comes with a big display and battery that lets you enjoy watching movies, playing games, and a lot more without worrying about battery drainage. Overall, if you are looking to buy a smartphone under this price range, then you can consider this as one of the options.

The Vivo V27 Pro is a mid-range smartphone with an impressive design, vibrant display, long-lasting battery, reliable cameras, and satisfactory performance. Though it lacks the best speakers and performance in its class, it's still a great purchase for most, especially those who prefer buying offline.

The Realme C33 128GB smartphone is a solid choice for those seeking a device with impressive features. With 128GB of internal storage, a 50MP camera, and an octa-core processor, it offers ample storage and processing power, as well as great camera capabilities. However, some users may be disappointed by the lack of fast charging and Full HD display.

The Moto G13 is a feature-packed smartphone that offers an exceptional user experience. The phone runs latest Android 13 OS out of the box and it is promised to receive Android 14 update along with 3 years of security upgrades. The smartphone's 6.5-inch 90Hz display, long battery life, advanced camera system, and ample storage make it the perfect device.

The Infinix Hot 30i boasts a high refresh rate display, all-day battery life, and extra RAM. While lacking in a modern front design and dual-speaker setup, and running on an older Android 12 OS, it's still a solid choice at its affordable price point.

The Lava Blaze X1 5G combines a sleek design, powerful performance, and a versatile camera system. With its impressive 50 MP triple rear camera, long-lasting battery, and expandable storage, it offers great value for its price. However, the lack of fast charging and limited screen resolution are minor drawbacks to consider.

The realme Narzo N53 128GB is a feature-packed smartphone with a sleek design and vibrant display. Its 50 MP camera captures stunning photos, while the decent performance and ample 128 GB storage ensure smooth multitasking. The long-lasting 5000 mAh battery keeps you powered all day.

The Xiaomi Redmi A2 2023 4GB RAM smartphone offers a budget-friendly option with its MediaTek Helio G36 chipset, 6.52-inch IPS LCD display, and dual rear camera setup. The device provides smooth performance, ample storage, and long battery life. It's a reliable choice for everyday use at an affordable price.

The Realme 11 Pro offers an enhanced experience with its impressive design, camera, display, and battery life. It outshines its predecessor, the Realme 10 Pro. However, the Realme 11 Pro+ offers significant upgrades at a similar price point. Still, in the sub-'     25K range, it is the most visually appealing and reliable phone overall.

Infinix Smart 7 is a budget smartphone with up to 7GB RAM and a 6000mAh battery. Its large screen and stylish design add to the list of pros. However, the processor and camera performance are considered cons. At INR 7,299, it's a fantastic budget-friendly phone, ideal for daily tasks and media consumption, offering impressive battery life.

Despite using last year's chipset and retaining the silent/ring switch, the iPhone 15 Plus remains impressively fast with the A16 Bionic. Its updated design, USB-C port, Dynamic Island, and a powerful 48MP camera offer excellent value. For those seeking a large-screen iPhone experience without the high cost, the iPhone 15 Plus is a compelling choice, especially in pink.

The Vivo Y17s offers a 6.56-inch IPS LCD display with decent specs like MediaTek Helio G85 processor, 4GB RAM, and 128GB storage. The 50MP primary camera and 5,000mAh battery are notable features. However, the device lacks fast charging and 5G support. Considering the price point it is offered, it should be a great device.

display: 5.0″ (12.7 cm) True HD IPS Plus LCD Display

mobile_name: Alcatel One Touch Idol X Plus
Asus Zenfone 2 ZE551ML (2GB RAM, Full HD, 16GB, 1.8GHz)

expert_view: If you want to see a phone that lags in every department, the Xolo Era 2 is it.

The Nokia 7 Plus is one of the best smartphones in its price range. Its performance is superior to most of its competition, and so are its exterior looks. This phone undoubtedly deserves our recommendation to buy.

The only thing that Moto E5 Plus is better than its competitors is in the battery backup. However, even in battery backup, it is only marginally better. Other smartphones in the same price range like the Xiaomi Redmi Note 5 Pro and the Asus Zenfone Max Pro M1 offer tons of other features and they also perform better, while having almost similar battery backup. Therefore, I think it is pointless to buy the Moto E5 Plus.
Although the Lenovo A5 has good specifications for its price, the company's ZUI makes it less appealing compared to the likes of the Xiaomi Redmi 6A.
The Nokia 3.1 is a good buy because it is an all-rounder in terms of processing power, design, camera output, and display quality.

mobile_name: Asus Zenfone Max Pro M2 6GB RAM

expert_view: dummy  text

The Infinix S4 is a good buy at its price and even in a saturated market, the phone has a lot of interesting highlights that make it stand out. One can't be sure about regular software updates but all in all, the S4 is a good package.

The Tecno Camon 15 is a budget handset with an attractive design and impressive specs sheet. It packs a powerful hardware configuration that ensures the smooth performance of the smartphone without any hiccups. Even though the device comes powered by a large 5000mAh battery capacity, it does not support fast charging.

The Tecno Spark Power is the ideal choice for those looking for a budget smartphone with decent performance and the best battery back up. There are many other available options out there from the likes of Realme and Redmi.

While most feature phones in the market are more or less the same, the X752 from Micromax stands apart by offering features that other feature phones don't, such as its big loudspeaker and the ability to use the X752 as a call receiver for your smartphone or as a Bluetooth speaker. While the rear camera of the phone is futile, it doesn't really matter because the device is extremely cheap. If you want a feature phone that can act as a call receiver and Bluetooth speaker, go for the X752. However, if these features aren't necessary for you, there are other features phones in the market that cost the same offer better build quality.

Panasonic Eluga I6 gets a compact design, powered by quad-core processor but only with 2GB of RAM. The rear camera offers decent quality photos for the price and the storage is further expendable up to 256GB. However, the phone comes with Android 9 version out of box and the overall package does not match with the competition.

Samsung Galaxy Note 20 Ultra gives you the best flagship hardware package, with high-end AMOLED display that supports 120Hz refresh rate and gets Corning Gorilla 6 protection. It comes with premium set of cameras with a 108MP primary sensor and dual 40MP cameras on the front. The built-in battery supports fast charging, wireless charging and reverse wireless charging also. But you will have to sacrifice the second SIM to expand storage and start using wireless earphones or USB Type C ones if you're planning to buy this phone.
If you've got only 1,000 bucks and need a phone for staying connected, the Karbonn KX5 is your go-to device.

Nokia 2.4 is a typical phone that we've become accustomed to from the brand. It features a quality design with a strong build quality that gives it an appealing touch. But on the hardware front, the phone lacks the required features you expect at this price point. You get a HD+ display, powered by Helio P22 chipset that is average and the cameras just about get the job done. However, you do have stock Android interface with promise of timely updates.

Xiaomi Redmi Note 9 128GB variant gets a well-rounded design, features Full-HD+ display which gets Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection. The hardware on board offers gaming support and also packs a large capacity battery with reverse charging support. The phone features a decent quad rear camera setup for the price. However, the MIUI version is filled with bloatware.

IKall K800 features a large HD+ display at a pocket-friendly price. Apart from that, the phone packs average set of hardware, cameras as not very good, runs on outdated Android 6.0 version out of box and the battery life is average as well. Unless you are limited on the budget, this phone is not worth buying.

I Kall K4 Plus packs a 6-inch display with 4GB RAM and quad-core processor on a budget. The cameras are just about manageable but the outdated Android version out of box is inexplicable. Add to that, the screen supports low resolution and the overall package is rather underwhelming, even for this price.

I Kall K201 gets a large 6.2-inch screen but the resolution support is very low. It runs on outdated Android 6.0 version and offers average performance. The rear camera does the job for the price but the battery life is lower than needed for the overall package.

I Kall K2 Plus features a 5.5-inch HD+ display, comes packing with quad-core processor, 4GB RAM and offers 64GB storage. The rear camera does a manageable job and the battery life offers solid backup. But the phone runs on outdated Android version that compromises on the security of the user. Better to skip this one.
I Kall K220 is an entry-level budget smartphone for basic usage. It comes with decent performance, battery backup, and storage capacity. The company could have included a better processor.

I Kall K210 is an affordable entry-level smartphone and ships with decent features. It offers 2GB RAM, 16GB internal memory, expandable up to 64GB using a microSD card. The 2800mAh battery capacity offers backup for only a few hours. If you consider the features and price range, I Kall K210 is a decent purchase.

Itel Vision 1 with 3GB RAM is a reliable budget phone that helps people switch to smartphones. It has a large display with HD+ resolution, dual cameras, and decent battery life. However, the cameras offer nothing, and the device runs on Android 9.0 version which is outdated.

Tecno Spark Go 2020 is a budget phone running on Android Go version. The phone packs a quad-core processor from Mediatek that offers basic performance and with 2GB RAM you can manage daily tasks. The 5,000mAh battery offers long backup, however, it is hard to recommend this phone, especially at this price, when so many better options are available.

If you are looking for a low-budget feature phone to buy, the Itel U10 should be in your shortlist. While the Itel U10 might not have extra features that other feature phones offer, it gets all the basic tasks done without any fuss.

The Itel Magic 2 Max is basically an Itel Magic 2 with a larger battery. Itel could have cut the manufacturing cost by skipping on the camera as it is anyhow useless. Other than that, the Itel Magic 2 Max is a decent feature phone for the price.
The Itel Magic 2 is an affordable feature phone that is great for people who can't operate smartphones (especially old people).

Nokia C3 2020 32GB is a good budget smartphone featuring a dedicated microSD card, audio jack and stock Android OS. The phone does disappoint when it comes to the camera department as it ships with a single 8MP rear camera. There are better options available in the market at this price point.

Realme 7 gives you value-for-money features, with the added bonus of 90Hz refresh rate screen. The hardware is suited for gaming, and with 8GB RAM multi-tasking is a breeze. The quad-rear cameras do an impressive job, so does the front camera. The battery gets long backup and 30W fast charging for quick bootup. All in all, this phone is definitely worth having on your list.

Tecno Spark Power 2 Air packs a big display that satisfies your need for multimedia viewing on the go. It packs HD+ resolution that is the norm in this segment, but you also get triple rear cameras, along with a decent front camera. With its 6,000mAh battery, you will never run after a charger. But the phone is powered by a quad-core chipset that might not be good for multi-tasking, and for charging you get a microUSB port.

Tecno is stepping up its game in the budget segment. Tecno Pova is an excellent option in the budget gaming segment. With a tall 6.8-inches display, a large 6000mAh battery, and Helio G80 octa-core processor, the handset is a good option to consider in the price range.

Micromax IN 1 is the latest budget phone from the brand. And for under 10K, you get a decent package that includes MediaTek Helio G80 chipset, 64GB internal storage, punch hole design, Full HD+ display, and long battery backup with fast charging support. The only notable drawbacks are Android 10 OS, and average front camera. You consider this device along with others like Realme C10 or the Redmi 9 series.

Karbonn Titanium S9 Plus gets a big screen with 3GB RAM and onboard storage of 32GB that is further expandable. The battery life will also let you use the phone for a day without any issues. This is a budget phone but even then the screen resolution is low for its size, the hardware package includes a quad-core processor and even now the phone runs on Android 9.0. Much better options out there in the market.

The new Oppo A15, 2GB RAM, packs basic specs sheet and is available at an affordable price segment. The handset features a triple rear camera setup (13MP+2MP+2MP), a proper storage configuration of 32GB, and an Android v10 (Q) operating system. The device is devoid of a USB Type-C port, and also, it does not support fast-charging. However, the smartphone is a decent purchase at this price point.

Lava has launched the BeU as a budget Android Go phone that can run apps without needing heavy hardware. Which is why you get 2GB RAM but the built-in Unisoc chipset fares below expectations, even at this price. Having said that, you do get a large screen with HD+ resolution that can be used for watching videos. Having multiple rear cameras is always a bonus at the price, and you get a decent selfie camera too. However, the battery life could have been better.

Samsung Galaxy M02s is another affordable offering from the brand. The device targets budget-conscious consumers that come with decent specifications. However, the device packs decent specifications such as a tall 6.5-inches display, 5000mAh battery, and expandable memory support of up to 1TB. The poor camera configuration, lack of fingerprint sensor and USB Type-C port are its drawbacks.

Lava Z6 packs a big screen, with MediaTek Helio chipset for performance. It's a big plus to have the phone with 6GB RAM that guarantees decent multi-tasking usage, and quick app loading time. The triple rear cameras offer dynamism, with focus on photos on different angles. The phone runs on stock Android 10 that comes bloatware-free. The large capacity battery ensures decent backup. All in all, the Z6 has a lot going for it.

Realme C12 is another big screen device with promise of long backup. The phone uses Helio G35 to generate power and help you with basic computing needs. It get 4GB RAM with 64GB onboard storage for the price and you have Android 10 OS from the word go. It also has triple rear cameras to meet your photography demands. Having said that, phone only gets HD+ screen quality, packs a hefty design and only uses microUSB 2.0 port for charging.

Micromax 1N 128GB is yet another affordable brand from the Indian brand. The phone packs impressive specifications at the price range. The device sports a 6.67-inches IPS LCD with a resolution of 1080 x 2400 pixels. The phone comes powered by a MediaTek Helio G80 processor paired with 6GB RAM and 128GB internal storage (further expandable up to 256GB using a microSD card). It packs impressive triple rear cameras consisting of a 48MP macro camera, a 2MP macro camera, and a 2MP depth camera. Upfront, there is an 8MP selfie camera that also aids in video calling. The phone relies on a 5000mAh battery with 18W fast-charging for power backup. As for the cons, the device is bulky (195 grams) and difficult to operate with a single hand. Also, it runs Android v10 (Q) operating system rather than the latest Android v(11) operating system.

Tecno Spark 7 64GB is a budget-friendly smartphone and comes with decent specifications under the hood. The device features a steady RAM configuration and has an internal memory of 64GB with expandable storage support of up to 256GB using a memory card.  The phone comes fueled by the massive 6000mAh battery for seamless operation throughout the day. The device has a fingerprint sensor for security. Overall, the device offers value for money features at this price segment.

Lava Z2s runs on Android Go version which makes it a hard-core budget device with 2GB RAM on board. It comes powered by octa-core chipset but everything else about this phone is strictly average. You get single cameras on both sides. The display does come with Corning Gorilla Glass 3 protection which is rare at this price. And even the 5,000mAh battery should last you for a while. Worth skipping if you need a budget phone because better options out there.

Lava Z2 3GB RAM comes with 32GB storage, features a notch display with support for HD+ resolution. The hardware performance is good for the price, and the cameras as well do a good job. The battery life is decent as well and you can charge it through USB Type C port. Decent budget option for buyers.

MarQ M3 Smart is a basic phone meant for those who are new to smartphones. It packs an octa-core processor with 2GB RAM, offers expandable storage, and sports a large 6-inch HD+ screen. The single rear camera is good for the price, and so is the battery life. However, the phone's performance is average, only has microUSB port for charging and the front camera is basic. Better to buy other budget options.

mobile_name: Intex Aqua Lions T1 Lite VR

expert_view: The I Kall Z7 Ultra is an entry-level device from I Kall. The smartphone gets a seamless performance to its price. The device comprises 4GB RAM and 32GB of internal storage with an option to expand internal storage. The smartphone has decent cameras on the front and the rear.

Samsung's new Galaxy A03 64GB phone underwhelms for its price tag. It sports an HD+ display with a notch. The hardware is basic but you do get 4GB RAM with this variant. The storage is expandable, the main camera does well, but the others are strictly average. The battery life is good but charging support is slow.

The Lava Z6 128GB gives a good performance, thanks to the MediaTek Helio G35 chipset and 6GB LPDDR4X RAM. The impressive features like expandable storage, massive battery, and Stock Android v10 (Q) OS are included in the smartphone.

I Kall Z1Pro is an appropriate option if you are searching for an entry-level device with impressive operational specs. Considering its price, the I Kall Z1 Pro gets an impressive set of cameras on both sides, 32GB internal storage, and 4GB RAM for daily operations. Also, the brand lets you make a choice between grey and sky blue variants.

The I Kall K435 New is an entry-level smartphone that comes with some pretty standard specifications. The handset offers 4GB of RAM, which is a good thing. Moreover, the phone comes with a large display that makes it good for everyday usage. However, the phone runs on a dated Android version and comes with an unknown chipset, which makes it difficult to determine how well will it perform.

The I Kall Z14 is a regular option in this price range. The phone has an intriguing design language, but the rest of the specs are very conventional for this price range. So, if you're looking for an entry-level smartphone, be sure to look at other possibilities that provide a far more modern version of Android.

The I Kall Z11 brings some standard features and specifications in this entry-level segment. The phone has a dated design and some common characteristics of this price range. Some of the highlights include a large display, expandable storage, and a 20MP rear camera. On the downside, it provides a dated Android operating system, weak performance, and unknown chipset. So, if you are searching for an entry-level model, it is recommended that you first evaluate the competitors before choosing this model.

The I Kall Z12 is yet another option from the company in this entry-level segment. The phone packs a dated design and offers some standard specifications in this price segment. You get a tall display, expandable storage, 20MP rear camera which are some of the highlights. However, if you are looking for an entry-level model, it is advised to check for the competition first before opting for this model.
